Job Summary: Ansys is seeking to hire two (2) interns/co-ops for our Cloud and Platform Business Unit (CPBU).  This business unit is located in Waterloo, ON. Ideal candidates for internship would be Computer Science, or related majors with experience in application development, support, or testing.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities

Complete tasks within a CI/CD development process. 

Contribute to planning and design meetings, perform implementation and maintenance of multiple product modules. 

Perform complex bug verification, unit testing, and release testing. Research and develop solutions to problems discovered by QA or product support 

Understand market and customer needs, and research new technologies or development tools to ensure that the product satisfies the requirements and performs well. 

Candidate will be given tasks according to team needs and aptitudes. 

There may be additional testing and test automation work as well as application development support.

Required Skills/Qualifications:

Be 3rd or 4th year students in computer science or a related discipline 

Interested in learning more about user management and e-commerce systems  

Motivated, self-disciplined, and able to learn quickly

Job Summary:
We are looking for passionate, motivated software engineering interns who are excited to build their experience as they develop tools to power the next generation of cloud applications. We are hiring for a variety of roles, including:
 

Distributed systems
Machine learning
Frontend
Observability
Production serving
Ecosystem
C++
Reinforcement Learning

About Anyscale: 

Anyscale provides an application development platform for developers to build distributed applications. We're commercializing a popular open source project called Ray, which is a framework for distributed computing as well as an ecosystem of libraries for scalable machine learning. Our goal is to build a standardized platform for distributed computing. Ray was developed at UC Berkeley by Robert Nishihara and Philipp Moritz, under the guidance of Ion Stoica and Michael Jordan, and the four of them have co-founded Anyscale. The company raised a $20.6M Series A and a $40M Series B funding from Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), NEA, Foundation Capital, Intel Capital, Ant Financial, Amplify Partners, 11.2 Capital, and The House Fund. 


With Ray, we're making it easy to program at any scale (from your laptop to the datacenter) by providing easy-to-use, general-purpose, and high-performance tools. In addition, we are building a rich ecosystem of libraries (for reinforcement learning, hyperparameter search, experiment management, machine learning training, prediction serving, and more) on top of the core distributed system so that users can rapidly build sophisticated applications. Help us build the future of software development.
Job Responsibilities:
As part of this role, you will:

 

Develop high quality software to empower software developers and simplify programming
Work with a team of leading distributed systems and machine learning experts
Communicate your work to a broader audience through talks, tutorials, and blog posts
Help us to build and shape a world class company
Required Skills:
We'd love to hear from you if you:

 

Are passionate about machine learning and distributed systems
Are interested in working at a startup and making an impact
Have relevant software engineering internship experiences at tech companies 
Have side projects that showcase their passion for programming outside of the classroom setting 
Are a at least a rising junior

Targeted Clusters

Job Summary:
In this role, you will work with the company's directors, and managers to accelerate recruitment digital advertising for growing the Anytime Fitness Coaching brand. We are in the business of Making Healthy Happen and as a Talent Recruiter, you will work to grow our team and strengthen digital onboarding processes. 

  

The Talent Recruiter generates, aggregates and develops recruitment content for Anytime Fitness Coaching, including but not limited to websites posts, social media posts, and hireology. This role will focus on developing digital recruitment and virtual onboarding. They will work to develop a strong virtual training process and onboarding procedures.
Job Responsibilities:
Continuing to develop onboarding and training materials using our in-house videographer.
Maximize our online training system by organizing, structuring, populating, and creating onboarding content.
Hold first phase interviews and review applications for all. 
Update website, and social media recruiting positioning.
Support marketing team in developing employment brand strategies and utilizing video and photography content
Pull analytics and prepare reports on a regular basis.
Develop a monthly content calendar. Work with other members of the team to populate and ensure content is posted.
Promote the consistent use of brand guidelines to management and monitor all social media regularly.
Attend philanthropy events and other activities as required to assist with social media, and photography as needed.

Job Summary:
Legal Secretary/Paralegals Internship "Remote Working" Program 

  

We are looking for a talented and capable Legal Secretary to join our growing Residential Conveyancing and Business Development teams for our UK office. Your responsibility will be to support Heads of Department for both teams. The work is mixed and encompasses a range of Mitigation and non-contentious matters. 

  

Our Residential Conveyancing team deals with all aspects of sale, purchase, remortgage and transfer of equity matters. 

  

Our Business Development team deals with onboarding new client's, converting the possible conveyancing leads into confirmed business and follow up on new enquiries. 

  

You will provide secretarial support in a timely and effective way. You will need to demonstrate that you are organised, can work well under pressure, communicate effectively in person, on the telephone and via email, and above all be a team player who can contribute to the success of the teams. Your duties will include: 
 

Producing letters, emails and documents for Conveyancing Team
Answering telephone calls and dealing with enquiries
Diary management
Creating and maintaining electronic files
Creating and maintaining internal systems and procedures
Clear and on time communication in dealing with given tasks
Recogniose, respect and honour client confidentiality at all times
Take detailed and accurate information from enuiries
Maintain a professional attitude and effective communications between clients, fee earners, team members and colleagues

 The ideal candidate will demonstrate: 

 

Previous legal secretarial experience, if any
Fast, accurate copy typing
Attention to detail
Excellent communication and organisational skills
Being both confident and empathetic whilst maintaining high levels of professionalism 
Ability to prioritise work and meet strict timescales
Competence in Word, Excel, Outlook, and Adobe
Ability to work on own initiative and independently, but also to follow instruction.

 You will receive full support and training from your team leaders, and you will also acquire extensive knowledge of both departments. This is a remote working program. 

  

This is an excellent opportunity to learn and progress a career within law.

Job Summary:
Startup Culture, Creative Freedom, and Lots of Learning.  If that sounds appealing, then it's the perfect opportunity for you to combine your engineering theories, creativity, and design ability to become the Engineer you are striving to be! 


AOMS is a fast growing, scaling start-up and we are looking for a creative and entrepreneurial Product Developer Engineer to join our Toronto office. You will work directly within the Engineering R&D team as well as collaborate with Marketing and Production team on a daily basis to help execute our product vision. 


AOMS is a truly welcoming space. We encourage you to come up with new ideas and take ownership of your projects that will create a real impact on growing the business. 


Your opportunity at a glance:

Be a part of IoT revolution using cutting edge sensor technologies
A fun, collaborative, and creative environment
An opportunity to learn and grow with the team
A startup backed by major industry players

About AOMS Technologies:

Our vision is to revolutionize the Industrial IoT world with advanced sensing technologies. 


We believe in a world of highly connected network of devices providing insightful analytics for stakeholders, customers, and users alike. We are backed by leading industrial investors and are looking for talented individuals like you to be part of our exciting growth phase.
Job Responsibilities:
About you:

You are passionate about building products. You are a hands-on person with a can-do attitude who is creative and is not afraid of getting your ideas challenged. You have a solid understanding of engineering concepts and are relentless about designing better products, be it a school project or a side project. You want to explore how to synergize your skills and experience in a high-tech startup environment to produce amazing results. You are always working to improve and grow, and you have a proven track record of execution. 


Responsibilities:

Build prototype using desktop CNC machine (we have a Shapeoko XL), 3D printer (we have a FormLabs Form 2), and various machine tools
Design electrical schematic, PCB layout, and firmware
Design test jig and fixture for sensor characterization and automated testing
Develop the validation test requirements for new and existing products and oversee the execution of test plans
Execute detailed mechanical design activities including simulation analysis, CAD modelling, prototyping, validation, design improvement and documentation etc., to deliver awesome products that are innovative, reliable, and easy to manufacture.
Lead tasks relating to drafting specifications, RFQ, and supply chain coordination
Coordinate with suppliers to develop work plans and prepare bill of materials
Create sensor test and calibration report
Research, evaluate, and recommend systems/equipment/technologies and innovative ideas for future products
Required Skills:
Our ideal candidate:

Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree in Mechatronics, Systems, Mechanical, or Electrical Engineering
Experienced with CAD modelling - SolidWorks, SolidWorks PDM
Experienced with FEA Simulation - Solidworks Simulation
Proficient with prototyping - machining, 3D printing, etc
Proficient with electronics, PCB schematic capture, PCB layout
Hands-on: able to use solder electrical components, assemble component into an enclosure, hacking hardware systems using hand tools
Experienced with Python or C++
Experienced with Linux operating system
Knowledge in version control software - Git
Familiar with wireless technology such as Bluetooth, Zigbee, LoRa, Sigfox, etc
Can-do attitude, self-driven and proactive, with an entrepreneurial spirit
Ability to prioritize workload and handle multiple tasks simultaneously
Strong verbal/written communications skills with demonstrated ability to clearly document experimental procedures and results
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail
Strong aptitude in mechanical and electrical systems
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Aon is looking for a Health and Benefits - Actuarial Analyst, Co-op for Winter 2022


As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of our Health and Benefits Consulting business group within Aon, in Ontario.

Our Colleague Experience: 

  

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day.  They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another.  This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience. 


About Aon: 

Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance. 

  

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test.  You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position. 

  

Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status.  Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer.

Job Summary: Providing assistance to Stability Coordinators by ensuring that samples received for the QC Stability program are stored and scheduled for testing appropriately, which includes labelling, and removal of stability samples.
Job Responsibilities:
Provide support in data analysis and execution of tasks related to the Stability Reduction Initiative for the QC Stability and QC Laboratory departments.
Ensure that all samples received are logged correctly and accurately into Labware LIMS and stored in the appropriate stability chamber in a timely fashion.
Create Labware LIMS protocols to control the testing of the stability samples and ensure that all the appropriate storage conditions and time points are included in the protocols.
Import initial testing data and/or perform manual entry, as well as, sending samples to the QC laboratory for initial testing.
On a weekly basis, or as required, pull samples from the stability chambers and send to the QC laboratory for testing, and as well, perform weekly folder checks.
Maintain detailed and accurate records of all sample movement and update inventory records accordingly.
Run monthly inventory report in Labware LIMS and perform monthly inventory checks.
Perform monthly inventory checks on controlled substances and provide illicit values to the site QPICs.
Run disposal report in Labware LIMS and dispose of Stability samples for completed studies.
Place requisition orders for batches from inventory control, when required.
Prepare samples for shipment in accordance with established Apotex procedures, regulatory, and safety procedures to internal and external customers.
Provide weekly status updates to the Supervisor, QC Stability.
Works as an effective team member to meet department goals, sharing knowledge with team members and across QC.
Monitor training progress and ensure all training gaps are completed within MyHR for Documents, GMP, Safety, Technical and Software courses.
Performs all work in compliance with our Code of Conduct and Business Ethics, and related policies and with the legal and regulatory requirements that apply to our job activities.
Work as a member of a team to achieve all quality/compliance outcomes.
Operates in accordance with our Code of Conduct and Business Ethics, and all established regulatory, compliance and safety requirements.
Performs all work in support of our Values: Collaboration, Courage, Perseverance, and Passion.

All other relevant duties as assigned
Required Skills:
Experience:

Scientific background in laboratory analysis of solid or liquid dosage forms is recommended.
Enrolled in a post-secondary recognized educational institution in Chemistry, Biology, Pharmaceutical and/or Health Sciences.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

 Theoretical knowledge of ICH Guidelines as it pertains to Commercial Stability.
Understanding of GMP and GLP guidelines and related SOPs and their application to a laboratory setting.
Scientific background in laboratory analysis of solid or liquid dosage forms is recommended.
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.
Ability to handle multiple work assignments and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Well balanced interpersonal skills.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Student Coordinator - Safety, Health and Environment
Job Summary:
Assist members of the Safety, Health and Environment (SHE) team in functions related to areas of safety, health and environment.  This work will involve interaction with a variety of personnel at each of the 3 pharmaceutical manufacturing sites. 

A Day in the Life… 

The opportunity to work with a team of Safety, Health and Environment professionals and get exposure to various areas within the department (e.g. Environment, industrial hygiene, training, risk assessments, safe work procedures etc.)  Each day is unique and never routine. There will be office work (administration), and project based work with some exposure to the production floor and/or lab environment.  This role may require some travel between the 3 pharmaceutical sites (Etobicoke, Signet, Richmond Hill) within the GTA however, the main location will be at the Signet campus (any other travel requirements will be accommodated).
Job Responsibilities:
Along with the Environmental Associate, assist with the creation of the chemical inventory in Excel which is the basis for Apotex's environmental regulatory submissions (NPRI, Chemical Weapons, and Chemtrac).
Assist in the preparation of all necessary compliance submissions
Assist the Global EHS director in the preparation of materials (presentations, graphs, etc.) that will analyze safety performance at the global sites.
Assist the Environmental team in performing environmental management system duties, including specific projects as assigned. (e.g. Government submissions, risk assessments, waste audits).
Assist in the planning and execution of employee engagement activities related to the environment (e.g. Earth Week, Bike to Work, People Power Challenge, Waste Reduction Week, Apo-Green newsletter).
Develop/revise Safe Work Procedures to support corporate safety policies.
Assist the Coordinator, SHE Hazard Information prepare SDSs and WHMIS related documentation.
Work on defined projects that support worker safety or environmental compliance.
All other duties as assigned
Required Skills:
Must be enrolled in a recognized post-secondary Co-op education program (e.g. Occupational Health & Safety, Chemical or Environmental Engineering, Environmental Science or Business etc.)
Prior experience in an industrial manufacturing environment would be an asset.
Basic Knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety Act or Environmental regulations.
Excellent written and verbal skills.
Strong computer skills in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Second, third or fourth year Occupational Safety and Health student or Environmental engineering/science student preferred.

Job Summary:
appficiency Inc.

Our purpose is to drive business transformations on the cloud. Our shared values help us achieve our purpose and consistently work towards being the best at what we do. We strive to act with principle, learn together, inspire innovation, and deliver value. We are a fast-paced entrepreneurial company with an initiative to emerge as an industry leader on the NetSuite ERP platform. 


As an Oracle NetSuite Alliance Partner, our team works together to bring exceptional industry leading professional services on the NetSuite ERP platform to clients all over North-America from our growing international network of offices. 


Our Culture

appficiency understands that our greatest strength is our people. We always put our talented people first and invests heavily in seeking diverse backgrounds. We then challenges them with the best opportunities to learn, innovate and lead, more than they could elsewhere. We combine advice with action to develop experts that are knowledgeable and passionate about what they do. appficiency is committed to developing a culture built on integrity and collaboration and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. In addition, as part of our growing global network, there are opportunities to work with international teams and clients, or even help lead our global expansion. 


NetSuite Consulting: What We Do

We realize that to maximize value for our clients we need to deliver the best advice and technological solutions unique to their business needs. As part of our team you'll be at the forefront of new initiatives and best practices as we continue to help businesses grow and thrive on the cloud. 


We work with clients to define their IT needs, and show them how to get there. We provide technological solutions and support that enterprise's need to improve their performance and better compete in the market. Whether our clients are looking for a focused change initiative or a full-scale enterprise transformation, our team delivers IT solutions that help create a sustainable competitive advantage. 


What You'll Do

We have already been recognized for being the best at what we do, but we are working hard to do even better and that all starts with you. We are a rapidly growing company at the intersection of business and technology which requires entrepreneurial tenacity, motivation to learn, and enterprise building initiative. 


No matter your role, you'll be an integral member of the team, focusing on engagements of varying sizes and across diverse industries. In our progressive environment, the projects you work on will drive your learning and accelerate your business acumen and technical expertise. 


Our operations team is a key part of our business that ensures that everything is set in place to guarantee the successful delivery of all projects by providing the technology tools that all team members use on a day to day basis. 


Our Strategic Business Consultants work across the NetSuite service delivery lifecycle to design, build, test, and implement multiple system components. Professionals in this role will be challenged to leverage the knowledge of application development, business and accounting, and streamlined operations to technically build custom solutions for our clients. 


Start Your Future With Us

At appficiency we believe in career paths with no ceiling. We are invested in helping our people to grow professionally with industry leading opportunities to build up your technical expertise and leadership abilities, all while having exposure to enterprise building decision making. You will start by learning a complex ERP software package that will reward you with in demand expertise you can take anywhere in multiple roles and industries. 


appficiency will provide you the best environment to learn as we believe in teaching rather than telling, developing you through shadowing, lessons learned, observation and feedback. Regardless of your interests or skills set, there is ample opportunity to be involved in improving our current practice, or leading something new- our goal is to create a career path that matters to you.
Job Responsibilities:
The Operations Co-op will organize and coordinate office administration and procedures in order to ensure organizational effectiveness, efficiency and safety 


Responsibilities

Monthly invoicing support, Accounts Payable including supplier invoice entry, reconciliation and payments, Accounts Receivable.
Manage relationships with vendors, service providers and building management, ensuring that all items are invoiced and paid on time.
Troubleshooting video conference and computer equipment, as well as organize/manage collaboration tools such as G-Suite, 1Password and Zoom.
Provide support to the HR department by posting job descriptions in different online platforms.
Be comfortable working with senior executives regularly.
Become an expert on the NetSuite and other on-line collaboration applications.
Required Skills:
Who Are We Looking For?

We are looking for an energetic candidate who doesn't mind wearing multiple hats, someone who is a self starter, has initiative and is resourceful when delivering solutions to any given challenge.
Experienced in handling a wide range of administrative and executive support related tasks and able to work independently with little or no supervision.
Well organized, flexible and enjoy the administrative challenges of supporting an office of diverse people.

Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Analytical, attention to detail and problem solving skills.
Knowledge of accounting, data and administrative management practices and procedures as well as bookkeeping experience.
Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment and deal with changing priorities.
Experience in IT, software, or specific business models such as distribution, manufacturing, professional services, retail, media & advertising, or finance.
Familiarity with cloud computing technologies.
Experience with ERP, CRM, or e-commerce applications.
Troubleshooting video conference issues, system errors, fix and update software on video conference systems.

We have already been recognized for being the best at what we do, but we are working hard to do even better, and that all starts with you. We are a rapidly growing company at the intersection of business and technology which requires entrepreneurial tenacity, motivation to learn, and enterprise building initiative. 

  

No matter your role, you'll be an integral member of the team, focusing on engagements of varying sizes and across diverse industries. In our progressive environment, the projects you work on will drive your learning and accelerate your business acumen and technical expertise. 


Our Strategic Business Consultants work across the NetSuite service delivery lifecycle to design, build, test, and implement multiple system components. Professionals in this role will be challenged to leverage the knowledge of application development, business and accounting, and streamlined operations to technically build custom solutions for our clients.
 

Be the primary consultant on 3-5 clients at any time for whom you are their primary systems expert, business advisor, and chief driver of process efficiencies.
Be comfortable working with senior executives regularly.
Become an expert on the NetSuite application.
Work closely with appficiency leaders to deliver client projects.
Work directly with customers to understand, validate, and document their business requirements and map them to NetSuite functionality.
Solution delivery responsibilities include, but are not limited to: requirements gathering, design, documentation, implementation, testing, and user training.
Required Skills:
Who are we looking for?

We are looking for business and technology smarts; driven and hard-working individuals; and savvy communicators.  
Those who can deliver real business recommendations along with expert software knowledge to senior customer executives.
Consultants that can manage a room, quickly configure and navigate software, and ultimately make satisfied repeat and referenceable customers.

Qualifications/Skills

Currently enrolled in a Canadian post-secondary institution with a focus in computer science, software engineering, or a related discipline.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment and deal with changing priorities.
Experience in consulting, IT, software, or specific business models such as distribution, manufacturing, professional services, retail, media & advertising, or finance.
Familiarity with cloud computing technologies.
Experience with ERP, CRM, or e-commerce applications.

Job Summary:
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. The people here at Apple don't just build products - they build the kind of wonder that's revolutionized entire industries. It's the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. 


Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. In this highly visible role, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on Apple Products, and leave a footprint for years to come. We have an opportunity for an accomplished quality engineer to lead development, and ramp for a next generation Apple product from both dimensional and cosmetic perspective. 


Our Operations team ensures that Apple's ground breaking designs become industry-leading products, delivered on time and on spec. This high profile, highly respected organization is positioned at the junction of Apple's product teams, the industries that supply core component technologies, and our manufacturing partners who help ensure that products such as iPad, iPhone and Mac can be restocked just as fast as they fly off the shelves! We're looking for high-energy people to support the procurement, manufacturing, fulfillment and support of all things Apple.
Job Responsibilities:
Some of the responsibilities in Manufacturing Engineering may include: 


MANUFACTURING DESIGN ENGINEER 

As an MDE, you will handle selection, implementation & optimization of manufacturing processes for mechanical enclosure subassemblies for our legendary products. Utilize Mechanical Engineering experience and work cross functionally with Product Design Engineering and Industrial Design Assess product features for manufacturability, and recommend capable processes and equipment. Developing new manufacturing processes to enable future product design and conducting DOEs to validate process capability. Work with Global Supplier Managers to identify capable suppliers, assess their secondary processes for capacity, quality and cost. Work with suppliers to define and refine mechanical tooling, fixtures and establish capability / readiness. Audit supplier processes and assembly processes and support product phase builds from EVT, DVT PVT and ramp. Assist post production quality / cost improvement activity related to fixtures and processes. 


MANUFACTURING QUALITY ENGINEER 

As an MQE, you will utilize Engineering, Factory Management & Supply Chain skills in developing and implementing high efficiency inspection equipment, groundbreaking quality systems and ultimately the best products available. Help lead the creation of state of the art inspection & measurement equipment for Apple product. Apply your understanding of quality control and manufacturing concepts to lead the development of specific Product Quality Plans (PQP) appropriate to program and commodity. Provide technical direction and mentorship to other Quality Engineers supporting the implementation of the PQP. Identify and direct studies to implement improvements in measuring method where appropriate. Coordinate Quality Engineering functions for multiple programs in the product category. Collaborate with internal and external groups to ensure accurate definition of quality expectations and appropriate assurance techniques are used for the product. 

Supplier Quality Management - Assist in supplier selection process for new products and sourcing activities. Assess supplier production control and quality programs, identify shortfalls to expectations, and directly secure agreement to correct. Supervise each supplier's performance through measurement of production line statistics, company inspections, and audits. 


SUBJECT MATTER AUTHORITY 

Our SME's investigate and develop solutions to overcome difficult technical challenges that require non-standard manufacturing approaches. Apply your engineering skills to develop an in depth understanding of the process drivers that will drive successful implementation of significant improvements to mechanical enclosures. The following activities fall within the scope of responsibilities: Assess mechanical designs and relate design goals to process, equipment, and material requirements to evaluate a set of options to tackle difficult manufacturing problems. Research manufacturing processes and evaluate them for potential to achieve technical goals. Plan and execute development trials to test feasibility, optimize process inputs, and validate capabilities of process options. Present analysis to key decision makers used to make significant commercial and design commitments
Required Skills:
You may meet or have interest in any one of the following qualifications: 

Experience in a hands-on manufacturing environment. 

Experience developing quality plans, validating test methods and gauges, and driving corrective actions / failure analysis efforts. 

Knowledge of quality and reliability concepts, supplier management, and general manufacturing operations. 

Project management experience and a deep understanding of problem solving tools including design of experiments, root cause analysis and statistical process control principles preferred. 

Experience with: mechanical enclosures, casings, plastic parts, injection molding, tooling, jigs, fixtures, or automotive high volume quality manufacturing engineering. 

Understanding of GD&T Geometric Design & Tolerance, as well as statistics. 

Understanding of mechanical properties of materials as they relate to manufacturing requirements 

Understanding of DOE principles 

Extraordinary interpersonal skills - verbal, written and executive presentations
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering

Job Summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, extraordinary ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple's University Recruiting team is looking for a highly motivated, engineering students with a strong background in Back-End Engineering, Core OS, and Web Development to join its team of highly skilled software engineers. Our software engineers are the brains behind some of the industry's biggest breakthroughs! OS X, Siri, Apple Maps, and iCloud - not to mention the system-level software for iPhone and Apple TV - all started here. These teams are on the front line of our constant charge toward innovation! We are actively seeking enthusiastic interns who can work full-time for a minimum of 12-weeks.
Job Responsibilities:
Some responsibilities in Hardware or Silicon Engineering may include: 


Backend Development - Making the features that Apple users love (like Siri) work by presenting data to the user-facing applications. Backend development opportunities are available for students in the following areas: 


Siri, iCloud, Apple Maps, Core OS, OS X, Frameworks and Applications, Interactive Media Group, Audio/Video Software Integration and Localization, Advanced Computation, iLife, iWorks, Aperture, Pro Apps, iTunes, Security, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) and Platform Infrastructure Engineering (PIE) 


Core OS - The Core OS team is responsible for the design and development of core technologies that are deployed across all Apple product areas including the iPhone, iPad, Watch, MacBook, iMac, Apple TV, and audio accessories. (Yes, that's pretty much everything.) 


Web Development - Help build web-based tools and applications to improve our products and do more for our customers. Our developers are responsible for crafting the direction of our products by considering the architecture, performance, testing, design, and implementation. And of course we look for engineers that use our products. 


Engineers at Apple work on both UI level and lower-level implementation details. The successful intern candidate will be amenable to working in a dynamic, collaborative environment. The person filling this position must be a hands-on, enthusiastic, self-motivated developer with strong initiative and desire to succeed in a challenging environment. You will have a real passion for extraordinary user experiences and an eye for details. Those applying for the Web Development intern position should include a link to a web portfolio.
Required Skills:
You may meet or have interest in any one of the following qualifications: 

Strong object-oriented design skills, coupled with a deep knowledge of data structures and algorithms 

Proficiency in one or more of the following developer skills: Java, C/C++, PHP, Python, Ruby, Unix, MySQL, Clojure, Scala, Java Script, CSS, HTML5 

Experience in sophisticated methodologies such as Data Modeling, Validation, Processing, Hadoop, MapReduce, Mongo, Pig 

Experience with web frameworks such as AngularJS, NodeJS, SproutCore 

Proven experience in application development in Objective-C for OS X or iOS a plus 

Client-Server protocol & API design Skills 

Able to craft multi-functional requirements and translate them into practical engineering tasks 

A fundamental knowledge of embedded processors, with in-depth knowledge of real time operating system concepts. 

Excellent debugging and critical thinking skills 

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills 

Ability to work in a fast paced, team-based environment

Job Summary: Apple is seeking highly qualified people for the position of AI/ML Engineer and AI/ML Researcher. The team pursues research & development in the areas of machine learning (ML) with particular focus on deep learning (DL), computer vision (CV), Natural Language Processing (NLP), optimization, and reinforcement learning (RL). As a member of the team, you will work on some of the most ambitious technical problems, develop new ML solutions that will impact future Apple products, and collaborate with the best product teams to integrate your ideas into products. In addition, you will engage with the academic community by publishing your innovative research, and speaking at conferences and events.
Job Responsibilities:
Some responsibilities in AI/ML may include: 

You will research and develop innovative ML strategies for challenging problems that will affect future Apple products. You will collaborate with broader teams across Apple to transfer AI/ML solutions. You will have opportunities to provide technical mentorship and guidance and prepare technical reports for publication and conference talks. You are self-motivated, excellent problem solver, a go-getter. You are quick to build relationships and work well with change and ambiguity. You have strong programming skills with tried experience crafting, prototyping, and delivering advanced algorithmic solutions.
Required Skills:
You may meet or have interest in any one of the following qualifications:  

In-depth expertise in deep learning (DL) and statistical machine learning (ML) 

Expertise in one or more of CV, NLP, optimization, RL, time series, generative models, signals, pattern recognition fields, and/or computer graphics fields 

Strong publication record demonstrating innovative research 

Good presentation skills 

Passionate about building extraordinary products 

Excellent programming skills in Java, Python, C/C++, CUDA or other GPGPU is a plus 

Knowledge of common ML frameworks 

Expected to perform well in a fast-paced environment, to execute on the tasks assigned, to meet the production deadlines and, at the same time, to explore independently new innovative ideas that can improve and transform the product experience of Apple customers 

Be able to deliver ML technologies aligned with the core values of Apple, ensuring the highest standards of quality, scientific rigor, innovation, and respect for user privacy 

Creative, collaborative, & product focused 


Education: 

Pursuing PhD, Masters, or Bachelors degree in Machine Learning, Human Computer Interaction, Natural Language Processing, Robotics, Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or related areas.

Job Summary:
At Applied Brain Research (www.AppliedBrainResearch.com) we develop software and build AI applications using neuromorphic methods and hardware. We integrate cutting edge machine learning with neural engineering methods we developed over two decades of research. Our fifteen person team works with world leading industrial partners and has early access to technology to develop the next generation of computational hardware.

We are looking for help developing and optimizing new deep neural network applications, and exploring implementation on high-efficiency hardware. Projects include novel methods for scene understanding, cutting-edge wearable technology, and expanded applications of our state-of-the-art recurrent neural network architecture, the Legendre Memory Unit (LMU).
Job Responsibilities: Responsibilities include collecting and processing data, developing network architectures, and running training/hyperparameter optimization processes.
Required Skills:
Required:
- Experience training deep learning models
- Experience with Python deep learning packages (TensorFlow or PyTorch)
Preferred:
- Experience working as part of a collaborative software team (e.g., working with git/github)

About ApplyBoard

ApplyBoard is an online platform that empowers students around the world to access the best education. Founded in 2015, ApplyBoard has grown to become the world's largest online platform for international student recruitment, assisting more than 100,000 students with their educational journey.  

  

By connecting international students, recruitment partners, and educational institutions, we simplify the study abroad search, application, and acceptance process through our platform and services. Our Team

Our team of over 1000+ ApplyBoardians (and growing!) is just as diverse as the customers we support. Comprising 27 nationalities, 53 languages spoken, and 50/50 gender parity, diversity is fostered and celebrated on our team. The ApplyBoard headquarters is located in Kitchener, ON Canada, with representatives in 20 countries including India, Bangladesh, Nepal, Pakistan, Vietnam, the Philippines, the United Kingdom, Mexico, Brazil, and China. 

  

The Role

We are looking for an experienced, well connected, organized and International Recruitment Manager to join our growing Sales team and take our company and platform to the next level!

Job Summary:
We're building a movement - an education revolution. 

We're building a world where anyone, anywhere can have access to the best education regardless of where they were born. At our core, we believe education is a right, not a privilege. To that end, we're building a company and a suite of products to lead the charge in transforming access to education. 


ApplyBoard is an online platform that empowers students around the world to access the best education by connecting international students, recruitment partners, and academic institutions. We simplify the study abroad search, application, and acceptance process. Not only do we help students with their study abroad journey, but we also help academic institutions to find the best students globally. Our goal is to help enable better, more diverse, schools that are enriched with cultures from all over the world. 


The Role

As a product co-op, you play an important role in supporting the Product team and will be responsible for assisting a product manager to increase user engagement within our Recruitment Partner Journey domain. You will work closely with a world-class cross functional team to support the full product lifecycle, from problem identification to product launch.  Our product co-ops  are passionate about the intersection of user need, design and technology with a knack for simplifying complex problems into elegant solutions that ship!  


While learning our product process, you will have the opportunity to develop your professional skills and contribute your ideas to projects. Your work will touch the lives of students all over the world as they embark on their journeys to achieve their education dreams! 


Life at ApplyBoard - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E6PkwawTJm0&feature=emb_logo
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll be doing every day:

Working with prospects, customers and the market at large to drive primary research, discovery, insight and recommendations for definition around the Recruitment Partner Engagement domain's roadmap initiatives
Understanding, defining and communicating user personas and use cases, understanding user workflows, and articulating the needs of users - you are the customer and user expert
Collaborating with a product manager to help prioritize and define an evolving product roadmap
Connecting across the product, design, dev and QA teams to effectively bring these stories to life within the product offering
Coordinating product releases and product lifecycle changes with marketing, sales, operations and support teams
Required Skills:
Preferred Qualifications:

Working towards a degree in a field such as business, interaction design, HCI, Industrial Design, Engineering or related discipline
Familiarity with concepts related to the product development life cycle
Familiarity with concepts related to Agile (e.g. SCRUM and Kanban) methodologies
Experience with making data-driven decisions; experience using tools such as Google Analytics, Amplitude, Mixpanel, Looker, or equivalent is preferred
Excellent communication (verbal, written) and overall project/stakeholder management skills
A team player but with the ability to work independently too
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Project and Process Management
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences

Job Summary:
Aquafor Beech Limited is a Canadian company, incorporated in 1990, with offices in Mississauga, Guelph and Kingston.  The firm provides multidisciplinary engineering and environmental services to a variety of public and private sector clients.  The firm's principal focus is on watershed planning, environmental restoration, fluvial geomorphology, stormwater management, environmental assessment/permitting, water resources engineering and municipal infrastructure design.  Typical projects include the following: 
 

Detailed engineering designs for stream restoration, storm and sanitary sewer replacement, culvert and bridge replacements, and road reconstruction applying Low Impact Development technologies.
Watershed and subwatershed studies, Class Environmental Assessments and Environmental Impact Assessments.
Master Plans and retrofit studies for stormwater treatment, including Low Impact Development.
Environmental Monitoring (water quality, quantity, stream erosion and groundwater) including development of monitoring plans and protocols. 

Aquafor Beech Limited uses a multi-disciplinary approach to develop innovative and technically sound solutions to address project requirements.  The firm emphasizes individual initiative but promotes strong collaboration between staff members.  This unique approach has resulted in Aquafor Beech Limited becoming a leading firm in this field in Eastern Canada.  The firm provides exciting career opportunities by engaging in diverse projects, using interdisciplinary teams to address project requirements and providing ongoing training and professional development.  We have a friendly work environment that encourages employees to provide ideas, strive for excellence, and create new opportunities.
Job Responsibilities:
We are looking for a highly motivated individual with excellent analytical, technical and interpersonal skills to join our team.  


Key responsibilities include the following:
 

Field work, including topographic surveys
Development of detailed design drawings using AutoCAD Civil 3D and / or Microstation
Administrative tasks, including preparation of proposals and reports
Tender document preparation and contractor support services
Application of Federal, Provincial and Municipal regulation and standards
Assisting multi-disciplinary project teams to achieve project goals and deliverables
Advancing individual knowledge and experience in watershed and stormwater management, channel design/stream restoration, environmental monitoring, and applied geomorphology
Required Skills:
The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:
 

Proficient skills in mainstream computer applications such as MS Office
Proficiency in AutoCAD Civil3D or Microstation
University Candidate in Water Resources, Environmental and/or Civil Engineering
EIT Eligible
Experience in the planning, design and construction of civil and water resources projects
Strong project management skills with ability to adhere to project schedules and budgets
Valid Class G Drivers License and access to a personal vehicle is required

This is an excellent career opportunity for a candidate who is looking to advance their career by applying their knowledge of erosion control, stream restoration, and stormwater management to a variety of public and private sector projects as part of a multi-disciplinary professional team.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

- Ability to quickly grasp complex technical concepts and communicate them to the intended audience

Arctic Wolf, the leader in security operations, is a fast-growing company in an exciting and fast-growing industry Cybersecurity. About the Role: 

The Arctic Wolf security operations platform ingests and processes upwards of 150 billion events a day from a wide variety of on-premise devices and cloud platforms. The security pipeline is a distributed system of loosely-coupled microservices that constitute our real-time analysis and threat detection systems. These services distill the incoming events into actionable intelligence that our Concierge Security Teams use to protect customers.  

We are growing rapidly, with our data volume increasing ten-fold roughly every two years.  We are looking for developers to work with us to continuously evolve and expand the capabilities of our security platform.

Job Summary:
Ready to make an impact? Arctic Wolf is looking for a Software Developer - Analytics to join our pack. 


Arctic Wolf, fresh off its unicorn valuation, is the leader in security operations in an exciting and fast-growing industry - cybersecurity. How fast are we growing? Well, Arctic Wolf was highly ranked in the Deloitte Fast Technology 500 for North America in both 2019 (#25) and 2020 (#104)! We have doubled headcount, customers, and revenue for five years running. 


We are also cultivating a collaborative and productive work environment that welcomes a diversity of backgrounds and ideas to make our teams even stronger. In fact, we are recognized as one of the 2020 Best Places to Work (bizjournals.com). 


As we believe in corporate responsibility, Arctic Wolf offices across North America participate in volunteer programs throughout their communities. We've also earned distinction from TravelWise for our efforts in promoting sustainable transportation. 


About the Role:

As a Software Developer in the Analytics space, you'll work on the team that focusses on building the systems that allow for the storage and analysis of big data.  This telemetry data is collected from customers by leveraging endpoint, network, and cloud data sources both inside and outside our customers' networks.  Our team then builds products that allows our customers as well as our own employees to make business intelligence queries against this large set of data, to better understand their security posture. 


Our existing stack includes both custom built and open source components written in Java and Go, deployed within Amazon Web Services.  Some open source components we use include Metabase, Postgres, Apache Kafka, HazelCast, various open-source columnar databases, as well as custom application servers leveraging frameworks like Quarkus, Apache Samza, Apache Calcite, and Go.
Job Responsibilities:
The Software Developer - Analytics will fulfill these key responsibilities: 
 

Work alongside senior developers to help with the Implementation and design of new analytics products, taking customer requirements into account
Maintenance of our existing Java and Go based systems
Deployment and configuration of open source components
Required Skills:
Who You Are:

A tenacious developer excited about working in the big data space

Required Skills and Experience:

Experience or University courses with one of Java or Go
Interest of experience with SQL, relational databases (e.g. Postgres, MySQL, etc), or columnar and/or time-series databases (e.g. ClickHouse, Druid, InfluxDB, Prometheus, etc)

Employment Requirements:

Each successful candidate will be required to pass a criminal background check and an employment verification as a condition of employment.

Job Summary:
Ready to make and impact? Arctic Wolf seeks a Software Developer, co-op to join our pack.  


Arctic Wolf, fresh off its unicorn valuation, is the leader in security operations in an exciting and fast-growing industry - cybersecurity. How fast are we growing? Well, Arctic Wolf was highly ranked in the Deloitte Fast Technology 500 for North America in both 2019 (#25) and 2020 (#104)! We have doubled headcount, customers, and revenue for five years running. 

  

We are also cultivating a collaborative and productive work environment that welcomes a diversity of backgrounds and ideas to make our teams even stronger. In fact, we are recognized as one of the 2020 Best Places to Work (bizjournals.com). 

  

As we believe in corporate responsibility, Arctic Wolf offices across North America participate in volunteer programs throughout their communities. We've also earned distinction from TravelWise for our efforts in promoting sustainable transportation. 


Arctic Wolf Networks is looking for a talented software developer co-op to help us revolutionize the way that network security is delivered to small and medium businesses. Our hardworking team is passionate about building a cloud-based solution that will solve the real world security problems that IT professionals face. 


You'll use various languages/technologies such as Golang, RabbitMQ, JavaScript, PostgresSQL, AWS Cloud Services, GitHub, Python, and Jenkins to implement features. You'll have a the opportunity to work on some of the following:
 

Back end, large-scale, highly available distributed software architected as microservices running in cloud environments.
Vulnerability Scanning Linux embedded devices and virtual machines.
Windows/Mac/Linux endpoint software.
Job Responsibilities:
End to end ownership of the design, development and deployment of new features in innovative cyber security products
Follow software engineering best practices such as unit/component testing, code reviews, continuous integration using tools such as Git and Jenkins
Build and maintain high-level knowledge of cyber security threats
Identify new and innovative ways to handle cyber security incidents more effectively and efficiently
Debug and troubleshoot problems in test and production environments
Collaborate effectively with the user experience designer, product manager and developers to bring powerful designs to life
Deliver solutions at the intersection of Big Data, Cloud, and Web
Required Skills:
Ability to excel in fast-paced, small team environment
Experience with various programming languages, with a passion for writing quality code
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines
Believe in testing as a fundamental development practice

Job Summary:
Reports To: Director of Engineering
 
Organizational Profile:  Arcturus Networks Inc. is a privately held Canadian company that develops embedded hardware and software solutions for the industrial and commercial marketplace, utilizing open source and proprietary software.  The company develops in-house designed hardware platforms targeted as embedded, industrial-grade server or end-point modules, for use in audio communications, analytics and control, video surveillance and IOT applications in various industry verticals. Our customers are typically industrial application developers, manufacturers and OEM's who integrate our modules or platforms into their specific applications. 
 
Role Profile:  We are looking for highly skilled and motivated students to participate in the development of a new state-of-the-art Embedded Machine Vision System. We have developed two new hardware platforms targeted for small form factor, highly integrated, ruggedized and efficient industrial IoT and surveillance end-point devices. The smart embedded systems will incorporate IO and network peripheral integration, video surveillance, video analytics and machine vision algorithms for the purpose of public safety and threat detection use cases.  The candidate will have the opportunity to be a major contributor to this project and will obtain tremendous experience in the areas of Machine Vision, Machine Learning and embedded system-level development. 

Please visit our website www.arcturusnetworks.com to learn more about our company.
Job Responsibilities:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 


Develop low-level library functions for highly specialized embedded hardware
Develop machine vision algorithms with aim for efficient processing in a resource constraint platform
Develop, integrate and test inter-process communication stacks and interfaces
Develop, integrate and test digital input/output interfaces for specialized hardware 
Develop highly advanced video capture, video processing capabilities
Develop highly advanced Machine Vision and Machine Learning algorithms 
Apply software engineering methods to produce high-performance and hardware-optimized functionality 
Develop expertise in overcoming challenges of cross-platform code compatibility 
Design, develop and optimize media processing (video and voice) and networking applications for embedded hardware platforms
Design and develop highly interactive embedded web frontend and backend interfaces for realtime video streaming, machine vision event detection and data analytics presentation
Required Skills:
Required Experience

System-level software development under Open Source systems and Linux environments
System-level design and implementation using C and C++ 
Multi-threaded and distributed software applications
Inter-process communications 
Python and other scripting languages
HTML5, CSS and Javascript
Web frontend and backend applications with database components
Web development frameworks and open-source full-stack frameworks 
Databases and data models
Web development frameworks and open-source full-stack frameworks 
Image processing libraries (such as OpenCV) and Neural Networks
Code porting from open source projects into targeted embedded platforms 
Open-source tools and build environments

IP network protocols
Network troubleshooting techniques and equipment

Job Title: Software Engineering - Full-stack Cloud/Native Software Developer
Job Summary:
Software Engineering - Full-stack Cloud/Native Software Developer
 
Organizational Profile:  
Arcturus Networks Inc. is a privately held Canadian company that develops embedded hardware and software solutions for the industrial and commercial marketplace, utilizing open source and proprietary software.  The company develops in-house designed hardware platforms targeted as embedded, industrial-grade server or end-point modules, for use in audio communications, analytics and control, video surveillance and IOT applications in various industry verticals. Our customers are typically industrial application developers, manufacturers and OEM's who integrate our modules or platforms into their specific applications. 
 
Role Profile:  
If you are looking to make a big difference within a small team, earn great satisfaction of your work, and learn a tremendous amount along the way, this job is for you to apply. 
Our flagship cross-platform desktop application, System Manager, which discovers, controls and configures Arcturus embedded devices deployed in local and remote networks is undergoing a modernization and refactoring phase. Think of the analogous of a desktop and/or web application that needs to discover, map, access, configure, monitor, upgrade a vast amount of modern IP-enabled thermostats or sensor devices in various disparate open and closed networks. 
The project consists of a total reimplementation of the current version into a cutting edge, state of the art Web-Cloud based application using the newest technologies for advanced cloud based and containerized web applications. 
The candidate will have the opportunity to do original architecture and design, take ownership of the entire code base, implement the functionality and improve the interoperability and performance. 

Please visit our website www.arcturusnetworks.com to learn more about our company.
Job Responsibilities:

Influence the architecture of a state of-the-art web-cloud application using cutting edge frameworks
Develop, integrate and test inter-process communication stacks and interfaces
Improve functionality of mass upgrades of devices in disparate, remote, closed networks
Enhance front end and back end functionality, improve performance, increase interoperability
Develop sophisticated and efficient automated testing of front-end and back-end functions
Develop APIs to standardize interprocess communication on distributed embedded platforms
Develop approaches to perform operations on devices with distinct capabilities and APIs 
Improve functionality for efficient information exchange with resource constraint platforms

Experience with frontend frameworks, preferably React and Redux

Job Summary:
The Platform Engineering team, otherwise known as Diagnostics team, in Arista acts like the 'glue' between our Hardware teams and Software teams. 

We mainly write code to bringup and validate new system-level hardware designs, and to a degree new silicon and chipsets as well as supporting manufacturing in debugging hardware issues.
Job Responsibilities:
As part of the diagnostics team, you'd be responsible for: 

* The manufacturing test process 

- learn what is required to build and ship high-end electronic systems in production quantities 

- write test scripts in python and improve the testing infrastructure 


* The design verification process 

- learn how we test and ensure that a board design is suitable for production 

- add support for new products, and create test suites to beat on new board designs

Job Skills:

Good understanding of python 

Knowledge of computer architectures and technologies ( Buses, microcontrollers, etc )

Job Summary:
Diagnostics Infrastructure Engineering 


Arista is passionate about building the highest quality, most advanced network switches in the world. To scale manufacturing for ever increasing production volume while ensuring the highest quality standards, we develop and maintain our own automated production testing system used in all of our manufacturing facilities. We are obsessed with continuously improving the level of automation in all areas of production - verification of newly built hardware on the assembly line, as well as debugging, tracking and analyzing trends in manufacturing issues. 


As a Diagnostics Infrastructure Engineering co-op, you will be responsible for improving our automated hardware testing infrastructure in manufacturing sites as well as our regression test infrastructure in which we test our diagnostics software. You will have opportunities to work with various groups in Arista including diagnostics-infrastructure, diagnostics-platform, software, hardware, and manufacturing.
Job Responsibilities:
Develop and contribute to our automated hardware testing infrastructure, applications and tools used in the production process of Arista Network switches - this involves code written in Python, Go, Django and MySQL. 


Interface with local and remote manufacturing teams to resolve problems, collect requirements, identify opportunities for improving efficiency and scalability of the automated production system on an ongoing basis. 


Develop, maintain and monitor our automated regression test infrastructure used to to test diagnostics software before releasing to manufacturing. 


Develop and build tools to monitor software releases to manufacturing 


Deploy and troubleshoot Linux Servers (virtualized, bare metal) and networking devices.

Job Summary:
Manufacturing Engineering, Continuous Improvement 

Arla Foods, Canada 

  

Do you have a passion for Continuous Improvement? This is your chance! Join the Operations Excellence Team in our Continuous Improvement Student Placement! This exciting role will be the perfect opportunity for you to be part of an exciting team and a dynamic, world-class Consumer Packaged Goods and Dairy Manufacturing company. 

  

Working in our Continuous Improvement team, you will support the manufacturing and processing of specialty cheese products by tracking, analyzing and correcting  technical issues through continuous improvement (CI) work, assisting in troubleshooting and coaching and enabling Operators to meet and exceed daily production, packaging, quality, warehousing and safety objectives. 


The job will require in-person work at our office location.
Job Responsibilities:
About the role

Reporting to the Lean & Excellence Team, you will:
 

Collect data on KPIs of production and packaging lines as well as present corresponding action plans to achieve targets
Proactively look for CI related opportunities carry out work to optimize work on the lines and ensure maximum uptime
Inform and interact with all line staff, to keep supervisors up to date on CI related activities
Champion the Lean philosophy and support the development of the Lean culture within the departments to drive Continuous Improvement
Perform a broad range of work duties that include assisting with troubleshooting, and basic operator asset care
Work closely with the other members of the Line Centric Organization (LCO) Continuous Improvement team and openly share knowledge and ideas on an ongoing basis
Support major optimization work and efforts on lines
Hold and chair weekly meetings relating to key KPIs as reported in the OEE system, while acting in accordance with the PDCA (Plan, Do, Check, Act) process and carry out relevant processing confirmations
Review and check SOPs to ensure they are in place and being utilized
Train core team and Operators according to required standards and on CI related processes
Coach the line and operational team to ensure that performance meets the required standards with a focus on planned downtime and speed
Assist in ensuring results of downtime and technical stops are tracked continuously and transparently
Optimize existing processes by running regular Kaizen workshops, SMED analysis and process confirmations
Lead and participate in relevant A3 and Root Cause Analysis activities
Support LEAN implementation and actively engage in Lean activities within departments, including leading board meetings, assisting in Lean improvements events
Required Skills:
Who are you?

You are outgoing, curious, openminded, self-motivated, proactive and independent problem solver who can effectively communicate and interpret a wide variety of information to key stakeholders. With your Engineering education and mindset, you will have a keen eye for continuous improvement, supporting our Lean programs by engaging in and helping to lead Continuous Improvement activities.

Job Summary:
Technology Design Consultant Internship/ Co-Op-Available Winter 2022

Start Here, Go Anywhere!  Are you looking for an opportunity to shape a better world?  

  

During your internship at Arup, you'll have the chance to work with some of the most highly respected engineers and specialists in the world. You'll also get the opportunity to work on exciting and significant projects, delivering quality work that has a positive and lasting influence on the community and the environment. 


While traditional engineering disciplines may be the obvious face of buildings, structures and infrastructure, digital technologies are increasingly the enabler that makes these projects truly come to life and realize their operational goals.  From real-time crowd management and security platforms in airports, automated train control systems in rail, to integrated data networks connecting hundreds of thousands of sensors to enable 'smart' buildings and cities, the possibilities of technology applications we design and consult on are endless. 

  

Notable Projects:  


Arup is the creative force at the heart of many of the world's most prominent projects across our industry. We offer a broad range of professional services to clients around the world that combine to make a real difference to our clients and the communities in which we work.   
 

Calgary Cancer Center
University of British Colombia 
National Music Centre of Canada 
Tim Horton's Field  
New Champlain Bridge
Queen's Way West Revitalization 
Toronto Pearson International Airport

Arup is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment where our people are encouraged to grow.

Start Here, Go Anywhere! Are you looking for an opportunity to shape a better world?  

  

During your internship at Arup, you'll have the chance to work with some of the most highly respected engineers and specialists in the world. You'll also get the opportunity to work on exciting and significant projects, delivering quality work that has a positive and lasting influence on the community and the environment. 


Notable Projects:  

Arup is the creative force at the heart of many of the world's most prominent projects across our industry. We offer a broad range of professional services to clients around the world that combine to make a real difference to our clients and the communities in which we work.  
 

Calgary Cancer Center
University of British Colombia 
National Music Centre of Canada 
Tim Horton's Field  
New Champlain Bridge
Queen's Way West Revitalization 
Toronto Pearson International Airport

Arup is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment where our people are encouraged to grow.
Job Responsibilities:
As a Structural Intern, you will learn and apply the following:

  

•Design of individual structural members on a project 

•Structural analysis using structural software 

•Attend meetings and participating in discussions 

•Structural software skills (training course, on-the-job) 

•Structural analysis modeling (on-the-job) 

•Learning about the Arup Structural Skills Network (introduction course, on-the-job) 

•Learning to navigate through codes and/or guidelines.
Required Skills:
Qualifications

  

Required:

  

•3rd or 4th year student working towards a bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or Architectural Engineering with emphasis on Structures 

•Authorized to work in Canada and not require visa sponsorship 

•3.0 GPA or higher 

•Achieved high standings in Structural Engineering courses 

•Professional demeanor 

•Skills in planning and organizing 

•Ability to communicate thoughts and technical ideas in an accessible way 

•Attitude of taking initiative, enthusiasm, and eagerness to learn. 

•Bilingual in French and English

  

Preferred:

  

•Coursework in structural analysis, advanced steel design and advanced reinforced concrete design 

•Coursework in structural dynamics, earthquake engineering 

•Internship experience with a design firm 

•Structural software skills, AutoCAD skills, Revit skills, 3D modeling skills (SAP 2000, ETABS, SAFE, Rhino, SketchUp, etc.) 

•Evidence of past internship or extracurricular activity in the field 

•Proven ability to perform in a deadline environment 

•Past history of technical presentations and technical writing 

•Evidence of personal investment in academic or extracurricular field
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				ENG - Architectural Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

An employee-owned, Canadian company, Associated Engineering provides a broad base of consulting engineering services in the infrastructure, water, transportation, environmental, building, energy, and asset management sectors.
Job Responsibilities:
Position

We currently have an opening for a Civil / Environmental Engineering Co-op Student to join our team in our Vancouver Office.

The successful candidate will work closely with individuals and teams on design and construction services for municipal drinking water and wastewater projects. You may also assist in liaising with clients, contractors, and other consultants as well as assisting with the preparation of proposals. The successful candidate will join a dynamic team active on municipal engineering projects for a variety of public sector clients.

Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Committed team player and the ability to work independently.
A valid driver's license is an asset.

										Robotics and Math Enrichment Instructor
Job Summary:
Associated Hebrew Schools is a community day school where we value developing students' knowledge, creativity, critical thinking, collaboration and communication skills while exceeding the Ontario Ministry of Education's curriculum expectations. We are committed to educational excellence and innovation in a safe secure and nurturing environment where the individual needs of our students are being met to ensure their success in all domains of life. 


Associated is known for its excellence in STEAM and math education, and looking to increase robotics and math enrichment opportunities for our students. Associated Hebrew School seeks to contract a highly motivated, engaging individual to lead small groups of grades 5-8 students in enriching their mathematical critical and inquiry skills while developing the thinking skills to do a variety of math contests.
Job Responsibilities:
Specifically, you will be responsible for:
 

working with small groups of bright and motivated students (grades 4-5) during morning, lunch, and or after-school programs developing, reinforcing, and modeling strategies and techniques to compete in variety of math contests;
assisting classroom math teachers in supporting students with in-class challenges and enrichment opportunities in a variety of math units; and
working collaboratively with math lead and enrichment coordinator in creating learning goals/planning/lessons/activities while providing a mathematical environment that is hands-on that strengthen the fun and beauty of mathematics.
Required Skills:
Achieved or pursuing co-op university degree in math
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills
Enthusiasm and love for math
Energetic and confident personality
Excellent verbal communication and multi-tasking skills
Ability to professionally and positively interact with students and teachers
Experience in instructing and working with children  
Have participated in math contests in the past (Gauss, Math League, Caribou, etc.)
