Job Summary:
Opportunity Overview:

 Assuris is the not for profit organization that protects Canadian policyholders if their life insurance company should fail. 

  

During your co-op term at Assuris, you will get to work on projects that make a difference, focused primarily on detecting solvency risks in the Canadian life insurance industry. 

  

Assuris is not a life insurance company or a regulatory body. We are the compensation organization for the life insurance industry.  Our mission is to protect Canadian policyholders if their life insurance company fails. Working at Assuris, you will be exposed of all facets of the life insurance industry. This overview of the industry will afford you the opportunity to gain a deep and unique understanding of the Canadian life insurance industry. 


The work we do here is non-traditional and high-level.  We seek out thinkers who are curious and motivated to learn and think outside the box.  If you are interested in non-traditional actuarial work in a small, flexible and friendly work environment, this could be the right co-op placement for you. 


Assuris Overview:

Assuris was founded in 1990 and its mission is to protect policyholders if their life insurance company should fail. 

Every life insurance company authorized to sell insurance policies in Canada is required, by the federal, provincial and territorial regulators, to become a member of Assuris.
Job Responsibilities:
As a Risk Analyst intern at Assuris, you will work on:

developing your understanding of the Canadian life insurance industry with a focus on risk and solvency
performing a risk assessment of Canadian life insurance companies using information from regulatory filings including the Life return, Life Insurance Capital Adequacy Test (LICAT) return, Appointed Actuary's report and the Financial Condition Testing (FCT) report
comparing the financial results of life insurance companies and monitoring key economic indicators
collaborating with industry risk analysts to develop and improve risk detection processes
communicating the results of your analysis to Assuris management
other industry risk projects
Required Skills:
To get the most out of this opportunity, you should:

be an actuarial, math or finance student working towards completing an actuarial designation, preferably 2nd year or above
have strong analytical skills
be able to work effectively both independently and as part of a team
have strong results orientation, initiative, creativity and attention to detail
be proficient in Word, Excel and Outlook
have excellent verbal and written skills including the ability to communicate technical information using plain English

Assuris is proud to offer an enriching and educational co-op experience, where you are given the opportunity to develop your risk analysis skills and knowledge through continuous training and personal development. Many of our co-op students return to complete multiple terms with us. We value the relationships we build with students, and we focus on helping you develop the real-world skills that will allow you to successfully launch your career. 

  

For more information on Assuris, please visit our website at www.assuris.ca
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				- Theme - Insurance and Risk Management 
				
			
				ARTS - Economics
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

Job Summary:
As a member of the engineering team at Aterlo Networks you will be part of a team that is changing how our customers monitor and manage their networks. Our platform includes a real time, network inline component, offline metric gathering and cloud based big data architecture that processes billions of metrics per day. Few companies can expose you to both sides of that equation!

You will influence, design and implement features that delight our customers but even more importantly, solve real problems and add value.   You will work in a team of networking experts to build innovative network products that enable local and regional ISPs to thrive.  Learn how the Internet works at its lowest levels, and use cutting-edge technologies to build products that measure and improve the quality of experience of Internet users.

In this role you will design, implement and deliver Preseem features using Go and Python, using technologies such as Kubernetes, BigQuery, Prometheus, gRPC, CI/CD tools, Linux and eBPF.
Job Responsibilities:
Design, implement and deliver product features that add value and delight customers.
Learn about ISP networking technology, the Preseem product and participate in design and code reviews.
Build with focus on operations, performance and maintainability.
Required Skills:
We are looking for:

Passion and interest in software development. People who love what they do excel.
A focus on delivering value to our customers.
Team player with a desire to jump in and get things done.
Willingness to learn, experiment and try new things.
Strong communicator, both written and verbal.
Self-motivated and able to work independently.
Positive attitude.

Technical skills:


Experience with a scripting language such as Python
Experience with C, C++ or Go
Familiarity with Linux

Bonus Points


Experience with Javascript
Expertise with networking technology such as TCP/IP and socket programming
Experience with Git
Experience with Google Cloud
Experience with React
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
What do we do? 

Atlantic Industries Limited (AIL) is an award-winning innovator of engineered solutions in structural plate bridges and tunnels, prefabricated bridges, pipe and drainage systems, abutments and retaining walls, and sound barrier walls. Headquartered in Sackville, New Brunswick, AIL operates a network of technical sales teams, engineering departments, and manufacturing plants in Canada.  

  

Who are we?

At AIL we value integrity, excellence, innovation and a 'can do' attitude. We look for team members who are collaborative, accountable, curious and committed in everything they do. If this sounds like you, then you will enjoy working at AIL. 

AIL is a member of the multinational AIL Group of Companies  -  a leader in developing efficient engineered solutions for the transportation, public works, railway, mining and energy, forestry, and development sectors for over 50 years. 

  

What are we looking for?

We are looking for a designer to work in our Ayr, Ontario engineering department. They will be acting as support for various projects' specific drafting and designing activities, co-ordination and update of AIL's standard drawings, and product testing. This role will require excellent communication skills, a highly collaborative mindset, and excellent time management skills. This is a 4 month co-op position, running from January 2022 to April 2022.

Responsibilities:

Support ongoing research using finite element soil-structure modelling software (Plaxis and Cande).
Update AIL's buried structures, concrete structures and retaining wall design procedures.
Support the co-ordination and update of AIL's standard drawings.
Support project specific drafting and design activities.
Support product testing.
Prepare and submit reports.
Interface and communicate priorities and relevant information to internal stakeholders.

Preferably 3rd year of an accredited Engineering Program in the Civil Engineering discipline.
Exceptional written, oral and telephone communication skills.

Strong interpersonal skills.

Job Summary:
This is a hands-on look into the early days of an enterprise software company. 


As a Waterloo alum, I remember struggling to find co-ops where I could learn about the software industry, explore different business functions, have a meaningful impact, and get closer to the customers - especially the executives who sponsor large software purchases. So, I've come back to create precisely that.  


Atolio is an early stage software company, founded in 2019 by former engineers and early employees from Splunk ($30B company) and PagerDuty (uWaterloo alum) - having been part of the earliest team (under $1M in revenue) until IPO. Our first product is a platform for corporate information - integrated into your on-prem and cloud ecosystems (Microsoft, Google, Box, Atlassian, Slack, etc.) to help employees search, discover and organize information.  


This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP). The SWPP program requires that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.
Job Responsibilities:
We've figured out a remarkably effective way for startups at our stage to build relationships with potential clients - and you'll be mastering that process.  


You'll be working closely with our Head of Sales to research, contact, and meet with tech executives of the largest companies in the world. Using Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other tools, you'll learn how to research and present to Chief Information Officers (CIOs) and Chief Technology Officers (CTOs) to hear what they have to say about our offering and to start building relationships into target accounts. 


Think of 80-90% of the job as an advanced research and sales role - beyond that we encourage you to engage with any part of Atolio that interests you. Examples from past co-op terms include an AFM student building out a chrome extension in JavaScript and Go to improve our sales process, a Psych major rethinking through our discovery questions and leading team building activities, a Biomedical engineering student analysing our hundreds of discovery calls to gather insights for our product efforts, and a double degree Business/CS student who analyzed trends in our dataset to better understand what leads to a higher quality conversation and future opportunity. 


If you want to be part of an early team that's tackling a massive opportunity inside large enterprises, and if you want to learn more about what it's like to have a career in enterprise software sales, apply.
Required Skills: You are curious, notice the details, and enjoy learning.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				- Theme - Marketing and Communication 
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics

Job Summary:
As a former EE grad from Waterloo that was interested in how businesses were built and operated from my earliest terms...I found it challenging to find co-op's that got me closer to the business and provided an opportunity to have a meaningful impact on the customer experience. 


Atolio is a seed stage software company, founded in 2019 by former engineers and early employees from Splunk ($30B company) and PagerDuty (uWaterloo alum) - having been part of the earliest team (under $1M in revenue) until IPO. 


Our first product is a platform for corporate information - integrated into your on-prem and cloud ecosystems (Microsoft, Google, Box, Atlassian, Slack, etc.) to help employees search, discover and organize information. We are solving the enterprise search problem, but the broader solution looks more like Splunk with more valuable data.
Job Responsibilities:
As a backend systems engineer, you will be assisting at the earliest stages of building a new cloud-based enterprise product, investigating and proposing algorithmic improvements, building out integration pipelines, testing search relevance with our internal dataset and working with the team to establish cloud infrastructure. 


We are using industry leading tools and languages such as Go, Java, graph databases, full text search systems, machine learning, AWS, IaaC, CI/CD, etc. 


As the product is at an early stage, there's a good amount of flexibility around the work to be done and can be shaped by your own expertise and interest. 


If you want to be part of an early team building a product that has real impact for big enterprises and an opportunity to learn more about how a business is run (not just how products are built), apply.

You:

* enjoy learning 

* are passionate about writing software

Our Controls Engineering Team is looking for a bright and ambitious student who is looking for a challenging but rewarding co-op experience. 


As a member of a team of professionals you will develop industrial control systems for automated assembly systems. You will be required to produce hardware and software designs to meet customer control specifications. You will test these designs during system integration to ensure that all design requirements have been met. The challenge is to develop world-class control systems that meet or exceed our customer's requirements. 


As a member of our control systems team, you will gain experience using the latest Industrial control products including PLC's, SCADA Systems, Human Machine Interfaces, Servo Controllers, Robots and Data Acquisition equipment.
Job Responsibilities:
Under the supervision of an experienced Control Systems Software Designer, you will:

 Develop real-time control system software for automated assembly systems. This includes the programming of PLC's, Servo Controllers, Robots and Vision Systems.
 Develop human machine interfaces. These interfaces can be commercially available industrial products, SCADA nodes or custom GUI's written in Visual Basic or Visual C++.
 Work with mechanical and electrical designers to ensure that the control system will meet performance, reliability and functionality requirements.
 Perform system integration. This includes the testing of all system hardware and software, the configuration and calibration of intelligent devices and the verification of the assembly process. The goal is to meet all customer quality, functionality and safety requirements.
 Perform on-site commissioning and startup. This involves demonstrating system's capability once the equipment has been shipped to the customer's site.
 Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct.
 Adhere to all health and safety rules and procedures.

Experience:

 GUI development (Visual C++, Visual Basic).

 A self-starter with the ability to work as part of a team with minimal supervision.

Uses sound judgment in assessing the significance of risks or problems.

Provide timely response to customer requests.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

In collaboration with other members of the corporate marketing team, this role will use high-quality video to drive engagement and reach business goals.  Students will use studio equipment including lighting, cameras, and audio for live action shoots, and edit video footage and still images into compelling stories that impact our audiences. The successful co-op student will have the opportunity to manage a project from initiation, planning, execution, and launch including measuring business impact that can be added to your portfolio.

Research industry trends and pitch new ideas, designs and tools

In process of completing a post-secondary degree or diploma in Media Studies, Videography, Visual Communication, Graphic Design, or related discipline. 

  

Experience:

Must have knowledge of Microsoft Office and Adobe Creative Cloud. 
The individual must be excellent at multi-tasking and present themselves professionally.

										Control Systems Software Design Co-op Student
Job Summary: As a member of a team of professionals you will develop industrial control systems for automated assembly systems.  You will be required to produce hardware and software designs to meet customer control specifications. You will test these designs during system integration to ensure that all design requirements have been met. The challenge is to develop world-class control systems that meet or exceed our customer's requirements.  As a member of our control systems team, you will gain experience using the latest Industrial control products including PLC's, SCADA Systems, Human Machine Interfaces, Servo Controllers, Robots and Data Acquisition equipment.
Job Responsibilities:
Under the supervision of an experienced Control Systems Software Designer, you will:
 

Develop real-time control system software for automated assembly systems. This includes the programming of PLC's, Servo Controllers, Robots and Vision Systems.
Develop human machine interfaces.  These interfaces can be commercially available industrial products, SCADA nodes or custom GUI's written in Visual Basic or Visual C++.
Work with mechanical and electrical designers to ensure that the control system will meet performance, reliability and functionality requirements.
Perform system integration.  This includes the testing of all system hardware and software, the configuration and calibration of intelligent devices and the verification of the assembly process.  The goal is to meet all customer quality, functionality and safety requirements.
Perform on-site commissioning and startup.  This involves demonstrating system's capability once the equipment has been shipped to the customer's site.
Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct.
Work in compliance with divisional health, safety and environmental procedures.
Refrain from removing or altering safety devices or guarding unless hazardous energies are controlled through lockout-tagout methods.
Report any unsafe conditions or unsafe acts.
Report defect in any equipment or protective device.
Ensure that the required protective equipment is used for the assigned tasks.
Attend all required health, safety and environmental training.
Required Skills:
Education:

Electrical, Computer or Systems Design Engineering student with an interest in industrial control systems.

  

Experience

Real-time controls, PLC programming, motion controls, vision programming.
GUI development (Visual C++, Visual Basic).
SCADA system development (Wonderware, Intellution).
A self-starter with the ability to work as part of a team with minimal supervision.

Job Summary:
Job Title: Engineering Co-op Student 

Location:  Portlands Energy Centre, Toronto, ON

 Dates: September 7 - December 23, 2021 

  

As an Engineering Co-op Student, you'll be a valued member of the Atura Power Engineering Team. Located at Portlands Energy Centre this is a great opportunity to join the team which provides engineering support for projects, preventive maintenance, operational issues and troubleshooting, outages, and ongoing business improvement projects. The team is responsible for the implementation of world class operating and maintenance strategies, programs, systems, processes, and tools to existing power assets in collaboration with the operation and maintenance departments. 

  

During your 4-month work-term, you will learn a variety of engineering functions and participate in operations support and improvement projects that relate to our role in Atura. You will be exposed to Atura's entire portfolio of power generation assets and the programs utilized to manage these assets throughout Ontario. 

  

Based on your interest, background and skillset, projects may include:
 

Business and Maintenance planning/optimization
Water treatment, gas turbine, steam turbine, HRSG maintenance and engineering
Environmental compliance and permitting
Financial and technical analysis to optimize the business and improve asset management
Track and analyze energy (electricity and gas) trades/markets to improve business performance
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:
 

Provide engineering support for operational issues, this will involve spending time in the power plant troubleshooting, walking down systems, and investigating equipment
Provide engineering support for the planning and execution of plant outages, overhauls, and other capital projects
Work closely with the plant engineer, system engineers, and project managers to support ongoing engineering and project work.
Analyze and assess equipment condition through review of field test data and other equipment-centered information systems
Ensure relevant documentation is retained in accordance with company expectations including drawings, reference manuals, and other related information
Evaluate new technologies, studies, reports from EPRI and other industry user groups for applicability to the business
Follow company procedures including Practice of Engineering, Management of Change, and Project Management Procedures
Gain exposure to the power generation industry
Perform other related duties as business needs arise and your skills and interests align
Required Skills:
Job Qualifications, Required:
 

Must be enrolled in an Engineering Program (mechanical or electrical preferred)
Must be enrolled in a post-secondary institution's co-op program
You must be legally entitled to work in Canada by way of Canadian Citizenship, Permanent Residency or a valid work permit which would allow you to work for Atura Power
Intermediate to advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Excel, Word, Outlook and Visio (or similar spreadsheet, database, and e-mail software) is required
Have and maintain a valid G driver's license and provide a driver's abstract for review.
Use of a personal vehicle as Atura's sites are not accessible via public transit.

 Preferred:

 

Power generation industry experience
Familiarity and interest in mechanical and/or electrical equipment used in power generation

 Possible software used:

 

C# ETL programming skill, dealing xml in C# (e.g. scrape online data and put into Database)
VBA - Visual Basic programming skill for Applications such as MS Excel
AutoCad, Solidworks
C++, JAVA
MS Office (Excel, Word)
Visio
Power Point Presentations
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Energy Production and Distribution
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Description
 
Audioworks is a collection of audio software professionals that are building innovative music technology products. With a team of audio engineers and music producers, we are creating a variety of products that will revolutionize and educate the music creation process in the cloud and will provide artists support to exploit and promote their song compositions.
 
Right now, we have an opportunity for a Lead Full Stack Web Developer to join our fully scaled agile team to develop cutting edge products that improve the way people experience music creation.
 
As a hands on Full Stack web developer you will have a crucial role spearheading this transformation. Working in scrum teams with scrum masters and product managers, the successful candidate will evaluate and, as necessary, transform our organization to ensure that we have the right resources, tools, and operating models in place to add even more value for our customers.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities will include:

Driving full cycle end to end development from design through implementation.
Serving as a driving force in our organizational evolution to deliver an exceptional customer experience through superior digital interactions.
Mentor staff to align with our fully scaled Agile methodology.
Provide technical and architectural leadership to developers through code reviews, program enhancements, unit testing, bug fixing and problems solving.
Implement new features and enhancements for the next generation of Audioworks mobile and web based products.
Preside over strategy sessions and technical reviews with key stake holders and senior management teams.
Innovate and provide critical thinking and problem solving ability to drive change and develop creative technology solutions.
This role will lead teams by contributing refreshing and innovative technological solutions to the design process and product roadmap.
Required Skills:
Desired development skills:

Proven experiencing designing and developing applications and services which can scale using proven cloud architecture patterns..
Experience integrating/developing automated and background processes in python, go, perl, bash, etc. (unless you want any backend integration with the audio processing done in node..which is fine I guess?)
Strong experience as a software development team lead with experience developing cloud-hosted, responsive, single page web applications using JavaScript, Java, HTML5, CSS3
High proficiency with client side JavaScript frameworks (preferably React/Redux), server side frameworks (preferably NodeJS) and NoSQL databases (preferably MongoDB)
Able to integrate with and managing APIs exposing microservices (REST, JSON, JWT, etc).
Familiarity with event-based System of Engagement architectures
Experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum, Lean Startup, Kanban, XP) and cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Designers, Test Engineers)
Demonstrates leadership and active pursuit of optimizing CI/CD process and tools, testing frameworks and practices (preferably GitHub, Jenkins/Bamboo, Mocha/Karma, etc)
Ideally familiar with Design Thinking, Behavior and Test-Driven Development
Familiarity with test-and-learn approaches using web and customer analytics data, understanding how these drive hypotheses-based development
Strong leadership, communication and collaboration skills with track record of taking solution ownership

You want to work for a small company that dreams big and thinks out of the box. You are driven and think work is more than just a job. You enjoy being surrounded by creative and fun-loving people who are passionate about their work. You are motivated and thrive on solving challenging problems.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Intern, User Interface Research Group Developer
Job Summary:
Through our apps for iPhone, iPad, iPod, and Android, we're also making design technology accessible to professional designers as well as amateur designers, homeowners, students, and casual creators. Whether it's a kid looking to build a new contraption, a seasoned pro sketching out a great new idea, or someone who just wants to ramp up their creative output, we're taking technology originally built for movie studios, automakers, and architectural firms, and making it available to anyone who wants to create and share their ideas with the world. 

  

Since its introduction of AutoCAD software in 1982, Autodesk continues to develop the broadest portfolio of state-of-the-art 3D software for global markets. 

  

About Autodesk Research 

Autodesk Research is a team of expert scientists exploring and creating technologies to help improve design and its role in society through high-level projects and collaboration with leading research universities worldwide. We are looking for an inquisitive intern to work on development projects. 

  

http://www.autodeskresearch.com/

  

This is a unique opportunity to work in the very high-end software industry with the Research group in Toronto. The position is with the User Interface research group, a team responsible for developing and studying new user interaction concepts and ideas. 

  

Past projects that students have contributed to include a 3D UI navigation library; prototyping with 3D mice, touch input, styluses and stereographic displays; a web-based learning tool which allows users to explore graphical document workflow histories through captured video and command usage metadata; a sketch-based interface for adding animation effects to drawings. 

  

Autodesk makes software for people who make things. If you've ever driven a high-performance car, admired a towering skyscraper, used a smartphone, or watched a great film, chances are you've experienced what millions of Autodesk customers are doing with our software. Autodesk gives you the power to make anything. For more information and open positions visit autodesk.com/careers. To see our culture in action, please check out #AutodeskLife on Instagram or facebook.com/autodeskcareers. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, gender, disability, veteran status or other protected category. Please visit us at: www.autodeskresearch.com and www.autodesk.com
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities Include:

-Work as part of a team of researchers, software developers, product designers and QA specialists. 

-Participate in the iterative design process by quickly implementing prototypes. 

-Design and code production-quality applications and reusable software components. 

-Contribute to technical documentation.
Required Skills:
What we are looking for in an intern... 

-Object-oriented programming experience with one or more of C++, Objective-C, JavaScript, Python. 

-Programming experience with desktop, mobile and/or web application frameworks. 

-Experience or interest in learning basic electronic hardware and circuitry. 

-Ability to learn quickly and to adapt to frequent change. 

-Ability to communicate effectively and work cooperatively. 

-Self-motivated. 

  

Desirable Skills: 

-Knowledge of user interface design. 

-Knowledge of fabrication, 3D modeling, 3D printing. 

-Agile software development. 

-Knowledge of Autodesk products.

Job Summary:
The Role


AREA is an online community of enthusiasts, students, and professionals in the fields of design visualization, advertising, film and TV, visual effects, animation, and games. Boasting over 1K free tutorials and assets, AREA is home to the latest industry news and 3D lifestyle content, and where studios big and small alike talk shop. Most importantly, AREA is where people can connect with one another - whether it's to share tips or get feedback on their latest project.  

  

As the AREA Support Intern, you will help the Web Experience Team maintain our AREA website and mobile applications. You will also assist AREA members by troubleshooting their technical issues and answering their inquiries, as well as monitor conversations within the community and our forums. This is an incredibly exciting time at Autodesk and this role will give you the opportunity to be on the front line, having a direct impact on our members' AREA experience.?
Job Responsibilities:
Participate in operations of AREA (member services, support, assisting the development team, etc.) 
Support AREA members' journey through onboarding, adoption, and day-to-day use. 
Investigate technical issues and log tickets with accurate information to provide a full record of each issue and its resolution. Interactions include platform usage questions, onboarding and set up, and general inquiries.  
Report support issues, bugs, and important user concerns to the AREA team.
Required Skills:

You are passionate about helping our customers and have excellent people skills 
You are an exceptional communicator (verbal and written), with top notch grammar and spelling  
You are a master at breaking down complex concepts into every-day language to effectively serve customers of all technical proficiencies 
You possess a keen attention to detail and have an analytical, technical mindset that helps you solve problems quickly and efficiently   
You are a multi-tasker who nails the art of juggling multiple chats at once, while answering emails and supporting your peers 
You understand the basic of Apple iOS, Android, online CMS, customer service, and SaaS.


Required

Strong verbal and written skills required in English 
Proficient in MS Office products (SharePoint, Office 365) 
Demonstrated analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills 
Flexible and adaptable to work in a global and multi-cultural environment Experience in Jira is a plus.

Job Summary:
About Us:

Autodesk transforms the way buildings get built. We're shaking up the trillion dollar construction industry by creating the world's first mobile construction collaboration app. Autodesk replaces the headache of stacks of paper, costly mistakes and coordination nightmares with simple, beautiful tablet and smartphone solutions. More than 40 million blueprints are stored in our cloud, and our customers are adding 4,000 new projects every week. Autodesk is used on high-profile projects like SFMOMA in San Francisco, Hudson Yards in New York and Conestoga College in KW. (Note: PlanGrid was acquired by Autodesk; you may see references to PlanGrid in parts of this job posting.)


About the Role

You're a champion for the user. You love working with fast-paced, cross-functional teams to distill complicated problems into simple and elegant solutions. You're self-motivated, autonomous, and a master of navigating ambiguity. 


In this role, you'll have ownership of your projects and guide them through research, exploration, design, and delivery. You'll work closely with design mentors, product managers and engineers to solve meaningful problems. You'll have the opportunity to be curious, focused, and relentless in pursuit of great user experiences every single day. You will be working on high-impact initiatives with a lot of complexity. 


Projects previous co-ops have worked on include:

* Using existing patterns to design across Android, Web, Windows and iOS (including research and testing); 

* Refreshing a tool's information architecture (including research, user testing and running a team workshop) and 

* Defining new design system patterns. 


What past design co-ops say:

"The design team at PlanGrid is so talented and welcoming. I was put on challenging projects that let me grow, but also worked closely with more experienced designers that could help me if I needed." 


"My internship at PlanGrid was easily the most challenging and rewarding internship I've ever had. I got to work with - and learn under - not only some of the best designers in the industry, but also with outstanding engineers and PMs. What really set this experience apart for me was how much my manager and team cared about my professional development, as well as my personal well-being. It really made me feel supported in all aspects, right from day 1." 


How to apply:

Include a link to your portfolio. (It doesn't have to be fancy! We just want to learn about your work and how you think.) 

(Pssst: We put a lot of tips for applications and interviewing in this Medium post: http://bit.ly/plangrid-design-internship)
Job Responsibilities:
Work with other members of the design team and cross-functional partnerships to ship experiences users love, including:

* Partner with Product Management to understand business needs and requirements. 

* Partner with the engineering team to explore technical constraints and effectively balance quality and speed. 

* Work with our research team to draft testing plans to conduct user research, usability testing, etc. 

* Produce documentation, mock-ups, prototypes, journey maps and other design artifacts to help communicate thinking and intended user experience. 

* Help grow and evolve our design system 

* Participate in design critique and other team initiatives
Required Skills:
Requirements:

* High energy, a positive outlook, an entrepreneurial spirit and ready to take initiative. 

* Strong growth-mindset and eager to learn. 

* Excited to work closely with other designers and cross-disciplinary partners. (Design is a team sport! :) ) 

* Experience with Figma, Sketch, Invision, or similar design and prototyping tools 

* Able to think through complex problems. 

* Demonstrated interest in design and/or user research, such as school projects, personal projects, freelance or past professional projects. 


Bonus Points:

* Experience in facilitation, service design and design thinking 

* Previous experience working on cross-functional teams, shipping product, or with the construction industry 

* Experience on creating for iOS, Android, Web or Windows.

Targeted Clusters

About the role:

We're looking for a Frontend Engineer to join our feature teams to help us develop and build out client-side workflows and features on our web applications that bring high impact and value to our users. 


You should enjoy creating user friendly applications, taking mockups and turning them into functional features. Job Summary:
Job Summary

The User Research team's mission is to inform and influence product decisions through rich insights about the behaviors and motivations of our users. As a co-op researcher, you will be paired with a senior research mentor who will support you in your research work. You will conduct exploratory as well as evaluative research through field visits, surveys, fast-cycle concept testing, usability evaluation, and more. 

Working closely with designers, product managers, and engineers, you'll advocate for our users and blend their needs with those of the complex world of construction. 


About Us:

We're transforming the way buildings get built. We're shaking up the trillion dollar construction industry by creating the world's first mobile construction collaboration app. Autodesk replaces the headache of stacks of paper, costly mistakes and coordination nightmares with simple, beautiful tablet and smartphone solutions. More than 40 million blueprints are stored in our cloud, and our customers are adding 4,000 new projects every week. Autodesk is used on high-profile projects like SFMOMA, Levis Stadium, and Conestoga College in KW. 


Construction is a complex, modular, and physical industry that shapes the world around us. On any given built-world project there are managers, contractors, laborers, engineers, designers, inspectors, and more who all need to coordinate and collaborate to complete the job at hand. It's a complex domain and our research team are critical translator-guides that ensure our success. 


Projects previous co-ops have worked on include:

* Digging into the data and interviewing users to help guide product thoughtful decisions 

* Concept testing for new features 

* Exploratory research on construction processes 

* Advocating for accessibility patterns and support 


What past design co-ops say:

"The design team at PlanGrid is so talented and welcoming. I was put on challenging projects that let me grow, but also worked closely with more experienced designers that could help me if I needed." 


"My internship at PlanGrid was easily the most challenging and rewarding internship I've ever had. I got to work with - and learn under - not only some of the best designers in the industry, but also with outstanding engineers and PMs. What really set this experience apart for me was how much my manager and team cared about my professional development, as well as my personal well-being. It really made me feel supported in all aspects, right from day 1." 


How to apply:

We recommend including a portfolio. (It doesn't have to be fancy! We just want to learn about your work and how you think.) 

(Pssst: We put a lot of tips for applications and interviewing in this Medium post: http://bit.ly/plangrid-design-internship)
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities

* Develop impactful research studies designed to uncover new insights about users: design research plans, recruit participants, and conduct interviews with users. 

* Synthesize and communicate research findings to inform product decisions and build empathy across the organization 

* Partner closely with our data team to bring qualitative meaning to quantitative insights 

Required Skills: Experience: 

* Interest in applying the research process to a variety of user and business problems 

* Curiosity in how things work and how people think 

* Systematic thinker and thoughtful communicator 

* High energy, a positive outlook, an entrepreneurial spirit and ready to take initiative. 

* Strong growth-mindset and eager to learn. 

* Excited to work closely with other researchers and cross-disciplinary partners.
Required Skills:
Bonus points:

* Experience with data, analytics or experimentation 

* Curiosity and passion for developing great products in complex industries 

* Intrigued by construction and helping teams build better together 

* Experience in assisting/managing study participant recruitment

Job Summary:
We're looking for people who want to show up to the future and we're building a founding team for the future of health devtools. We have an open core "Plaid for health" product that you will help us build.
 

Company formed at start of the year by ex-YC founder group of 3, raised $2M at the start of 2021 - cumulatively, we've raised nearly $20M in our careers so far
During your co-op, you will be part of the founding team and help us launch "Plaid for health"
You will alter the trajectory of our R&D work with rapid prototype development

We want to work with people who are:

 

Authentic and opinionated - with a story to tell
Thinking about the future a lot these days
An ex-founder or a future founder
Deeply technical

You will contribute platform code, technical writing, and product roadmapping. You will advance in your understanding of typed languages like TypeScript, modern ECMAScript standards, database schema development, exchange formats like GraphQL, and standards like FHIR which are going to power the future of health data.

Autonomously contribute to our growing body of open source work and important health data projects
Provide clear, frequent communication in variable formats (reading, writing, speaking)

Uphold best practices for development, security, and patient rights to privacy

Independence and self-starting attitude, taking ownership and solving hard problems

Job Summary:
Advances in cloud computing, connectivity, embedded hardware and security are culminating in the biggest disruption in transportation since the advent of the automobile. The founders of Xtreme Labs saw an opportunity in the space and started Autonomic as their next venture. 


We are looking for a coop student to join the team as we accelerate this transformation. At Autonomic you will have the opportunity to join a team of passionate technologists with broad experience in cloud and distributed systems, mobile, UX, and machine learning as we set out to provide current and next-gen transportation companies alike with the services they need to transform the industry. As a software engineer within our team you will be pair programming and writing production-level code within your first week. You will also take your knowledge of Engineering and Computer Science fundamentals to deploy your Spring microservices to Kubernetes on AWS. 


https://autonomic.ai/


In your application please specify at least 2 teams that you are interested in. 


Within the Toronto Office we have the following 3 software development teams. 


Inventory Management Team (IMT): Focused on building services and APIs to facilitate our customers - large vehicle manufacturers - to enroll and manage their vehicles and connectivity devices on the Transportation Mobility Cloud. We strive to offer a well defined and easy to use API, and build highly available services that can support the scale of large OEMs. Our APIs are available in gRPC and REST, and our microservices are built using Java 11/Spring Boot 2, and communicate with each other by leveraging Kafka and GRPC. 


Command Adapter Team (TMS): Focused on building out adapter interfaces to enable our customers to integrate with the TMC Command functionality. We work closely with the business and our clients on improving our command definitions, and our services enable bi-directional communication for commands between our platform and a client's own cloud. Our system is designed to run at a global scale to support command conversion for millions of active vehicles. Our microservices are built using Java 11/Spring Boot 2, and communicate with each other by leveraging Kafka and GRPC. 


Command & Telemetry Team (CHAT): Focused on building APIs to facilitate customer interactions with Autonomic's platform. Some examples of functionality we expose are the ability to retrieve vehicle telemetry, to issue vehicle commands (start engine, lock, etc), and to administer groups of vehicles. We strive to offer well defined and easy to use APIs, and build highly available services that can support the scale of our customers. We currently offer APIs through REST and Websockets, and our microservices are built using Java 11/Spring Boot 2, and communicate with upstream services via REST, GRPC, and Kafka. 


Recent Press: 

* https://www.businessinsider.com/how-ford-benefits-from-autonomic-transportation-cloud-2018-5

* https://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/ford/2018/05/07/ford-start-teams-develop-new-business-ventures/34639707/

* https://media.ford.com/content/fordmedia/fna/us/en/news/2019/04/23/ford-motor-company-autonomic-amazon-web-services-collaboration.html
Job Responsibilities:
- Pair programming with our software developers on a daily basis 

- Writing Python code to build tools and services to improve the engineering process across the company 

- Writing Java Spring Boot code to build scalable client APIs or interact with hundreds of millions of messages from live vehicle data via Kafka streams per day 

- Devising algorithms on how best to aggregate non-chronological data received via Kafka Streams 

- Ownership of the quality of the code that you produce 

- Working using Extreme Programming (XP) fundamentals
Required Skills:
Required: 

- Experience with Java, Spring, Python or Go 

- Object-oriented programming 

- Strong communication skills within a pair programming environment Nice to haves: 

- Experience working with Kubernetes on AWS 

- Experience with developing backend micro-services 

- Kafka streams 

- Test driven development 

- Experience with XP 

- Pivotal Tracker 

- IntelliJ IDEA
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Why should you consider joining Auvik?

You want to work at a company that is building impactful, relevant technology.
Auvik's network management software helps IT teams by automating time-consuming tasks, streamlining operations, and mitigating risk. It's more important than ever to be able to remotely monitor and manage network infrastructure, and with Auvik, IT professionals have that essential visibility and control.
You want to work with a leadership team who are transparent and trustworthy.
Our senior leaders have a vision for Auvik. They are experienced, knowledgeable, approachable, and consistently working hard to drive success, both for the company and the team of people who make it happen.
You want to work with a product customers love.
People rave about what we've built-our latest NPS was 57 (phenomenal!). Our customers are smart, aspirational, and highly technical. It pays to get the details right.
You want regular opportunities for learning and growth.
With ongoing feedback from leadership, you'll find that Auvik encourages you to be your very best. Our onboarding process is thorough and informative because we want to make sure you're prepared to have a great work experience. We also have programs designed to help you take the next steps you want for your career.
You want the flexibility to manage your work, your way.
We're a fully distributed team and we're prepared to continue to support working from home (or the space you choose!). When we're able, we'll have Auvik hubs in Waterloo and Barcelona for you to leverage if needed. We trust you to get the job done where you feel most comfortable and effective.


What's this role all about? 


As a Frontend Developer at Auvik, you'll design key components as we transition to our new user interface stack based on React and GraphQL.
Job Responsibilities:
What will I be doing?


As a Frontend Developer, you'll influence the design and implementation. You'll be part of an agile team of coders, developing a network management service that handles millions of transactions per second, while solving big challenges for our customers. Drawing on your love of developing creative solutions, your can-do attitude, and your drive to do great work, you'll help Auvik continue to build software our customers can rely on.
Required Skills:
What are we looking for?

As the ideal candidate you will have professional or self-taught experience with the following: 


- Develop intuitive, efficient, and elegant web UI features using React, GraphQL, D3, and NodeJS. 

- Build reliable, highly available, and scalable software on top of the Kafka streaming platform. 

- Deploy and manage containerized applications using Kubernetes orchestration. 

- Architect and design key components as we transition to microservices. 

- Monitor microservices in production using metrics and OpenTracing. 

- Strong communicators (written and verbal) who work collaboratively with their immediate team, and the larger organization. 

- Developers who are unafraid to learn through research and will drive conversation and make recommendations based on experiences and findings. 

- Demonstrate accountability by following established processes and making suggestions for process/delivery improvements. 

- Work collaboratively with engineering and product management to deliver software components to meet the needs of our customers.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary: Avia NG is an airport consulting firm specializing in airport planning, design, contract administration and construction supervision services for airport infrastructure projects.  We operate from four (4) Canadian-based offices located in Kitchener, Calgary, Toronto and Southampton (Ontario) and serve airports, government and private clients throughout Canada and the Caribbean.  We are currently seeking one (1) engineering co-op student who has completed two years of the civil engineering academic program.
Job Responsibilities:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 

Work with Professional Engineers and Project Managers in the planning, design and project management of airfield infrastructure projects for private airport, regional and international airports by applying principles of civil engineering.  Specific tasks include design of new runways, taxiways, aprons, airside service roads, approach lighting systems, airside commercial developments including site servicing, grading, earthworks, stormwater management and deicing facilities.
Assist in the development and preparation of figures, design drawings, specifications, calculations, cost estimates, quantity take-offs, technical reports, etc.
Enhance knowledge of airport design and requirements of reviewing agencies such as NAV CANADA, Transport Canada, Airport Authorities, Municipalities, etc.
Assist with or be responsible for Construction Inspection at project sites and evaluate contractor work to determine compliance with Contract Documents.
Assist in Planning and conducting site visits and topographic surveys.
Other duties as assigned or required.

This position may require periodic travel within Canada and all candidates are expected to have a valid drivers license.
Required Skills:
QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
 

Enrolled in the Engineering Program and have completed a minimum of two years of the civil engineering academic program.
An interest in aviation/airports.
Fluent in spoken and written English.
Strong communication and report writing skills and ability to prioritize/manage multiple project timelines.
Mature, self-motivated individual possessing effective communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
Demonstrated experience with the MS Office suite of programs (MS Word, Excel, Outlook). AutoCAD Civil3d experience would be considered an asset.
Some experience in the field assisting with surveying, materials testing and/or construction inspection is considered an asset.
Familiarity with Transport Canada Standard TP312 Aerodrome Design Standards (TP 312 5th Edition) is considered an asset.

Job Summary:
Are you passionate about data and not afraid of searching for a needle in a haystack? Does developing pricing techniques give you goosebumps? Do you get excited when discovering a new piece of data that could potentially drive better business results or make customers happy? 


Join an exciting team of actuaries at the forefront of a company who is leveraging data to better drive decisions at every level of our organization. Our aim is to change how we do insurance and you can help us. Aviva writes personal, commercial and specialty lines insurance and has a sophisticated approach to capital management. With a workforce of about 150 Actuaries and Data Scientists, the diversity of experience is broad.
Job Responsibilities:
Aviva's Actuarial Campus Talent Program ("ACT Program") strives to provide actuarial students an opportunity to develop a breadth of experience across different functions in Property and Casualty Insurance. Successful candidates in the ACT Program will gain experience in one area of the business for each work term before rotating into another business area in successive work terms. As such, successful candidates will have diversified experience over the length of the program with possible full-time opportunity upon graduation. Ideal candidates will be self-starters with strong interpersonal and analytical skills with a drive for career development. 

Current business areas that require candidates from the ACT Program include:
 

Personal Insurance Pricing - Street and Technical Pricing
Commercial Insurance Pricing - Auto, Property and Casualty lines
Commercial Insurance Pricing - Large Accounts Pricing
Corporate Actuarial - Reserving
Analytics

Other business areas that do not currently have need, but could create opportunities for successful candidates in subsequent work terms include:

 

Corporate Actuarial - Innovation
Corporate Actuarial - Risk Management
Finance - Economic Capital and Asset Liability Management

Aviva's ACT Program Committee will assess the experience and strengths of the participants against the business areas that have need. The Committee will assign participants to business areas for each work term. 


We offer:

An open mind for new ideas and methodologies
A great team and collaborative work environment
Advanced pricing and collaboration tools
A culture of personal and professional development

Job Summary:
Join an exciting team of actuaries, data scientists and engineers at the forefront of using data to drive impactful decisions. The insurance industry has entered a period of unprecedented change, disruption and rapid technological development. Aviva recognizes that in this rapidly changing environment building a distinctive capability in Data Science is critical - demonstrating this commitment through the development of our Data Science Practice. This team is exploring the frontiers of the insurance business such as how to harness the data from connected cars to deliver new types of products to customers. This exciting role is at the heart of a high-performing Data Science team that is transforming Aviva in the Digital age. Here, we are creating a long-lasting legacy and optimizing every customer's experience. 

  

As a Data Science Co-op/Intern, you will be part of a dynamic team with exposure to different business partners and direct influence on future products and innovative solutions. You will propose machine-learning and statistical models for practical applications that impacts millions of customers.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do

Transformation of very large and complex datasets into meaningful conclusions and recommendations
Build high performing machine learning and statistical models on very large datasets
Develop novel algorithms and innovative data-driven solutions to solve business problems
Implement and help enhance existing ML pipeline, framework and modelling packages used by the team
Building and maintaining good quality code and help iteratively develop software to increase efficiencies
Show strong interest and understanding of the assigned business domain

  

Few reasons why others have joined us:

Experience the work of a Data Scientist and learn how new technologies in ML/Data Science space is shaping the insurance world
Get the opportunity to propose new innovative solutions and grow with the team
Participate in social events to meet new people, understand the team better and have some fun
Required Skills:
What you need to succeed

As a data-scientist, you will need the following skills and experience to succeed in the role:
 

Bachelor's, Master's or PhD in progress in data science, artificial intelligence, computer science, mathematics or a related field
Available to work with us for a 4-month, 8-month or 12-month period
Practical Experience with ML/AI technologies, such as scikit-learn, Keras. TensorFlow, PyTorch
Practical experience with Python or any other object-oriented programming language
Knowledge of Big data tools: Spark, Hadoop (an asset)
Knowledge of computer visioning or natural language processing (NLP) (an asset)
Advanced level understanding of machine learning fundamentals and model development principles (Generalization, Bias-Variance Tradeoff, GLMs, NLMs, etc.)(an asset)

What sets you apart

A growth mindset with versatile skills and able to work through problems from first principles.
A portfolio of projects that demonstrate your ability to draw inferences from data. This includes participation within the broader data science community including Kaggle competitions or any personal projects with open data.
Experience at all stages of data science; problem definition, data acquisition & wrangling, modelling, feature engineering and deployment.
Amazing people skills and able to translate and communicate complex algorithms to non-technical individuals. Someone who understands that it is not enough to just have a phenomenal algorithm but meaningful to build an agreement for the solution from different partners.
Experience working as part of an Agile Team
The best problems in the industry are yet to be articulated. We need someone who is creative and self-motivated

Job Title:
NEW
									



										In-Vitro Testing & Analytical Chemistry Co-op
Job Summary:
Avro Life Science is a Y Combinator, Bayer Pharmaceuticals, and Silicon Valley venture backed pre-clinical biotechnology startup developing novel transdermal drug delivery systems, focusing on the delivery of therapeutics for children and the elderly. Our mission is to bridge the gap between subcutaneous/intramuscular injections or intravenous infusions and optimal patient compliance through the development of more clinically effective and convenient drug delivery systems, in the form of transdermal patches. Our polymers serve to unlock the capabilities of the skin as a delivery route by enabling the delivery of non-ideal small molecules and small biologics in therapeutically relevant doses, fundamentally expanding the realm of possibilities for transdermal delivery, with opportunities to make an impact on patient lives in the near future.  


Avro has been named as one of the top 20 engineering projects internationally by the James Dyson Foundation, a member of the Kairos Society, and a member of Rotman's Creative Destruction Lab. We are a mission driven team of 14 based out of Kitchener/Waterloo, Ontario, working to improve patient health outcomes and quality of life through medication compliance, adherence, and therapeutic advantages afforded by effective drug delivery solutions. 


We are also interested in 8 month co-ops (preferrable, actually). If you are looking for a position for 8 months, please attach a cover letter, and mention this. 


We're looking for hard working, independent people who are handy in the lab and easy to work with otuside of the lab. At Avro, you get to take charge of a major aspect of the tech/project at hand, and bring it to life. If you love chemistry and biology and are fascinated by everything from advanced drug delivery methods to analytical techniques to materials sciences, you'll like it here.  


We value students who are able to work on a project and take full ownership of it, while maintaining flexibility and understanding the larger vision at Avro. As members of a quickly growing startup led by young founders, we place a lot of emphasis on culture - we want to make sure that you fit in with the team, and can enjoy your time working with us.  

  

The in-vitro testing and analytical chemistry coop will be responsible for validating the function of our patches using techniques including Uv-Vis spectroscopy, in-house diffusion cell testing, FTIR, HPLC, and more. A large portion of the job will involve running Franz diffusion tests at a high volume for in-vitro evaluation of our patches abilitties - this involves setting up the cells, preparing membranes for testing, sampling over the course of 72 hours, preparing buffers, and data collection. Enthusiastic students will gain significant exposure to analytical chemistry instrumentation for evaluation of the tests, and formulation development work for optiomization of our patches.  


The co-op will work with our analytical team to develop effective testing methods and procedures for primarily HPLC analysis of the samples obtained from our diffusion testing work, used to quantify the effectiveness and delivery ability of our patches. This position will require significant experience in method development, a fundamental understanding of chromatography techniques, and attention to detail throughout sample prep, development of calibration curves, method dev., etc. Previous experience in HPLC method dev, operation of Agilent 1100/1200 systems and GC/MS methodology, and SEC/GPC methodology is a significant asset.  


Ideal candidates will have experience working with a basic lab equipment and procedures, and possess a background in chemistry, polymer engineering, materials sciences, and scientific research. They should be able to follow operating protocols precisely and safely, while obtaining desirable results.  


Cover letter not necessary if your resume speaks for itself, but we've applied for co-ops before, and can tell when a cover letter is just a copy and pasted template, and when it has actually been written due to genuine interest in a position. Don't waste your time or our time with the former, as it will hurt your application, though we welcome the latter! 


We care about our co-ops at Avro - our previous students have contributed greatly to our tech, and are an essential part of our workflow. We give our students credits on research publications and patents, and do everything in our abilities to ensure that you have the best learning experience possible, and are well poised for the workforce/future co-ops.
Job Responsibilities:
Perform and optimize routine diffusion tests involving the preparation of skin samples, synthesis of transdermal patches, and assembly of Franz diffusion cells
Take samples from diffusion cells over a 48 hour time, filter and prepare for HPLC analysis
Work with research associates to optimize and develop HPLC methods for the separation and analysis of drugs of interest from diffusion cells samples, drawing on fundamental chemistry knowledge and experience with chromatographic method development
Work with research associates and senior scientists to develop MS procedures for characterization of varying drugs in heterogeneous solutions and characterizing analytes of interest
Work with research associates and senior scientists to analyze NMR and FTIR spectra to characterize materials and drugs of interest
Required Skills:
Essentials:
 

Ability to perform standard titrations and chemical reactions
Ability to work highly independently in a lab environment
Knowledge of basic biochemistry and organic chemistry
Analytical approach to variable analysis
Ability to take initiative working in a lab situation
Excellent teamwork abilities and clear communication skills
A good attitude
A really good sense of humour
Quick and independent learne

Nice to haves:

 

Basic understanding of chemical properties of polymers and appropriate synthesis methods
Understanding of the biology of the skin and transdermal drug delivery systems
Affinity for hacking and tinkering with systems
Familiarity with project management/collaborative software like Slack/Asana
Previous experience in independent scientific project management

Through rapid and iterative improvements, Cerebrum has the ability to be flexible and responsive to the clinical needs that impact the lives of patients/families.

Verify issues submitted by other parties.

Advanced technical skills.
Excellent documentation skills.

Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.

Job Summary:
Solution Developer 
 
As a Solution Developer within the Axsium Technology Center, you will have a position in our software development team.  Your primary focus will be to lead our testing imitative, which will include development and execution of automated test cases.  You may also be asked to assist with deployments, core development and design of the product and report development.

About Axsium
Axsium Group Inc. is a Workforce Management consulting firm, dedicated to delivering business and technology advisory services to large, highly distributed organizations. At Axsium, our mission is to enable organizations to maximize the "value capture" and ROI from their investment in technology-enabled workforce management (WFM) initiatives. Through a combination of technology and organizational best practice expertise, we assist our customers in implementing WFM solutions, which serve the business and organizational needs of the enterprise.
 
Axsium became a supporter of the Waterloo Coop program not long after our company was founded.  Waterloo interns and graduates have contributed to our rapid growth and success. If you are interested in joining a company where you will be consistently challenged, given opportunities to grow your career, to travel and have fun while you work.

Work closely with product owner and industrial engineers to develop and execute automated test scripts.

Experience with Ruby, javascript and ASP.net, C#

Have a deep understanding of browsers, mobile devices and automation of them

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Transportation Systems Modelling and Simulation Analyst
Job Summary:
BA Consulting Group Ltd. is a Canadian firm incorporated in 1974, specializing in urban transportation planning and design. We provide traffic, transit, pedestrian, bicycle, parking and loading solutions to facilitate the design, approval and implementation of facilities and events which attract large numbers of people. 

  

We work with owners, architects and other multi-disciplinary team members to create development plans supported by properly integrated transportation systems. BA Group has thus contributed to the success of thousands of noteworthy projects, including: residential, office, mixed-use, entertainment, retail, sports, education, health care, resort, recreation, parking, transit and industrial land uses. 

  

The organization consists of approximately 80 engineers, urban planners and administrative staff, many of whom are alums of internship programs from Canadian universities, including the University of Waterloo's co- operative study program. As a co-op student at BA Group, you will be part of a class of approximately 10 student interns and can expect to work in collaboration with numerous recent graduates and engineers-in- training. 

  

For the upcoming work term, BA Group's Modelling & Simulation department is looking to hire 2 motivated, responsible individuals with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of small-to-medium sized groups. Candidates will preferably have completed a significant portion of a Systems Design Engineering or Civil Engineering degree and have demonstrated a strong interest in Transportation Engineering and Planning. 


Examples of Typical Contributions from Co-op Students

Past co-op students in BA Group's Modelling & Simulation department have contributed significantly to the development of transportation models that were used to:
 

Identify the optimal configuration of a planned bus terminal connected to a future underground light- rail transit station, as well as investigate the impact of the recommended terminal configuration on traffic operations throughout the surrounding area's transportation system
Evaluate the effectiveness of different road network and highway interchange improvement schemes to support the development of a proposed 60,000-seat sports stadium in a rural environment
Develop coordinated and transit priority signal timing plans to maximize the effectiveness of additional signalized intersections to be constructed on heavily-used downtown Toronto corridors
Forecast future traffic, surface transit and pedestrian operations in and around an existing subway station and recommend station re-design measures to mitigate the impacts of population growth and densification from nearby development projects

Thank you for your interest in a co-op position at BA Group. If you are motivated by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment where each project requires solving challenging transportation issues, as part of an organization with a track record of putting co-op students in positions where they contribute to multiple projects and significantly develop their own individual skills, then we'd love to hear from you! 

  

Please visit our website at http://www.bagroup.com.
Job Responsibilities:
Major responsibilities and learning opportunities include:

Use and learn current technologies and programs to carry out numerical analysis and summarize data using standard traffic engineering tools
Provide assistance to our transportation modelling analysts with respect to coding and programming micro-simulation models.
Organize and execute traffic surveys and other project-related field work such as existing conditions assessments, field measurements, or general observations.
Conduct research online and in-house providing pertinent information for specific projects
Required Skills:
Job Requirements - Technical

Preferred candidates for this position will ideally have had some exposure to, or be willing to develop their technical capabilities in, some of the following areas:
 

Developing models of multi-modal (traffic, transit & pedestrians) transportation systems using industry-leading (Vissim/Visum/VisWalk, Aimsun) software tools
Using machine learning/neural networks in the TensorFlow environment, as well as operations research techniques (e.g. genetic algorithms), to calibrate and optimize transportation models
Retrieving and analysing transportation data from the Google Maps Distance Matrix API, the NextBus API and the StreetLight Data platform
Coding scripts in Python, MATLAB, SQL and VBA to support the integration and implementation of analytical features pertaining to the development, calibration and optimization of transportation models

Job Requirements - General

Preferred candidates for this position will also:
 

Be comfortable using Microsoft Office software tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access).
Possess strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
Be effective and productive when working individually and in a team environment.
Have demonstrated an interest in transportation systems engineering and modelling via course work, projects, research internships, prior co-op terms, etc.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				- Theme - Energy Production and Distribution
				
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Backpacker College® is seeking Ambassadors to research and source rooms in specific regions to ensure the supply and demand of curated rooms in Backpacker College® online system. This position will develop expertise in customer service and outreach. This position will work closely with the System Administrator Team Leader and Backpacker College®'s Marketing Team. We seek Ambassadors from across Canada who have knowledge of their community. 


Backpacker College® is the new marketplace for trusted affordable accommodation in college and university communities. We make it easy for students, guests and travelers to find and book furnished rooms on every major platform available monthly (and daily, weekly). 


Dedicated to College and University communities, we're generating opportunities for Students, Guests and Travelers to find Trusted Affordable Accommodation, Colleges and Universities to save money and time and to tap into new revenue streams! We market furnished and curated rooms. 


During a global pandemic, our accommodation services are deemed essential. We are helping higher educational communities prepare for the new normal. Backpacker College has their back. 


As Ambassador, you will conduct outreach to potential room providers and work with guests to find trusted, affordable accommodation. You will also be cross-trained in some system administration work and social media work. In collaboration with the System Administrator Team Leader and your regional marketing team, you will identify the best destinations and provide detailed information about room types to build accommodation offerings. Job Summary:
Backpacker College® is seeking System Administrators to research and source rooms in specific regions to ensure the supply and demand of curated rooms in Backpacker College® online system. This position will develop expertise in using our software. This position will work closely with the System Administrator Team Leader and Backpacker College®'s Marketing Team. We seek system administrators from across Canada who have knowledge of their community. 


Backpacker College® is the new marketplace for trusted affordable accommodation in college and university communities. We make it easy for students, guests and travelers to find and book furnished rooms on every major platform available monthly (and daily, weekly). 


Dedicated to College and University communities, we're generating opportunities for Students, Guests and Travelers to find Trusted Affordable Accommodation, Colleges and Universities to save money and time and to tap into new revenue streams! We market furnished and curated rooms. 


During a global pandemic, our accommodation services are deemed essential. We are helping higher educational communities prepare for the new normal. Backpacker College has their back. 


As System Administrator, you will conduct online research, including on social media, to ensure room offerings are consistent with market demand. You will use our software to maintain our accommodation database and ensure customer and room booking transactions are effective and efficient. In collaboration with the System Administrator Team Leader and your regional marketing team, you will identify the best destinations and provide detailed information about room types to build accommodation offerings. Your regional team goal will be to maximize revenues. 


System Administrators will work up to 37.5 hours per week. 


After a successful 90-day period, you will have the opportunity to own stock options in the company you're helping grow.

Job Summary:
In today's accounting environment you have more information, more opportunity and more choices.  Where to launch your professional career is a big decision.  At Baker Tilly, we take your future as seriously as you do. We're growing and are on the lookout for top talent ready and eager to embrace a BT Life. 


With member firms from coast to coast, the Baker Tilly Canada Cooperative is one of the country's largest associations of chartered accounting firms, As an all-Canadian network, we have a long-lasting reputation for value-added audit, tax and advisory solutions, due to the depth and breadth of our in-house skills, customized offerings and service excellence. Through our strong network infrastructure, shared expertise, resources and offices across the country, our independent member firms provide clients ranging in size from large, publicly traded companies to owner-managed and emerging businesses with a full complement of professional services across every major industry sector. (Please visit the web-site for our Ottawa Office at bakertilly.ca to find out more). 


At Baker Tilly, we care about your long-term development, so we have created a comprehensive process for building true accountants from the ground up.  We feel that this approach differentiates us from other firms.  Co-op students at Baker Tilly are exposed to a wide variety of work, due to the diversity and size of our client base and the breadth of our services.  Our co-op students learn to prepare an entire file, including financial statements and related tax returns, under the guidance of a manager which makes the work more interesting and more relevant to developing your overall technical knowledge and skills.     


Life at Baker Tilly is rewarding on so many levels both professionally and personally: competitive compensation, a recognized work life balance and the ability to contribute with our firm to the community. Where you start career is one of the most important decisions you will ever make. We know that the success of our firm goes hand in hand with the success of our people. If you are a driven, ambitious, hard-working individual who is looking for an opportunity to shine - we want to hear from you!
