Job Summary:
Software Developer Co-op
Global Markets & Research Technology Canada
Toronto, Ontario


Bank of America is one of the world's largest financial institutions, serving individual consumers, small and middle market businesses and large corporations with a full range of banking, investing, asset management and other financial and risk-management products and services. Following the acquisition of Merrill Lynch on January 1, 2009, Bank of America is among the world's leading wealth management companies and is a global leader in corporate and investment banking and trading across a broad range of asset classes serving corporations, governments, institutions and individuals around the world.  In Canada, Bank of America has a strong market position on which to continue to build, as well as a clear commitment to the market. 



Global Markets & Research Technology Canada (GMRT)

GMRT Canada enables equity and fixed-income securities trade execution and processing, on electronic trade enabled markets or over the counter. As part of Global Markets & Investment Banking, GMRT Canada delivers trade execution and post-trade processing service on Canadian markets to internal trading, operation, risk, finance teams as well as external clients. Closely working with users from front office to back office, this group designs, builds and supports a platform for trade capturing, allocation, settlement, repository and reporting . 


This position will be part of a team of application development and support staff with direct responsibility for all local application technology supporting Fixed Income and Equities trading and sales. The group is also responsible for all mid-office and downstream interfaces in direct support of the local trading businesses. The suite of applications is a collection of vendor, global and some in-house developed applications requiring coordination to integrate in a manner consistent with organizational standards and business goals.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities :

The successful candidate will be responsible for the delivery of new functionality for trade capturing and processing, working within a local development team with close ties to end users. 


GMRT Canada team supports several key products used by traders, operations, risk, finance and customer service teams inside the firm. 


Responsibilities will include:

- Development of Java applications for data transformation and delivery 

- Generating management reports to highlight potential data quality problems or inconsistencies 

- Development of high performance trade processing engine to facilitate high frequency trading 

- Development of sophisticated trade allocation engine to fulfill varying client requirements 

- Creating test cases for various components and perform QA testing
Required Skills:
Qualifications


Must Have:

- Core Java 

- SQL 

- Excellent communication skills 

- Strong documentation skills 

- Quick learner 

- Organized, hard worker and team player 


Desired Skills:

- Software development tools: SCM such as SVN; IDE such as Eclipse 

- Messaging tool, such as TIBCO RV or IBM MQ 

- Knowledge of Shell scripting in Unix/Linux environment 

- Knowledge of the securities markets

Job Summary:
BMO Capital Markets

BMO Capital Markets is a leading, full-service North American-based financial services provider offering equity and debt underwriting, corporate lending and project financing, merger and acquisitions advisory services, securitization, treasury management, market risk management, debt and equity research and institutional sales and trading. BMO Capital Markets has approximately 2,600 professionals in 33 locations around the world, including 18 offices in North America. 


BMO Capital Markets is a member of BMO Financial Group (NYSE, TSX: BMO), one of the largest diversified financial services providers in North America with US$760 billion total assets and nearly 43,000 employees as of January 31, 2021. 


Program Overview:

The Co-op Analyst program is designed for candidates between their third and fourth undergraduate years. Co-op Analysts will participate in a one week training and orientation program and are assigned to a specific Investment Banking product or industry group during the 15-week program.  In addition to this on-the-job experience, the program includes the opportunity to network across various business groups, learn about the culture of BMO Capital Markets, participate in training and learning seminars, and obtain career guidance from dedicated mentors.

Enrolled in an undergraduate degree program; graduating in 2023, 2024, 2025
A minimum cGPA of 3.4/4.0
Minimum of two finance and accounting classes with grades "B" or higher
Outstanding academic, achievement and peer recognition
Excellent analytical skills in business, financial and credit analysis areas
Strong interpersonal skills used within a demanding team environment
Ability to attentively review, assess and provide detailed information daily on multiple projects in an organized manner
Excellent capacity to independently function as part of a team through self-motivation
Strong work ethic
A high level of integrity
Preference will be given to those students in their 2nd or 3rd co-op term with a concentration in finance, accounting, economics, engineering and math (statistics)

Job Responsibilities:
Client Services and Reporting - Weighting: 50%

Utilize technical skills to efficiently and effectively extract and manipulate data from client databases or other source systems to meet various reporting needs (e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc reports)

Job Summary:
BMO Capital Markets

BMO Capital Markets is a leading, full-service North American-based financial services provider offering equity and debt underwriting, corporate lending and project financing, merger and acquisitions advisory services, securitization, treasury management, market risk management, debt and equity research and institutional sales and trading. BMO Capital Markets has approximately 2,600 professionals in 33 locations around the world, including 18 offices in North America. 


BMO Capital Markets is a member of BMO Financial Group (NYSE, TSX: BMO), one of the largest diversified financial services providers in North America with US$760 billion total assets and nearly 43,000 employees as of January 31, 2021. 


Program Overview:

Sales & Trading Analysts work in the Global Markets Group of BMO Capital Markets, comprising Global Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities (FICC), Global Equities & Financing Solutions (GEFS), Global Markets Engineering (GME) and Balance Sheet Solutions (BSS), serving our corporate, institutional and government clients. 


Co-op Analysts are assigned to a specific Global Markets group during the 15-week program. In addition to the on-the-job experience, each intern will complete one week of training and participate in professional development sessions and events throughout the term. 


Co-op students have the opportunity to join one of the following areas within Global Markets:
 

Global Equities & Financing Solutions
Global Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities
Global Markets Engineering
Balance Sheet Solutions

All candidates will go through a rigorous interview process and team assignments will be made closer to the start of the term based on previous experience, interest, and educational background.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:

The role includes performing a variety of analytical and administrative projects and tasks. These assignments will vary widely from day to day and may include developing presentation materials using PowerPoint and Excel, programming and shadowing.

Job Summary:
As a co-op/intern student at BMO, you will have the opportunity to be heard, keep growing and make a difference.  You will be part of our campus program to gain the skills and knowledge needed to take on roles similar to the description listed below. 

Our student experience is designed to integrate you to the BMO team from day one by adding value in the work you do.  You will have the opportunity to participate in programs such as the Women in Technology Mentorship Program, BMO First Friend peer assignment, BMO Social Squad student-led activities, BMO U corporate learning platform and access to various Employee Resource Groups to further develop your network within BMO.  

Interested in learning more about our campus program?  Stay up-to-date with BMO Campus Recruitment by following us on Twitter @BMOonCampus & Instagram @BMO_on_Campus. 

Note: Only students currently enrolled in an academic program and returning to their studies will be considered for Co-op/Internship opportunities. Student who recently graduated are invited to apply to our New Grad opportunities which are available at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en/new-grad 

To apply for this opportunity, please submit your cover letter, resume and an unofficial copy of your academic transcript. By applying for this general posting, you will be considered for a number of different student opportunities across multiple locations. If you are selected to move forward, you will be provided additional information.
Job Responsibilities:
Understands that the success of a developer is to understand the core business processes of the business unit and business requirements as well as the architecture patterns and technology strategy (e.g., Transformation, SmartCore, DevOps). Conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements. Writes, configures, and integrates code to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy. Understands the implications of various components (including technology strategy & architecture) to the overall design of a program, system, or eco-system. Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security). Works toward the objective of defect free software. Ensures that systems functionally meet requirements, align with architecture and promote the development of common assets. Supports the resolution of production issues and problems. Makes recommendations to improve BMO processes & systems. 

Supports research and development of development frameworks, and definition of standards. 

Leads and implements initiatives as required to deliver business objectives. 

Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues. 

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment. 

Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues. 

Reviews the work of other team members as required. 

Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs. 

Decomposes business requirements and translates them into detailed design specifications and code. 

Interacts with key business & technology stakeholders to define, analyze, and deliver requirements that reflect the needs of both the business and end-customers. 

Assesses the costs and benefits for different solutions and recommend/decide on appropriate designs. 

Designs solutions, writes code, performs unit testing, develops appropriate artefacts / documentation, and facilitates final delivery. 

Supports production issues, includes independently completing root-cause analysis and diagnosis. 

Devises new algorithms and data structures for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with architectural patterns. 

Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets. 

Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness. 

Supports the management of specific project deliverables & outcomes. 

Identifies opportunities to strengthen the development capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks. 

Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning. 

Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. 

Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 

Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. 

Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Required Skills:
Qualifications: 

As a full-time employee, we would require 2-4 years of experience, however as part of the BMO campus program, we are looking for motivated individuals with a strong desire to learn.     

Proficient level of knowledge in domain. 

Knowledge of software development practices, concepts, and technology obtained through formal training and/or work experience. 

Knowledge of required programming languages and can code with little oversight. 

Knowledge of technical/business environment and processes. 

Understand functional aspects and technical behavior of the underlying operating system, development environment, and deployment practices. 

Have facility with and understanding of the ecosystem that code operates in. 

Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. 

Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 

Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 

Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 

Influence skills - In-depth. 

Data driven decision making - In-depth.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Delivers operational processes and provides after-sales support to the personal wealth and asset management businesses and stakeholders. May function as a problem-solving resource for more junior staff.

Executes routine tasks such as service requests, transactions, queries, etc. within relevant service level agreements. 

Provides accurate and timely processing of transactions, activities, services, etc. to respond to stakeholder requests in compliance with regulatory and risk controls. 

Provides accurate, consistent, and knowledgeable responses to internal/external stakeholder questions and requests. 

Follows documented policies and procedures to execute day-to-day transactions, activities, processes and meet all Service Level Agreements (SLAs).

Job Responsibilities:
Supports the research and development of quantitative risk modeling methodologies and related strategies in support of the management of risks arising from business/group portfolios and products. Applies knowledge of analytics algorithms and technologies to develop forward looking models and analytic solutions that ensure risks are properly identified, understood and risk related strategies are enabled. Summarizes statistical findings, draws business conclusions, and presents actionable business recommendations used in the management of risks and related activities e.g. associated internal controls; enterprise-wide stress testing and scenario analysis; capital modelling; valuations. Drives innovation through the development of data products that can be leveraged across the organization and establishes best practices as well influences data governance guidelines and policies. May specialize in one or more risk categories e.g. Credit Risk, Market Risk, Interest Rate Risk, etc. 

Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. 

Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of solutions. 

Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions. 

Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 

Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy. 

Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues. 

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. 

Ensures alignment between stakeholders. 

Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations. 

Manages databases and provides support for analysis, forecasting and/or data visualization, ensuring adherence with data governance standards. 

Coordinates the management of databases; ensures alignment and integration of data in adherence with data governance standards. 

Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues. 

Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. 

Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting. 

Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues. 

Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives.

Works with various data owners to discover and select available data sources from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system) to fulfill analytical needs.

Summarizes statistical findings and draws conclusions and presents actionable business recommendations. Presents findings & recommendations in a simple, clear way to drive action. 

Documents data flow, systems and processes in data collection to improve efficiency and apply use cases. 

Performs experimental design approaches to validate finding or test hypotheses. 

Uses the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns. 

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. Ensures alignment between stakeholders. 

Supports development of tools and delivers training for data and analytics. 

Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 

Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes.

Job Summary:
We're a small, rapidly expanding startup within the emerging fitness data analytics space.  We offer unique, industry-leading algorithms for analyzing, optimizing and improving athletic performance. We've won multiple awards for our applications and products, achieving great success with a small, brilliant team.   


We're looking for talented and self-driven individuals to play an essential role in our success, applying their education and skills to help improve and expand our offerings. 


Company website: www.baronbiosys.com

Product website: www.xertonline.com

Gain experience working in a small, dynamic startup environment, working directly with founders.
Office is centrally located in Toronto, very close to the Jane subway station with lots of food options and things to do in the area.
Opportunities for company indoor/outdoor cycling and running as part of our software testing.

This front-end software engineer role involves responsibilties across a variety of disciplines from web and mobile application development with some back-end server application development.  Key responsibilities include:
 

Web and mobile applications architecture, design, development, testing and documentation,

Optimizing and streamlining software development and testing lifecycle.

Hired students will be assigned work commensurate with their skill, interest and priorities.  There are many opportunities to learn and apply advanced skills that students have learned at school given the breadth of our technology stack and the variety of projects that we have available. 


Past co-ops have found the work term very challenging and valuable professionally but also fun and rewarding when their contributions are rolled out onto live systems.

Job Summary:
Barracuda FX is a leading provider of end-to-end, front-office foreign exchange platforms for medium and large sell-side banks. We provide complete systems covering trading, sales, compliance, reporting, and all front office functions. We take a product-led and engineering-focused approach to delivering advanced technology to demanding customers. We leverage advanced, message-based architectures to create systems that process billions of dollars in transactions across five contents each day. 


We also believe that creating the best technology is not enough. We have a deep commitment to providing the best service and support in the industry. We partner with our customers to solve the hardest problems they face and ensure they achieve their goals. We are hands-on and solutions-oriented, and we understand that we succeed only when our customers succeed. 


At Barracuda FX, we are committed to building a thriving, diverse, and connected culture where people feel welcomed and are invited to bring their whole, authentic selves to work every day. 


Software Engineers develop state-of-the-art C++ applications for our groundbreaking automated foreign exchange platform.  You will own development projects end-to-end through many fast-cycle version iterations. As part of our remarkably high-performing team of collaborative, talented engineers, you will have significant freedom and self-direction to tackle a wealth of interesting, challenging problems as we push the technological envelope.
Job Responsibilities:
Work in C++ and Python to design, implement, and release state-of-the-art components and applications for mission-critical, high-performance, globally distributed systems related to automated trading
Produce exemplary code and deliver completed projects on time
Perform unit and system-level testing on your application and all affected systems
Work closely with a mentor to ensure effective coordination and integration between interrelated projects
Required Skills:
Programming skills and grasp of software engineering principles with experience programming in at least one industry-standard language (C++, C#)
Knowledge of a scripting language (Perl, Python, Ruby, JavaScript, etc.)
Familiarity with SQL and databases

Job Summary:
Barrick is a sector-leading gold company which owns five of the industry's Top 10 Tier One gold assets with advanced exploration and development projects all around the world. Our vision is to be the world's best gold mining company by operating in a safe, profitable and responsible manner. The company is headquartered in Toronto, Canada. Barrick shares are listed on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges. 

Barrick has a significant sophisticated corporate treasury function based at its head office in Toronto. This function is responsible for managing currency, interest rate and commodity risk exposures for the company, as well as its liquidity and financing requirements. Barrick uses derivative instruments, where appropriate, as 

a means to manage those risk exposures. The treasury function is segregated between a front office and a back office to ensure adequate segregation of duties for internal controls purposes, but both groups work closely to ensure the effectiveness and efficiency of treasury activities.
Job Responsibilities:
• Confirm daily trades transacted with counterparties to ensure accuracy of spot, metal, currency, interest rate and energy derivative instruments. 

• Respond in a prompt and professional manner to email messages and phone inquiries from internal and external business partners. 

• Assist in the compilation of reports to management on the company's hedging programs. 

• Assist in validating rates used for the valuation of derivative positions. 

• Maintain up-to-date and accurate process documentation. 

• Work with the Manager / Senior Analyst in the Treasury Back Office to analyze risk exposures, hedge effectiveness and ad hoc analysis as required to support treasury activities. 

• Evaluate current business practices and processes and implement improvements. 

• Assist with MD&A binder preparation.
Required Skills:
•    Knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications with advance skill sets in Excel. 

•    Working knowledge of Bloomberg is an asset but not required. 

•    SAP system experience preferred 

•    Able to prioritize work, multi-task, and manage deadlines 

•    Detail oriented 

•    General knowledge of financial markets and derivatives is preferred 

•    Strong communication skills, written and verbal required

Job Summary:
Commissioning Technician (Internship/Co-op) 

  

Overview:

A Commissioning Technician (Intern / Co-op) works with other Bastian Solutions employees, customers and suppliers to utilize the latest technologies to integrate material handling systems for complex applications. The process involves understanding the customer's goals and objectives, and developing smart engineered solutions to meet these goals. Integrating large scale Material Handling solutions often involving our Controls, Software, Robotics, and Consulting Teams within the project. Technologies used in this position include the full scope of Material Handling with conveyors ranging from simple gravity conveyor up to cutting edge shoe sorters with servo driven diverts, robotics, Automated Storage and Retrieval Systems from a variety of vendors, and complex add on such as automated carton erection or print and applies. The Commissioning Technician is responsible for supporting automation projects and will be capable of component selection, device troubleshooting, HMI development, PLC programming and debugging, Software debugging, onsite system checkout and startup, and validation of System Throughputs and Efficiencies.  As experience grows, the Commissioning Technician may be relied on to help tie reports and code standards into engineering design standards, assist with harmonizing the various teams, and perform other duties under the guidance of the execution team. 


The Commissioning Technician helps our company meet its mission to help our customers compete in their markets by providing the best material handling system solutions and technology. 


For an overview of the company and the work we do check out this video -  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gCDHvEjDKA0&t=26s

Close coordination with Project Manager

Previous experience with PLC's, HMI's, SCADA
Ability to work within a team environment, good communication and organization skills
Develop and implement standard practices to ensure quality improvement and cost reduction
Solve technical problems either individually or though collaboration
Deliver successful automation projects with regards to customer satisfaction, schedule, time, and budget
Support the Systems Checklist for systems projects

Qualifications:

Currently working towards a technical degree
Experience with Automation, specifically material handling systems a plus
Experience with Allen Bradley or Siemens PLCs & HMIs (or equivalent) a plus
Aptitude for Hands on Electrical and Mechanical troubleshooting

Extremely computer literate with MS Office products
Excellent problem solving and time management skills
Ability to work in the Saint-Hubert area

Working for BBA means being part of a team of talented people who have the passion to succeed and the drive to excel in order to provide first-class service to clients.

Recognized for its extensive field experience and cutting-edge expertise, BBA has been delivering a comprehensive range of consulting engineering services for 40 years, from studies and design to commissioning and operational support. Job Summary:
FT for 4-month term, possible renewal. January 15, 2022 to April 15th, 2022 

The British Columbia Housing Management Commission (BC Housing) is a crown agency of the provincial government and is responsible for delivering a range of housing programs for British Columbians. BC Housing works in partnership with the private, non-profit and co-operative sectors, Indigenous communities, provincial health authorities and ministries, other levels of government and community groups to develop a range of housing options. New housing is created across the housing continuum, from supportive housing for the homeless to affordable rental and owner-purchased housing for middle income British Columbians. 

In delivering on our strategic direction and mandate, BC Housing is also committed to working in partnership with Indigenous peoples to embrace and implement the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP) and the Truth and Reconciliation Commission of Canada (TRC): Calls to Action. BC Housing is also committed to taking action towards the goals of equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging in the work we do, involving employees, our partners and the people we serve through our programs and services. BC Housing's commitment to sustainability is reflected in our Livegreen Housing Sustainability plan.  

The Executive Office supports the Chief Executive Officer with respect to responsibilities for the overall administration of staff and operations, strategy development, support to the Board of Commissioners to ensure good governance of BC Housing, and the new Office of Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging (OEDIB). The Executive Office promotes effective liaison and relationship building with a broad range of external stakeholders and government representatives, and works with Vice Presidents, the senior management team and business areas to ensure effective alignment of corporate goals and strategies. It also liaises with Communications on sustainability communication, issues management and media relations. 

BC Housing's Sustainability & Resilience team is currently developing a Sustainability & Resilience Strategy Implementation Plan. Additionally, an external consultant team is assisting in the development of the internal and external engagement to support that work, and in particular the development of specific actions, KPIs and accountability metrics for each department within BC Housing. 

The work of this co-op student would be to develop the Sustainability and Resilience webinar series, that forms a critical part of this larger overall engagement strategy. The student would be assisting in planning and coordinating to engage both internal and external stakeholders in this webinar series, and the meetings with both internal and external stakeholders that will be necessary to develop it. The student will assist with the following research, engagement and planning activities that fit into the broader sustainability and resilience engagement planning process:
Job Responsibilities:
POSITION SUMMARY   

Reporting to the Senior Strategic Advisor, Sustainability & Resiliency, the Co-op Student provides practical, detail-oriented support to the research, planning and coordination of the Sustainability & Resilience Webinar series for BC Housing staff & partners, particularly for the Integrated Building Adaptation and Mitigation Assessment (IBAMA) and the Mobilizing Building Adaptation & Resilience (MBAR) initiatives. The student will support the development of staff and industry engagement events including the Sustainability & Resilience webinar series for BC Housing staff & partners. 

This is a webinars series which the student will assist in help to coordinate, research, develop and plan, which will include stakeholders that are both internal and external to BC Housing, and speakers and panelists on topics which may include, but are not limited to, the below, all of which will require the student to do research:
 

Resilience and adaptation in new and existing affordable housing: speakers may include architects, engineers, landscape architects, builders or others who have participated in notable projects, including, but not limited to, those who may have participated in the past in BC Housings' IBAMA or MBAR initiatives.
Using future climate data for design: what's new after BC's heatwave: speakers may include scientists that can give BC Housing direction on the best climate data sets to use.
Funding to support sustainable & resilient buildings: Current grant funding opportunities to support research, design and capital investment into sustainability and resilience initiatives that are applicable to BC Housing's ongoing expenditures into its portfolio of new and existing buildings, to support IBAMA and / or MBAR pilot projects which may require additional funding. This will involve research: a scan of provincial, municipal, federal and other funding currently available and speakers may be from the funding associations or they may include our external partners such as key stakeholders from local municipalities, local Indigenous groups, and internally key stakeholders will include development managers and directors. From there, it will involve putting together the webinar.
Other webinars on various sustainability and resilience issues: We would be looking for the student to do research into how other sustainability and resilience topics may or may not provide value to BC Housings' tenants and to BC taxpayers, such as:
	 
  
Indigenous approaches to sustainable and resilient design,
Standards such as passive house, living building challenge,
Strategies such as blue / green infrastructure, prefabricated design, modular housing
Leading technologies to adapt to extreme heat and smoke, such as heat pumps, misters, landscaping (blue / green infrastructure) solutions to create shade and reduce urban heat island, etc.



A final report will include a high-level overview of each of the webinar topics, the research that the student did on these, and the engagement / webinar that was planned. This co-op student posting counts as one work term. 


Knowledge & Skills:  

 

Research, including ability to locate and use databases, government websites, scholarly journals, news sites. Ability to review and summarize complex ideas into plain language.
Highly organized (seems this position is significantly about managing logistics recording, tracking speakers, taking action on decisions and direction?)
Organizational and project management skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks and adhere to timelines. 
Effective oral and written communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills. 
Demonstrated ability to function well as a member of a team and to receive constructive feedback. 
Demonstrated ability to be a self-starter and take initiative to move a project forward after being provided some direction.
Proficiency with Windows, MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Internet tools.

Job Summary:
Career Opportunity: Co-op/Internship
Investment Strategy & Risk - Strategic Investment Research (Winter 2022)
Use your research and investment skills in a fast-growing company where you can have an impact. The British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI) is currently seeking a Strategic Investment Research co-op student/intern for the Fall 2021 (September to December) work terms to provide research and analytics support across a range of investment subjects, including climate change and environmental, social and governance (ESG).
What You Need to Know
BCI manages a globally diversified portfolio of assets valued at $171.3 billion and is one of Canada's largest institutional investors. We invest globally to support pension funds and others for more than 30 clients based in British Columbia. We are proud to have been chosen as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers and BC's Top Employers. These national and provincial competitions recognize employers who offer exceptional workplaces for their employees.
The Strategic Investment Research co-op/intern will work within our Investment Strategy & Risk department. This is a great opportunity for you to learn and apply your knowledge to support the development and implementation of a total fund ESG strategy, the development of cross asset investment research, and the implementation of firm-wide investment projects.
Who you will work with
You will work with the Strategic Investment Research group within the Investment Strategy & Risk department (ISR). The ISR department plays a key role in BCI's long-term investment strategy by influencing and advising on investment decisions made by clients, management and asset classes. ISR consists of three branches: Investment Strategy, Strategic Asset Allocation and Investment Risk.
Investment Strategy includes the maintenance of a framework for understanding and estimating variable risk premiums over relevant time periods, research of relevant macro-economic issues including assessment of the current business cycle dynamics and research of emerging economic or financial trends, opportunities and risks, all at an asset class and total fund level.
The Strategic Asset Allocation branch assists clients with developing tailored investment policies that achieve their investment objectives consistent with their investment philosophies, funding policies and risk tolerances.
Investment Risk includes the maintenance of systems for monitoring, measuring and estimating various forms of relevant investment risks across the various asset classes that BCI currently invests or may invest in and aggregating that risk at a total fund level.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will be Doing


Work under the supervision of the Strategic Investment Research Manager or ESG Strategy & Risk Manager to assist with various projects


Collect, organize and analyze market, climate change, and ESG data to support investment recommendations


Research new investment strategy initiatives, provide recommendations and work collaboratively in a team environment


Prepare weekly and monthly reports for the department and management teams


Conduct specific research and data analysis on carbon measurements within the fund


Participate in the development and review of new investment strategy and risk initiatives


Ad-hoc projects and tasks as assigned by the team
Required Skills:

Has a passion for investing and a drive to continually learn about economics, financial markets, and integration of ESG and climate change in the investment process


Knowledge of finance and capital markets is desirable


Demonstrates an ability to gather and process large data sets with advanced Excel functionality, and present it in a concise manner


Ability to present data in an intuitive manner


Likes to solve problems using creative and innovative solutions


Demonstrates they are a team player, but can also work independently


Demonstrates an extremely strong work ethic and displays initiative to strive to deliver value above and beyond the job description


B+ equivalent cumulative GPA with an A- or better in economics courses


Preference for students who have shown initiative and passion for the investment industry


Required Skills


A fundamental knowledge of basic business and investment-related disciplines is essential


Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing


Exhibit a high level of professionalism and excellent interpersonal skills


Ability to meet deadlines while maintaining accuracy, excellent product quality, and attention to detail


Has an interest in investment management, a dedication to hard work, commitment to the highest ethical standards, and an eagerness to learn


Strong research skills combined with analytical and problem-solving abilities


Ability to use Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Outlook


Familiarity with Bloomberg would be an asset

Job Summary:
Career Opportunity: Co-op/Internship
INVESTMENT STRATEGY & RISK - STRATEGIC ASSET ALLOCATION (FALL 2021)
Use your research and investment skills in a fast-growing company where you can have an impact. The British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI) is currently seeking a Strategic Asset Allocation co-op student/intern for the Fall 2021 work term (September to December) to provide research and analytics support across a broad range of investment subjects, including portfolio construction, long-term capital market assumptions and peer comparisons.
What You Need to Know
BCI manages a globally diversified portfolio of assets valued at $171.3 billion and is one of Canada's largest institutional investors. We invest globally to support pension funds and others for more than 30 clients based in British Columbia. We are proud to have been chosen as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers and BC's Top Employers. These national and provincial competitions recognize employers who offer exceptional workplaces for their employees.
The Strategic Asset Allocation co-op/intern will work within our Investment Strategy & Risk department. This is a great opportunity for you to learn and apply your knowledge to support the development and preparation of asset mix reviews and other custom analyses related to our clients' asset mixes, investment strategies and other investment topics.
Who you will work with
You will work with the Strategic Asset Allocation team within our Investment Strategy & Risk department.
The Investment Strategy & Risk department plays a key role in BCI's long-term investment strategy by influencing investment decisions made by clients, management and the asset classes. They provide economic outlooks, evaluate broad risks to the economy and financial markets, make research recommendations on new asset classes or investment strategies and help to identify and manage investment risk. The primary functions of the department include the following:


Investment Research and Governance includes the maintenance of a framework for understanding and estimating variable risk premiums over relevant time periods, research of relevant macro-economic issues including assessment of the current business cycle dynamics and research of emerging economic or financial trends, opportunities and risks, all at an asset class and total fund level.


The Strategic Asset Allocation branch assists clients with developing tailored investment policies that achieve their investment objectives consistent with their investment philosophies, funding policies, and risk tolerances, advocates for client driven investment solutions, manages the BCI product shelf and coordinates investment planning.


Investment Risk includes the management of processes and systems for monitoring, measuring, and estimating various forms of relevant investment risks across the various asset classes that BCI currently invests or may invest in and aggregating that risk at a total fund level. This team also supports the asset classes in providing independent assessments for deals and strategies.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will be Doing


Support the team in the development of clients' ALM studies, strategic asset allocation, and investment policy recommendations to ensure that clients' investment strategies and policies are appropriate and prudent given the nature of the funds, their underlying liabilities, and unique characteristics or circumstances


Support the management of BCI's product shelf to ensure a client-focused rationale for each pooled fund


Assist with the development of long-term forward-looking capital market assumptions and simulations


Assist with annual investment planning activities


Ad-hoc projects and tasks as assigned by the team

Exhibit a high level of professionalism and excellent interpersonal skills

Has an interest in investment management, a dedication to hard work, commitment to the highest ethical standards, and an eagerness to learn

Use your quantitative and software development skills in a fast-growing company where you can have an impact. What You Need to Know

The Total Fund Management (TFM) team manages and owes a financial database of portfolio positions, asset prices, market signals and external manager performance which is being used for TFMs portfolio rebalancing and benchmarking/performance objectives setting processes. Each day, we rely on our professionals to provide exceptional service, and help our clients by providing advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth. 


Why BDO?

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
 

We enable you to engage with the firm's strategic plan, and be a key contributor to the success and growth of the firm.

Your opportunity
Our Oakville office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student Developer to join the BDO Cybersecurity Engineering team from January to April, 2022 and own the following responsibilities:

Experience with C++, C#, Java, Python, JavaScript, or equivalent widely used OOP languages.

Knowledge of cybersecurity frameworks and industry-leading practices such as OWASP, NIST CSF, PCI DSS, Canadian Center for Cybersecurity

In turn, we offer an environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth. 


Why BDO?

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
 

We enable you to engage with the firm's strategic plan, and be a key contributor to the success and growth of the firm.
We help you be the best professional you can be in our services, industries and markets.
Achieve your personal goals outside of the office and make an impact on your community.

Giving back, it adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community. 


Experience that matters: As a student at BDO, you will be able to develop your professional skills while making an impact. Our firm allows you to connect directly with clients, work on a diverse range of files and projects, and has opportunities for future growth after you graduate. 


Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us. 

Ready to make your mark at BDO? We require all students to apply directly online to our BDO Career website https://www.bdo.ca/en-ca/careers/students.  Click "Apply now" to send your up-to-date application to one of our Campus Recruitment Specialists. Please upload your cover letter, resume, and transcripts in ONE PDF document into the 'Resume' application field. 


To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page.
Job Responsibilities:
Your opportunity
Our Ottawa Kent Street office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student to join the Risk Advisory Services team from January to April 2022 or September to December 2022, and own the following responsibilities:

 

Assist in delivering individual client initiatives for the delivery of supplier engagement / procurement advisory services
Establish & maintain a trusted advisor strong relationship with clients, delivering high quality, professional & responsive service.
Effectively communicate with clients and team members regarding project progress updates and issues

How do we define success for your role?

 

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.
Required Skills:
Your experience and education

You are currently working towards a degree/diploma, focused in business
You have a desire to provide outstanding client service and a commitment to teamwork
You have proven leadership skill and can take initiative to seek understanding
You display strong problem solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration

Job Responsibilities:
Your opportunity
Our Montreal office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student to join the Risk Advisory Services team from January to April 2022 and own the following responsibilities: 

 

Work on a variety of engagement types, including internal audit, Third Party Assurance CSAE 3416/ SSAE 18 (SOC1, SOC2, SOC3), enterprise risk management, internal controls design and assessment, program evaluation, independent project review, business process enhancement/re-design, and IT general and application controls assessments
Review, document, evaluate, and test business processes and internal controls for design and operational effectiveness in a wide range of environments
Maintain a proactive and logical approach to information gathering, with an ability to combine complex ideas and present information in a concise manner
Assist with the development of risk assessments
Develop client deliverables, including analyses, recommendations, and reporting documentation
Demonstrate and apply strong project management skills, inspire teamwork with engagement team members, and use current technology and tools to enhance the effectiveness and quality of deliverables and services

How do we define success for your role?

 

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.
Required Skills:
Your experience and education

You are fully bilingual in both English and French
You are enrolled in an accounting focused post-secondary program with the intention of pursuing the CPA designation
You have a strong interest in pursuing a career in risk advisory with an interest in exploring the CIA or CISA designations
You have a desire to provide outstanding client service and a commitment to teamwork
You have excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate ideas effectively, both written and orally
You have strong analytical and problem solving skills
You have the ability to prioritize competing deliverables with varying deadlines
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
Application Documents Required: Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Responsibilities:
Your opportunity
Our Toronto office is looking for a Co-op or Intern to join the Risk Advisory Services team from January to April 2022 and own the following responsibilities:

 

Effectively engage with clients and execute risk management, third party assurance and internal audit projects under the supervision of your Managers.
Work on a variety of client engagements, primarily in the areas of internal audit, Third Party Assurance CSAE 3416/ SSAE 18 (SOC1, SOC2, SOC3), enterprise risk management, internal controls design and assessment, program evaluation, independent project review, business process enhancement/re-design, and IT general and application controls assessments
Review, document, evaluate, and test business processes and internal controls for design and operational effectiveness in a wide range of environments and industries
Develop client deliverables, including risk assessments, analyses, recommendations, and reporting documentation
Collaborate with engagement teams to establish timelines and ensure high quality client service through daily progress of fieldwork and communication of updates to Managers and staff
Support in driving innovation in service delivery; ensure delivery is in line with firm's Quality and Risk management requirements/expectations
Assist Managers with business development proposals on existing/new clients
Assist Managers in developing/refreshing methodologies related to our existing/new solutions
Maintain a proactive and logical approach to information gathering and present complex ideas through clear communication
Demonstrate and apply strong project management skills, inspire teamwork with engagement team members, and use current technology and tools to enhance the effectiveness and quality of deliverables and services
Solicit and apply feedback from Senior Consultants and Managers to enhance the quality and efficiency of future engagements
Build positive working relationships with clients and identify improvements for future assignments

  

How do we define success for your role? 

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspects of your work: Integrity, Respect, and Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities
Clients and colleagues describe you as a positive professional who delivers high quality work
You identify, recommend, and are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive and engaging work environment that develops, retains, and attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You demonstrate agility, flexibility and an eagerness to deliver services on time and on budget
You grow your expertise through learning and professional development  
You conduct research and prepare client presentations, information memorandums and contribute to thought leadership documents
You contribute to consulting engagements in the capacity of a team member - deliver quality output within assigned timelines
Required Skills:
Your experience and education

You are enrolled in an accounting focused post-secondary program with the intention of pursuing a professional designation (CPA, CIA, CISA, etc.)
You have previous experience in a professional experience in a risk advisory, consulting, internal audit, or external audit setting
You have a strong acumen for information technology and can assess information from an audit perspective
You can diagnose project issues, build solutions, and draft impactful communications for clients
You display strong problem solving and communication skills
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
Application Documents Required: Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, we rely on our professionals to provide exceptional service, and help our clients by providing advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth. 


Why BDO?

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
 

We enable you to engage with the firm's strategic plan, and be a key contributor to the success and growth of the firm.
We help you be the best professional you can be in our services, industries and markets.
Achieve your personal goals outside of the office and make an impact on your community.

Earn your CPA Designation

At BDO, we are committed to the success of students pursuing their CPA designation. We provide pre-approved programs across our 100+ offices, mentorship and support, reimbursement of exam fees, enrollment in Canada's leading CFE prep course, and flexible options for study leave in order for you to be successful. 


Giving back, it adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community. 


Experience that matters: As a student at BDO, you will be able to develop your professional skills while making an impact. Our firm allows you to connect directly with clients, work on a diverse range of files and projects, and has opportunities for future growth after you graduate. 


Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.
Job Responsibilities:
Our London office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student to join the Private Enterprise Group (PEG) team from January to April, 2022 and own the following responsibilities:

Efficiently prepare financial statements for Notice to Reader and Review engagement
Prepare working files for income tax and information returns for a variety of client sizes
Prepare corporate and/or personal tax returns including information returns
Build positive working relationships with clients and effectively respond to request and suggestions
Completion of ongoing accounting analysis and bookkeeping assignments following established procedures
Effectively communicate with team members regarding progress updates and issues on an ongoing basis

How do we define success for your role?

 

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.
Required Skills:
Your experience and education

You are currently working towards a degree/diploma, focused in accounting
You have a desire to provide outstanding client service and a commitment to teamwork
You have proven leadership skill and can take initiative to seek understanding
You display strong problem solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
				
			
				MATH - Business
Application Documents Required: Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Responsibilities:
Your opportunity
The BDO Management Consulting team takes its vast knowledge of industry challenges, regulations, and market dynamics to provide tailored guidance to clients, both large and small - delivering specialized services, solutions and opportunities that are relevant, adaptable, and sustainable. 

Our Toronto office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student to join the Management Consulting - Strategy and Operations team from January to April 2022 and own the following responsibilities:

 

Assist in delivering various digital strategy client engagements (i.e. understanding/prioritizing needs, identifying and evaluating opportunities)
Assist in preparing proposals to win new client work across different industries and practices
Perform data collection and analysis, partake in stakeholder interviews and client discovery sessions, among other value-added tasks to support the development of creative solutions
Establish and maintain a strong relationship with clients and colleagues, delivering high quality, professional, and responsive service
Effectively communicate with clients and team members regarding project progress & associated activities

How do we define success for your role?

 

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.
Required Skills:
Your experience and education

You are currently working towards a degree/diploma, focused in Commerce, Economics, Technology, Social Sciences, or other relevant program
You have a strong interest in pursuing a career in the Consulting field
You have a desire to provide outstanding client service and a commitment to teamwork
You have proven leadership skill and can take initiative to seek understanding of complex challenges
You display strong problem solving, analytical, and communication skills
You have the ability to prioritize competing priorities with varying deadlines
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Economics
				
			
				ARTS - Social Sciences

Your opportunity
Our Edmonton office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student to join the Mergers & Acquisitions team this fall from January to April 2022 and own the following responsibilities:

 

Prepare pitch-books and presentation documents in connection with business development initiatives

Job Responsibilities:
Your opportunity
The BDO Management Consulting team takes its vast knowledge of industry challenges, regulations, and market dynamics to provide tailored guidance to clients, both large and small - delivering specialized services, solutions and opportunities that are relevant, adaptable, and sustainable. 


Our Ottawa office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student to join the Management Consulting - Strategy and Operations team from January to April 2022 and own the following responsibilities:

 

Assist in delivering various digital strategy client engagements (i.e. understanding/prioritizing needs, identifying and evaluating opportunities)
Assist in preparing proposals to win new client work across different industries and practices
Perform data collection and analysis, partake in stakeholder interviews and client discovery sessions, among other value-added tasks to support the development of creative solutions
Establish and maintain a strong relationship with clients and colleagues, delivering high quality, professional, and responsive service
Effectively communicate with clients and team members regarding project progress & associated activities

How do we define success for your role?

 

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.

Your experience and education

You are currently working towards a degree/diploma, focused in Commerce, Economics, Technology, Social Sciences, or other relevant program
You have a strong interest in pursuing a career in the Consulting field
You have a desire to provide outstanding client service and a commitment to teamwork
You have proven leadership skill and can take initiative to seek understanding of complex challenges
You display strong problem solving, analytical, and communication skills

				ARTS - Social Sciences

Job Responsibilities:
Your opportunity
Our Barrie office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student to join the Valuations team from January to April 2022 and own the following responsibilities:

 

Assist as required in the valuation of business interests for the purpose of tax planning, litigation, and/or transaction advisory
Analyze company and industry-specific strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats to determine the cash flow risks of the companies involved
Build financial models to value business interests, intangible assets and complex financial instruments
Analyze income for spousal and child support purposes 
Quantify damages arising from shareholder disputes and breaches of contract
Communicate with clients to obtain the required information in connection with the engagement 

How do we define success for your role? 

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.
Required Skills:
Your experience and education

You are enrolled in an accounting focused post-secondary program with intention of pursuing the CPA designation 
You have a strong interest in pursuing a career in valuations and an eagerness to pursue the CBV designation 
You have a desire to provide outstanding client service and a commitment to teamwork 
You have excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate ideas effectively in writing 
You have strong analytical and problem solving skills 
You have the ability to prioritize competing priorities with varying deadlines

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, we rely on our professionals to provide exceptional service, and help our clients by providing advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth. 


Why BDO?

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
 

We enable you to engage with the firm's strategic plan, and be a key contributor to the success and growth of the firm.
We help you be the best professional you can be in our services, industries and markets.
Achieve your personal goals outside of the office and make an impact on your community.

Earn your CPA Designation

At BDO, we are committed to the success of students pursuing their CPA designation. We provide pre-approved programs across our 100+ offices, mentorship and support, reimbursement of exam fees, enrollment in Canada's leading CFE prep course, and flexible options for study leave in order for you to be successful. 


Giving back, it adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community. 


Experience that matters: As a student at BDO, you will be able to develop your professional skills while making an impact. Our firm allows you to connect directly with clients, work on a diverse range of files and projects, and has opportunities for future growth after you graduate. 


Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.
Job Responsibilities:
Your opportunity
Our Toronto office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student to join the Valuations team from January to April 2022 and own the following responsibilities:

 

Assist as required in the valuation of business interests for the purpose of tax planning, litigation, and/or transaction advisory
Analyze company and industry-specific strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats to determine the cash flow risks of the companies involved
Build financial models to value business interests, intangible assets and complex financial instruments
Analyze income for spousal and child support purposes 
Quantify damages arising from shareholder disputes and breaches of contract
Communicate with clients to obtain the required information in connection with the engagement 

How do we define success for your role? 

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.
Required Skills:
Your experience and education

You are enrolled in an accounting focused post-secondary program with intention of pursuing the CPA designation 
You have a strong interest in pursuing a career in valuations and an eagerness to pursue the CBV designation 
You have a desire to provide outstanding client service and a commitment to teamwork 
You have excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate ideas effectively in writing 
You have strong analytical and problem solving skills 
You have the ability to prioritize competing priorities with varying deadlines
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Economics
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Your opportunity
Our Waterloo office is looking for a 4 or 8 month Co-op or Intern to join the Valuations team from January to April/August 2022 and own the following responsibilities:

 

Value business interests for the purpose of tax planning and/or transaction advisory
Quantify damages arising from shareholder disputes and breaches of contract 
Analyze company and industry-specific strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats to determine the cash flow risks of the companies involved

Job Responsibilities:
Your opportunity
Value Creation helps companies improve, turnaround and grow performance.  We assist our clients to navigate urgent and critical situations where significant value is at stake, including defining moments such as M&A transactions, business transformation, growth or recovery. 


Our Toronto office is looking for a Co-op or Intern Student to join our growing Value Creation Services practice from January to April 2022, and own the following responsibilities:

 

Conduct detailed research and analysis of client, industry and market performance and develop practical strategies and action plans, including supporting financial analysis / models and implementation plans
Consult with client personnel and participate in client meetings and interviews
Contribute to the production of high-quality reports outlining key client project issues, data analysis and recommendations through effective and visual PowerPoint reports (including logical structuring and storyboarding skills)
Prepare assigned sections of client reports and other deliverables
Contribute to Value Creation's sales, business development and marketing activities
Be responsible for fostering an open and inclusive work environment

How do we define success for your role?

 

You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect & Collaboration
You understand your client's industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
You identify, recommend, & are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive & engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning & professional development.
Required Skills:
Your experience and education

You are currently working towards a degree, with outstanding academic credentials
Working towards a professional designation (e.g. CPA, P.Eng, Lean Six Sigma etc) and / or Masters level university education would be considered an asset
Previous work experience with financial planning & analysis and/or management consulting  would be an asset
Superior verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills
Strong PowerPoint design, layout and storyboarding skills
Experience with financial analysis or modeling, data analytics and visualization, market research and analysis, internal / external analysis, project problem diagnosis & solution development
Strong work initiative and the ability to adapt to new challenges and propose ideas
Motivated, detail-oriented, autonomous, rigorous and able to work under pressure
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Economics
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Responsibilities:
Our Guelph office is looking for Co-op or Intern Students to join the Outsourcing, Payroll team this fall for an 8-month term from January 2022 to August 2022. Students seeking a 4-month term are welcome to apply. The students will own the following responsibilities:

Input, validate, test and report client's payroll
Identify data discrepancies outside of the norm and notify the appropriate contact on the team
Administer hourly and salary payroll and ensure timely payments to employees
Generate requested payroll reports

Your experience and education

You are currently working towards a degree/diploma, focused in accounting, finance or commerce
You have a desire to provide outstanding client service and a commitment to teamwork

Bell and Howell is a company that provides world class software and hardware solutions. Our head office is in Durham, North Carolina and our local software engineering office is located in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada.Our Waterloo office focuses on designing and implementing software systems for the products we sell. Our solutions include a wide range of markets and products, but with a focus on solutions for the online order pickup systems. Our "Click and Collect" products are used in many market segments including Retail, Grocery Pickup, Pharmacy Automated Pickup and Campus Package systems.  While we are focused on these new business solutions, we also continue to develop software for our Print/Mail business and Track and Trace customers.  


We are currently looking to add more talented and innovative people to our software development team
