Job Summary:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Fintech Impact, Perkins + Will, BC Business, our Instagram, and our Blog. 


We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the x?m?θkw?y??m (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and S?l?ílw?ta?/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.


Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people, by removing the financial complexity of entrepreneurship. Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between doing their books and running their businesses.  


Bench solves this dilemma by taking bookkeeping off of their hands. Learn more about us on our About page.  


We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench! 


What does the Quality Team look like?


The Quality Team has one purpose: to permanently improve the quality of Bench's bookkeeping. Achieving this objective will ensure every Bench client receives financials that meet our high bookkeeping standards, and Associates across Operations are supported in their ongoing learning and development. 


You'll be a good fit for the Quality Team if you're ready for the next stage of your own learning and development. You'll be a great fit if you strive to make the Associates around you better through honest feedback and thoughtful communication. You've come to recognize that the only way for our clients to receive great books, is to have great Associates completing those books and knowledgeable Associates reviewing those books. 


We're a team of curious Benchmates who relish encountering a new bookkeeping challenge. You will be asked to develop your bookkeeping and accounting knowledge to the point where you can help any Associate with any bookkeeping issue.  


The Quality team reviews all Bench clients several times a year, including completing year-end reviews during tax season. We see it all, we strive to improve it all, and we always assume best intentions when sharing feedback with others. 


The Extra Details:

This is a 4 month contract position (Jan - end of Apr, 2022) for folks currently enrolled in a co-op work term
Worried about not having the experience for the role? Don't fret, we'll train you during our in-house Bench Operations Academy; you'll be up and running in no time
All Benchmates have access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
Our office is currently fully remote! We'll set you up with all the equipment you need to be productive at home from day one

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society-including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll be getting up to as a Quality Associate:

Communicating feedback to bookkeepers on the books you're reviewing in a concise and plain-spoken manner. 
Identifying themes of common issues or errors that you see while reviewing and communicating the pain-point you've seen to others on the Quality Team.
Providing input on projects that affect how you work in your day-to-day or the affect how the average Operations Associate works in their day-to-day. 
Completing reviews is the main task we ask you to do. You'll be completing a wide variety of reviews: MERs, YERs, CU reviews, Pro reviews, and possibly even YEFs. Completing reviews is what you do, but the purpose of the role is to ensure our clients are receiving high quality books and provide feedback to associates.
Required Skills:
To be successful in this role, you'll need to have:

Bookkeeping Knowledge: Excited by numbers, simple math, or problem-solving and are content with repeat, detailed work. Accounting or finance background is an asset
Attention to Detail: Incredible attention to detail combined with a sense of urgency to get constructive feedback to as many Associates as possible
People focused Attitude: An open-minded and team-oriented attitude to work with fellow Quality Team members and the desire to support all of Operations.
Independence: The ability to work independently, but still ask for support when needed.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
Application Documents Required: Résumé

Job Summary:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Fintech Impact, Perkins + Will, BC Business, our Instagram, and our Blog. 


We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the x?m??kw?y??m (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and S?l?ílw?ta?/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.


Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people, by removing the financial complexity of entrepreneurship. Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between doing their books and running their businesses.  


Bench solves this dilemma by taking bookkeeping off of their hands. Learn more about us on our About page.  


We're growing fast, and we're looking for you to join us on this incredible journey. 


What you'll be getting up to as an Associate:

At Bench, we really believe that people are everything, and our Accounting Associates play one of the most pivotal roles; providing the right mix of elegant and intelligent client assistance, and delivering bookkeeping for small businesses using our revolutionary software and app. Our Associates are directly responsible for helping our clients survive and thrive through monthly and historical bookkeeping. This is important now, more than ever. 


You'll maintain relationships with small business owners from various industries, both on the phone and through our proprietary bookkeeping platform. With or without an accounting background, we'll provide you with all the tools and training you'll need to be a highly successful Associate.  


In a typical week, Associates will spend roughly 60% of their time completing bookkeeping tasks, 30% of their time communicating with clients, and 10% of their time in meetings or training.
Job Responsibilities:
A highly successful Associate looks something like this:

Excited by numbers, simple math, or problem-solving, and are content with repeat, detailed work
Be able to communicate clearly and articulately on the phone and in messaging. (Note: We do not believe in the idea of "standard" accents for the English language.)
Motivated to build a global success story with us. Working for a start-up requires flexibility and resilience
Data driven: if you're someone that thrives off of metrics, statistics, and quarterly targets then you'll fit right in. 
A people-centered approach: you understand that people are everything. You're collaborative, optimistic and you listen to understand, demonstrating kindness and empathy in all interactions.
A drive to make things better: You're not satisfied with "good enough", and nothing that needs fixing is just someone else's job. You love to experiment, try new things, and drive improvement; within your own team, and across the organization.
Startup hustle: You are highly motivated, proactive, comfortable with change and ambiguity. You have a humble, team-player attitude and are ready to pitch in wherever you are needed most
Constant learning: This role is as challenging as it is rewarding. As long as you're someone who's eager to tackle new challenges and quick to learn new concepts, we'll get you up to speed in no time.
Required Skills:
What's next: 

We will review your application, and if you are successful, a Recruiter will be in touch to schedule a first-round Zoom interview with our recruiter. 
Following a successful first interview, there will be a second Zoom interview with two of our hiring managers. You can expect an interactive activity as part of the interview at this stage. 

The Extra Details:

This is an 8 month contract position for folks currently enrolled in a co-op work term
All Associates joining the team will start at a base salary of $42,300. From there, with the Tax Season Bonus and Variable Pay, the On Target Earnings (OTE) for the role is $48,300- pro-rated to the length of your contract.
This position also offers an extended benefits package that includes health, dental, and vision.
All Benchmates have access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
Our office is currently fully remote, so we'll set you up with everything you need to work from home, from day one.
Please apply directly to our website: https://bench.co/careers/job/?gh_jid=3436304

Job Summary:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Fintech Impact, Perkins + Will, BC Business, our Instagram, and our Blog. 


We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the x?m?θkw?y??m (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and S?l?ílw?ta?/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.


Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people, by removing the financial complexity of entrepreneurship. Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between doing their books and running their businesses.  


Bench solves this dilemma by taking bookkeeping off of their hands. Learn more about us on our About page.  


We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench! 


What does the Bench Tax department look like?

With Bench Tax we will ensure our clients can ditch the tax season stress, forever. We're a startup within a startup; a small but mighty team working cross-functionally within Bench as well as working closely with our tax partner, Taxfyle. 


As a  Bench Tax Coordinator you will provide ongoing support directly with our clients and within our internal help channels to ensure that every client and Benchmate has what they need to communicate with our clients or to ensure the service is being delivered. The Bench Tax Coordinator will help maintain the quality of our data environment, ensuring that the Bench Tax Team has the most up to date information to make quality decisions on our service. 


Over time, the Bench Tax Coordinator will dive deeper into the delivery of the tax services by being directly responsible for monitoring and managing the delivery of our tax services to our clients and will coordinate directly with various teams internally and externally in order to do so. 


Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society-including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll be getting up to:

Client Engagement

At the core of everything we do is our clients. As a Tax Coordinator  with Bench Tax, you will obsess over achieving positive tax outcomes for our clients. 
 

Connecting with our clients (via phone, email, and platform) to ensure a timely delivery of their tax services
Helping clients to maintain an accurate tax filing through education and support
Monitor and manage the delivery of our tax services within our partner, Taxfyle's, platform to ensure our clients are getting the best possible experience
Use your knowledge of the Bench Tax services to respond to and action inquiries & requests from various team members across Bench

Take a Stand

Bench Tax is transforming the tax industry by creating a service that prioritizes the success of our clients over anything else. As a Tax Coordinator within the Bench Tax team, you are fired up to fundamentally change the lives of our clients through the positive outcomes our team can create. We embrace every setback, conversation, experience, and success as a means of making your stand happen. 
 

Be accountable to deliver on the Bench Tax Team's quarterly Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) or Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Participate in the ideation and systematic improvement process that contribute to us building better systems, tools and processes to deliver superior results for our clients and fellow Benchmates
Required Skills:
To be successful in this role, you'll need to have:

Enjoy driving business success through growth, innovation, and ambiguity.
Have a high sense of ownership about your work and high performance standards.
Consistently looking to improve and are not satisfied with mediocrity.
Enjoy connecting with clients, improving their experience, and being a jack of all trades when it comes to client support.
A self-starter who is comfortable taking action where there won't always be clarity. You have good judgement and always push things forward.
Never shy in voicing your opinions, whether that's to a peer or any leader at Bench, and you welcome feedback from others. You believe that feedback is the cornerstone to being our best selves. 
Work well with other individuals and teams in a flexible work environment.
Comfortable collaborating cross functionally with other Benchmates to enhance the client experience.
Strive to be on the pulse of everything, whether that be stepping in to solve a problem, actively participating in ideation or communicating with various stakeholders to get things done!
Generally awesome to work with and be around!

It could be an even better fit if you:

Have experience in Salesforce or other CRMs

We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the x?m?θkw?y??m (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and S?l?ílw?ta?/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.


Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people, by removing the financial complexity of entrepreneurship. Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between doing their books and running their businesses.  


Bench solves this dilemma by taking bookkeeping off of their hands. Learn more about us on our About page.  


We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench! 


What's it like on the Sales Team at Bench?


At the core of it, sales at Bench is a people-centric team focused on helping small business owners and entrepreneurs in the US. As a Sales Development Representative, your first interaction with a potential client is the start of their relationship with Bench. Your genuine curiosity and drive to help people is what guides your approach to discover how Bench can be a part of their entrepreneurial journey. You'll have targets to meet individually and revenue goals to hit as a team, which fuels your innate sense of determination. If you're looking to gain experience in sales and start-ups while making a real difference in people's lives, then you've come to the right place. 


What you'll be getting up to:

Learning what it means to be a part of our stellar Sales team
Communicating with entrepreneurs and small business owners to gain a deeper understanding of their business needs, and educating them on how we are here to give them financial control over their lives
Using your good-natured wit and charm to build new relationships over the phone and email
Helping one of Vancouver's fastest-growing startups hit its revenue and growth goals
Guiding potential clients through to successful closure

To be successful in this role, you'll need:

Are currently enrolled in a co-op program  
Have a genuine passion for helping people
Have an articulate phone and written presence that's confident, yet personable
Are realistic about temporary challenges and setbacks, and use them to motivate yourself and others to achieve targets
Embrace feedback with arms wide open and action it to further your success
Can contribute to a high-performing team by bringing lots of mental horsepower, amazing work ethic, positive energy, and a little weirdness to keep things interesting

The extra details:

This is a full-time, 4 month, co-op position, because we want to help you build upon your current skills and add some new skills to your tool belt. Not to mention, you will have the opportunity to meet some pretty awesome people who will help you to succeed at Bench and beyond. You can read all about past student's experience here.
We're looking for co-ops starting January 2022 with an end date of April 2022. 
Competitive base salary and monthly uncapped commission (+55k OTE) available.
All Benchmates have access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society-including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.

Job Summary:
Bentley Systems (Nasdaq: BSY) is the infrastructure engineering software company. We provide innovative software to advance the world's infrastructure ? sustaining both the global economy and environment. Our industry-leading software solutions are used by professionals, and organizations of every size, for the design, construction, and operations of roads and bridges, rail and transit, water and wastewater, public works and utilities, buildings and campuses, and industrial facilities. Our offerings include MicroStation-based applications for modeling and simulation, ProjectWise for project delivery, AssetWise for asset and network performance, and the iTwin platform for infrastructure digital twins. Bentley Systems employs more than 4,000 colleagues and generates annual revenues of more than $700 million, in 172 countries. 


As a software developer you will be part of a small team that works in a modern, connected environment.  We are highly connected and supportive of each other utilizing MS Teams, git, and Azure DevOps to implement our Agile development processes.  You will be mentored by your team and work on new and existing software projects that our users rely on, such as:
 

Mobile applications for iOS and Android, built using the Xamarin toolset.
Interoperability software that uses an advanced service bus architecture to connect our applications to outside applications.
Our web development that is bringing the power of our offerings to the web
Our extensive C++ server that provides state of the art reliability application functionality that is accessed by all of the above.
Job Responsibilities:
Designing and implementing enhancements for mobile, web or desktop applications
Writing and implementing tests to cover what we develop
Participating in code reviews
Participating in daily standups to share progress and discuss obstacles
Assisting in resolving ongoing issues and those that recently come up
Potential need to quickly learn new languages for use if necessary
Providing support to other employees with their own tasks and responsibilities
Required Skills:
Any combination of C#, C++, JavaScript, TypeScript, SQL, Xamarin/.NET MAUI
Knowledge of the following is beneficial: Entity Framework, OData, ASP.NET Core Web API, Blazor (or experience with Razor)
We use git, so knowledge of source control fundamentals is an asset
Knowledge of ReactJS is a benefit.
Knowledge of Azure, Docker and Kubernetes is a plus

Job Summary:
Position Summary

The Actuarial Co-op Student will gain exposure to pricing, reserving and product development work in commercial and travel insurance.  The student will collect internal and external data in order to benchmark rates and gain the skills to be able to translate data into strategy and recommendations to actuarial business partners.
Job Responsibilities:
Main Responsibilities:

Assist in the development of pricing and reserving tools and databases
Emphasis on learnng actuarial techniques and gaining exposure to other functional areas, such as underwriting, claims handling, and product development
Develop and apply professional experience with spreadsheets, databases, and statistical software to compile and categorize data used in pricing, reserving and profitability analysis
Learn to communicate basic actuarial concepts to actuarial business partners both verbally and in writing
Produce various data exhibits and analysis relating to measuring, tracking, and monitoring company and industry performance
Gather and collect data from industry, government and other sources in order to benchmark rates
Required Skills:
Qualifications:

University degree - in progress (Third or Fourth year student a must)
Actuarial, Finance or Math major preferred
Completion of at least one actuarial exam is an asset
Knowledge of programming in SQL, Python, R or SAS is an asset
Interest in Data Analytics
Proficient in Microsoft Office tools including Word and Excel
Must be a team player who enjoys partnering with others to hit team goals
Ability to work well independently and in a team setting
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Comfortable working under pressure and against tight deadlines

Organization: Berkshire Hathaway Group of Insurance Companies
Job Summary: Berkshire Hathaway Group of Insurance Companies, Reinsurance Division is a leading provider of life retrocession to reinsurers from the United States, Canada and Europe, giving the organization a truly global presence.  We are looking for a positive, motivated individual to join us as an Actuarial Co-op student to play a vital role in the Reinsurance Valuation team.  Reporting to one of our Actuarial Analyst's, the selected candidate will be expected to assist in performing modelling and analysis on a Canadian GAAP, US GAAP and US Statutory basis.  The position will also support the development of actuarial assumptions and other projects as assigned.  This role will give you an opportunity to learn the reinsurance and retrocession business and work with other functional areas of the Reinsurance Division, including Pricing, Finance, and Risk Management.
Job Responsibilities:
AXIS set-up of reinsurance treaties including implementation of assumption changes, maintenance of the existing models, and development of new Axis cells
Make recommendations on process improvements
Ensure that processes have appropriate controls and comply with Sarbanes-Oxley requirements and other actuarial guidelines
Assist with special projects to enhance financial and capital management capabilities of  Reinsurance Division as required
Required Skills:
Working on a degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or statistics is preferred
At least 1 completed exam of the Society of Actuaries
Knowledge of insurance products and GGY AXIS is an asset
Proficiency in EXCEL, Visual Basic and Access is preferred
Strong technical skills and ability to analyze and solve problems
Good verbal and written communication skills
Detail oriented

Job Title:
NEW
									


										NLP / ML / Data Scientist at Startup
Job Summary:
BetterUp is a late-stage unicorn startup looking for data science co-ops who want to make real, meaningful contributions and to use their skills to bring about positive change in the world. At BetterUp, we give people the coaching, support, and push they need to reach peak performance and unlock their limitless potential, in all they do, personally and professionally. We work with world-class experts and Coaches, pioneer innovative technology, and foster human touch at scale to fuel the BetterUp experience, and make growth and development achievable for all. We believe that practicing strong mental fitness is a never-ending practice of maintaining and building the strengths that proceed to health, happiness, and success.  


What we believe:
 

Do Less, Deliver More - We focus on the work that will contribute the most to our mission and then execute to the best of our abilities.
Extreme Ownership - We are fully responsible for our work. When things go poorly, we relish the opportunity to learn from it and improve.
Work to Learn - We're curious, willing-to-be-wrong, agile learners. This means we engage with work as a playscape on which to discover, learn, and realize our full potential.
Bias Towards Action -  We prefer to act rather than wait and see. When we identify an opportunity to make a difference, we move on it.

Be yourself! We're a diverse group of thinkers, doers, and innovators. And we invest in our people through coaching and training to fuel our ability to revolutionize personal and professional growth and help our members live better lives. 


We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging education for every employee and have created our Belonging@BetterUp program to build practices that foster cultural inclusion and workplace belonging.
Job Responsibilities:
Job responsibilities can cover a range of data science responsibilities.
 

Be a data analyst serving to help drive product growth through a deeper understanding of our users
Design new data models that serve to provide data on each critical part of the user experience
Design new data models that serve to power novel user-facing features and analytical capabilities
Iterate on existing models to ensure they stay accurate as the product changes
Build meaningful dashboards and data visualizations
Conduct data deep dives and explorations to uncover insights
Translate complex results to non-technical audiences and help use data to inform the product strategy
Partner with data engineering to bring models to production


Engineers are expected to contribute to all stages of the software development lifecycle, including implementation, testing, deployment, maintenance, and production support.
Required Skills:
Engineering requirements and nice-to-haves:
 

Always be learning!  Ability and desire to find creative and thoughtful solutions to a variety of technical and product challenges
Relentlessness in debugging issues and solving problems
Prior work experience or foundational education in Machine Learning
Familiarity with all or part of our growing technology soup - Python, Ruby, TypeScript, React, Ember, Flask, Rails, ML frameworks, (big) data platforms, BigQuery, Snowflake, SQL, Docker, Google Cloud, AWS, Heroku, Gitflow, Looker, etc.
Experience in Agile product development processes (SCRUM, Kanban, Lean Startup, etc)
Strong verbal and written communication skills

Job Title: Junior Analyst, US and International Equity Research
Job Summary:
Beutel Goodman is a privately owned, independent investment manager founded in 1967 and located in Toronto. Assets under management totalled $45.4 billion as of June 30, 2021. 

The Beutel Goodman US and International Equity team adheres to a strict rules-based system of bottom-up value investing.  Investments in public issuers are made with an expected holding period of three years or longer.  Prior to making an investment, the team has completed a very thorough analysis of the company's long-term prospects as well as the industry it operates within. The result is a concentrated portfolio of high-conviction names and sector weights that can vary significantly from those of the benchmark.
Job Responsibilities: The candidate will assume the role of Junior Analyst where the primary task will be a deep dive on a company to produce a research report which will include a company overview, an industry analysis, a section on risks, a section on governance, a section on valuation, a full financial model, and anything else pertinent. The Analyst will be supported by one member of the team throughout the process.
Required Skills:
Ideally, candidates will be: 

- Able to use company regulatory filings and transcripts from company events as primary research sources for performing analysis of a company and the industry it operates in 

- An excellent oral and written communicator 

- A conscientious self-starter capable of productive independent work 

- Comfortable modelling financial statements using Excel
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				MATH - Business

Job Summary:
The leader of a multi-disciplinary project team, delivering custom process systems that enhance people's lives. 


We design and build process equipment that produce therapeutics, vaccines, food and dairy products and personal care products. Our equipment also supports scientific research. Our clients in the Bio-pharma, Food, Consumer Product and Nuclear industries are located through-out North America and Europe. At BFC Technologies Inc. you build what you design.
 
In this role, you will help the quality team to exeute validation and quailfication of pharmaceutical processing systems, also the main responsibility would be completing the documentation Turn over package.
Job Responsibilities:
Preforming component verification of manufactured skids and systems
Verifying in-process fabrication documentation
Compiling the documentation Turn over package for skids
Verifying the accuracy of the documentation as per project requirements, data sheet and test instructions (FAT/SAT protocols)
Preparation of hard copy / electronic copy of turn over packages
Liaison with client representatives during FAT/SATs for documentation review
Inspect received items (including pipe, fittings, and other component) as per Purchase order/Projects' requirement when necessary
Required Skills:
Certificate in Quality control or equivalent would be an asset
Ability to read blueprints and P&IDs or willingness to learn
Strong communication skills both verbal and written.
Ability to work in groups as well as independently with minimal supervision.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are essential.

Company Description

Specialized engineering company servicing the Bio-tech / Pharma, Food and Consumer product industries. The company designs, builds and commissions custom process equipment.

Who are we?

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 7,200 globally, we focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients' businesses. 


Through our shared values, we focus on building a sustainable future, diversity and belonging, and providing continuous learning and development.
Job Responsibilities:
The Intern, Engineering Project Management will assist project Manager and Project Team Manager with day to day tasks in implementing the project plan for end-to-end delivery of projects.  

  

The role:

Project Management Support

Assists Project Manager with administrative tasks of creating and implementing tenders online.
Assists Project Manager with setting up resource and budget requirements, cost estimates, and schedules in PMWeb.

Assists Project Manager in monitoring project delivery against timelines ensuring timely completion as assigned.
Assists Project Manager in communicating project status to relevant stakeholders.
Assists Project Manager with administrative tasks for gathering documents from external vendors for timely project close outs as assigned.
Assists Project Manager in ensuring projects are delivered on time, within scope, budget and requirements.

Use the opportunity to develop essential relationship management skills, within project management.
Use the opportunity to develop vendor management skills within project management.

Computer proficiency - proficient in and experience with MS Office suite of applications along with proven ability to quickly learn new applications.

Job Summary:
Business Intelligence Programmer - Intern

Do you have an inexplicable fondness for numbers? Does pulling data make your heart sing? Do you dream about pivot tables? Having a hard time explaining this to friends and family? At Big Blue Bubble, we understand.
Job Responsibilities:
Here are a few things you can expect from this internship placement:

Developing code bases for internal data display dashboards, API interfaces, and analysis scripts.
Maintaining and supporting existing code. 
Writing, testing, debugging and documenting code and processes. 
Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services, API development and front/back-end dashboard maintenance and extension.
Required Skills:
To be an effective team member, you will have:

Completed two years of your Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Data Analytics degree.
Experience with programming in Java, MySQL, PHP.
The skills to understand and interpret analytics.
Excellent problem solving skills combined with mad math skills (calculus/statistics/linear algebra).
Experience with source control systems such as SVN and Git.
Familiar with Linux and shell scripting.
Knowledge of software concepts such as data structures, object-oriented programming and design patterns.

  

You also have the following attributes: 

Detail oriented.
Self-directed.
Able to meet deadlines.
Comfortable working in a team.
Enthusiastic about gaming.

We know the above list is a lot. You don't have to fill every single point. We each bring our own respective strengths to the table. Let us know which of the above is you, and get in touch with us now to explore the opportunity further!

Job Summary:
Through the quality system, the Regulatory Affairs/Quality Assurance Medical Device Associate position puts you in the center of the company's operations.  These multi-faceted areas include device design, engineering, manufacturing, microbiology, process validations, clinical studies, supply chain management and even human resources.  It also develops a wide range of skills as well, from project management to good communication skills. 

  

The Quality Assurance role is all about project management and processes.  You'll receive training on the BioIntegral Surgical Quality Management System, and move onto help keep that system working and improving.  These improvements are typically made with better systems and processes, training programs, new regulations, risk-driven decision-making, data collection and analysis, and presentations to management after which changes can be made.   In addition, the QA Associate will gain exposure and experience to various functional areas of the firm, including Manufacturing, R&D, Engineering and Sales/Clinical Support.  This is an exciting time for the industry, as some regulatory changes are moving a lot of new processes and there are some great one-off and long-term projects for the right COOP. 

  

Regulatory Affairs is the area where everything about a product comes together.  The regulatory role is a mixture of all the skills required in the medical device and pharma industries: basic science, writing, project management, clinical research, risk analysis, data analysis, physiology, biology, product life cycles, manufacturing and quality systems.  

  

In short, you'll be exposed to both, and perhaps over the 4- or 8-months, specialize in a particular area.
Job Responsibilities:
Support various operational areas of the firm (e.g., product analysis/reviews, clinical performance, technical documentation, quality audits, etc.)
Support clinical studies, from initial design to ongoing data collection and analysis
Collaborate with Quality Assurance to maintain regulatory compliance across the product range
Act as core team member providing review and analysis of applicable regulatory guidelines and project regulatory assessments as needed
Responsible for document control/management, quality documentation review and record control/maintenance
Provide training to others in areas you've mastered
Draft documents and forms
Validate processes and equipment
Participate in internal audits, putting the processes to task and see how we're following them
Have fun, ask questions, get involved and learn some new things about yourself and the industry
Required Skills:
Be a self learner and a team player
Be comfortable and creative with MS Word and Excel
Be well-rounded
Have good to excellent technical writing skills
Have good communication skills, especially with data
Have good judgement and a desire to make effective decisions
Have fun, ask questions, get involved and learn some new things about yourself and the industry
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				- Theme - Professional and Technical Writing

				ARTS - Political Science
				
			
				ENG - Chemical Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				SCI - Biological Sciences
				
			
				SCI - Chemical Sciences

Job Summary:
Foot and lower limb health & wellness is crucial to overall health and longevity.
			 
			At BioPed, we hire and train Kinesiology students to become Canadian Certified Pedorthists. BioPed's Canadian Certified Pedorthists (C.Ped (C)'s)  are biomechanical experts, specializing in orthotics, footwear and other supportive devices to address lower limb conditions. They work in concert with family physicians and other health care providers to improve the quality of life of their patients.  As a C. Ped. (C), you would perform in-depth evaluations through observation of surface anatomy, palpation of the lower limb, gait analysis, orthopaedic testing and footwear analysis, and devise a treatment plan for your patients, which may include a device, a specialty shoe, exercise/stretching, or otherwise.
			 
			Those who become Pedorthists have the opportunity to work as a Clinician, Clinic Manager and/or own their own BioPed clinic.
			 
			To learn more about BioPed, please visit www.bioped.com
			 
			To learn more about what a Pedorthist is, please visit http://www.pedorthic.ca/

			Work location: Ontario, British Columbia, Nova Scotia (refer to the job posting for the specific city)

			Accommodations and Travel: Please be advised that you are required to arrange for your own travel to and from the clinic during your co-op semester, as well as for living accommodations.
			Recent Student Testimonials:
"My experiences at BioPed enriched my exposure and curiosity within the field of footcare and orthotics. My peers at BioPed established a welcoming and supportive environment. From shadowing the Pedorthic team, I observed clinical procedures and made connections that enhanced the concepts taught from my undergraduate studies. My involvement within the orthotics assembly process, as well as patient assessments, facilitated my growth as a Co-op student. BioPed provided an excellent opportunity to develop the fundamental experiences of a health care provider."
			 
-Shawn Budiatmanto, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Fall 2020
			 
"My experience at BioPed was absolutely amazing. I was given the opportunity to learn about Pedorthics and Chiropody, two career paths I was unaware of prior to working there. I was a little nervous when starting as it was my first work term, however the staff at BioPed were very friendly and welcomed me in with open arms. I learned so much about lower limb injuries and treatments, bracing options, and even how to work with vendors and insurance companies throughout the work term. I would highly recommend working at BioPed if given the chance!"
			 
- Makayla Fraser, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Winter 2021
			 
"Prior to this work term, I had never been exposed to the field of Pedorthics and Chiropody and was quite unfamiliar with what these professions have to offer. Working at Bioped has now opened an entirely new perspective of healthcare which I did not consider before. Throughout my time here, I have been able to see and experience first-hand all the hard work that is put in to provide patients with nothing but the most effective solutions to address their problems and concerns. Whether it was through fabrication of orthotics, sitting in on assessments or dealing with customer retail, each day brought a new experience to learn from, which piqued my interest and kept me engaged. Overall, this work term has been a memorable experience working with such a dynamic and innovative team, who all have positively influenced my growth as a kinesiology student."
			 
-Imaan Ahmed, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Spring 2021
Job Responsibilities:
The work term may include: 

·        Learning the operations of the front retail area 

·       Gaining knowledge related to the BioPed Way and how to professionally interact with patients 

·       Understanding how to clinically fit footwear 

·       Learning about various products related to treating patients such as knee braces, compression socks, over the counter products 

·       Booking appointments 

·       Taking payments 

·       Communicating with insurance providers 

·       Working with a Pedorthist/Technician to craft a custom pair of orthotics for yourself and then for patients 

·       Learning how to work with manufacturing equipment 

·       Understanding how to select the most appropriate materials for each condition and patient 

·       Sitting in on patient biomechanical assessments with a Pedorthist and/or Chiropodist 

·       Performing gait assessments 

·       Learning how to cast/measure for orthoses/braces 

·       Learning how to design a foot orthoses
Required Skills:
·       Kinesiology Students (preferable) or Sciences Students 

Assets: 

Having a car is an asset, but not necessary depending on how closely you're situated to a clinic. Location details can be found on our website www.bioped.com/locations
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Health Care: Therapy and Patient Care 
				
			
				AHS - Kinesiology
				
			
				AHS - Public Health and Health Systems
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
BioRender is a Toronto-based high growth startup backed by Y Combinator.  


At BioRender, our mission is to empower the world to learn and communicate science faster through visuals. BioRender software reduces the time it takes to visually communicate research from hours to minutes, while also making that communication more effective. 


We aim to save scientists over 1 billion hours of wasted time per year so they can spend it performing life-changing medical research, teaching the scientists of tomorrow, and helping people understand the world around them. 


To support the mission, we have ~20 engineers across 4 teams tackling a variety of challenges. We're remote-first and have team members in 3 provinces. A physical office in Toronto is available, but you have the flexibility to work from anywhere.  We're hiring coops for all 4 of our teams: 
 

The Editor team creates web-based interactive tools for communicating science  ( think rendering, caching,  drawing and editing tools ). 
The App Experiences team enables teams of scientists to organize their content, collaborate, and manage their accounts ( think tools like commenting, sharing and organizing content, identity and access management )
The DevOps/Infrastructure team builds out low-latency services for real-time collaboration, and ensures our AWS infrastructure scales with our user base.
The Growth and Acceleration team ingests and analyzes huge amounts of telemetry and usage data.  The insights from this data inform all of our decisions and help us optimize the user experience for scientists.

This posting is for our DevOps team. We're looking for an engineer interested in designing and building out services in AWS that scale to hundreds of thousands of concurrent users! 


We write services in TypeScript running in Node.js, using Express and WebSockets, and use AWS-managed services for: docker, container orchestration, kafka, Dynamo DB, CI/CD, and infrastructure-as-code.
Job Responsibilities:
Our ideal fit:

Excellent technical communication skills
Ability to explain complex solutions clearly to others
Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
Creative problem solver

What you'll be doing:

Participate in architecture and system design discussions and evaluate tradeoffs between different design choices.
Build out new services end-to-end: from initial design, architecture review, development, testing (including load-testing), to production go-live.   For example, last term's coop built a real-time push notification service using Kafka. 
Build tooling that boosts developer velocity, making it easier for all our teams to develop, integrate, and deploy using AWS. Examples include CI/CD improvements, zero-downtime deployments, and system observability improvements (logging, monitoring, alerting). 
Peer review code, participate in team meetings and contribute to team efforts around code quality improvements
Required Skills:
What you bring to the table:

You've had some professional experience with (or done challenging side projects using) AWS, and want to take that experience to the next level.
You're comfortable working in TypeScript or JavaScript 
Must be eligible to work in Canada
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

To support the mission, we have ~20 engineers across 4 teams tackling a variety of challenges. We're remote-first and have team members in 3 provinces. A physical office in Toronto is available, but you have the flexibility to work from anywhere.  We're hiring coops for all 4 of our teams: 
 

The Editor team creates web-based interactive tools for communicating science  ( think rendering, caching,  drawing and editing tools ). 
The App Experiences team enables teams of scientists to organize their content, collaborate, and manage their accounts ( think tools like commenting, sharing and organizing content, identity and access management )
The DevOps/Infrastructure team builds out low-latency services for real-time collaboration, and ensures our AWS infrastructure scales with our user base.
The Growth and Acceleration team ingests and analyzes huge amounts of telemetry and usage data.  The insights from this data inform all of our decisions and help us optimize the user experience for scientists.

This posting is for our App Experiences team.  We're looking for a full-stack engineer interested in building new features that improve the way scientists work and communicate!  We primarily use the MERN stack (React, Node.js, Typescript/Javascript, MongoDB) and AWS.
Job Responsibilities:
Our ideal fit:

Excellent technical communication skills
Ability to explain complex solutions clearly to others
Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
Creative problem solver

What you'll be doing:

You'll build both the frontend and backend of user-facing features.  Some examples of projects you might work on:  real-time commenting on graphics;  easy sharing of graphics across labs and teams; improving the  "gallery" where users find and organize their graphics; improving the discoverability of our content (making it easier for scientists to get the right pre-built icon or template for their needs).
You'll be responsible for the same end-to-end development expected of a full-time developer:  code design, architecture (in collaboration with team members), implementation, testing, QA and deployment. 
You'll do peer code reviews, participate in (and help improve!) our scrum process, and proactively address product issues.
You'll be paired with a full-time developer for onboarding, mentorship and project coordination.
Required Skills:
What you bring to the table:

You have professional experience in any part of our stack ( Node.js/express, React, or MongoDB) or extensive web development background and challenging side projects
Must be eligible to work in Canada
Bonus: you have some full-stack experience using the MERN stack!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
BioRender is a Toronto-based high growth startup backed by Y Combinator.  


At BioRender, our mission is to empower the world to learn and communicate science faster through visuals. BioRender software reduces the time it takes to visually communicate research from hours to minutes, while also making that communication more effective.  


We aim to save scientists over 1 billion hours of wasted time per year so they can spend it performing life-changing medical research, teaching the scientists of tomorrow, and helping people understand the world around them. 

To support the mission, we have ~20 engineers across 4 teams tackling a variety of challenges. We're remote-first and have team members in 3 provinces. A physical office in Toronto is available, but you have the flexibility to work from anywhere.  We're hiring coops for all 4 of our teams: 
 

The Editor team creates web-based interactive tools for communicating science  ( think rendering, caching,  drawing and editing tools ). 
The App Experiences team enables teams of scientists to organize their content, collaborate, and manage their accounts ( think tools like commenting, sharing and organizing content, identity and access management )
The DevOps/Infrastructure team builds out low-latency services for real-time collaboration, and ensures our AWS infrastructure scales with our user base.
The Growth and Acceleration team ingests and analyzes huge amounts of telemetry and usage data.  The insights from this data inform all of our decisions and help us optimize the user experience for scientists.

This posting is for the Editor team. We're looking for an engineer interested in web-based graphics: animation, interactive tools for manipulating shapes, and rendering! 


We primarily do front-end development in Typescript and React using web-based graphics (SVG and Canvas based), with occasional backend work (Node.js, MongoDB and AWS).
Job Responsibilities:
Our ideal fit:

Excellent technical communication skills, the ability to explain complex solutions clearly to others
Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
Creative problem solver
A passion for graphics! 


What you'll be doing:

Identify and build new user-facing tools and features.  Some projects on our roadmap include: animation; specialized drawing tools for scientific use cases; curve manipulation and editing;  painting tools;  text rendering; exporting graphics to different formats (SVG, PPT, TIFF etc)
You'll be responsible for the same end-to-end development expected of a full-time developer: code design, architecture (in collaboration with team members), implementation, testing, QA and deployment. 
You'll do peer code reviews, participate in (and help improve!) our scrum process, and proactively address product issues.
You'll be paired with a full-time developer for onboarding, mentorship and project coordination.
Required Skills:
What you bring to the table:

You have some professional development experience and are interested in front-end development with React and TypeScript (bonus if you are already comfortable with these technologies!)
Nice to have: Some experience (or some challenging side projects) that involve computer graphics, web-based graphics libraries, game development, or animation.
Must be eligible to work in Canada

To support the mission, we have ~20 engineers across 4 teams tackling a variety of challenges. We're remote-first and have team members in 3 provinces. A physical office in Toronto is available, but you have the flexibility to work from anywhere.  We're hiring coops for all 4 of our teams:

The DevOps/Infrastructure team builds out low-latency services for real-time collaboration, and ensures our AWS infrastructure scales with our user base.
The Growth and Acceleration team ingests and analyzes huge amounts of telemetry and usage data.  The insights from this data inform all of our decisions and help us optimize the user experience for scientists.

This posting is for the Growth and Acceleration team.  We're looking for someone that wants to make a business impact by:

 

Using data and building tools so that our customer-teams (Finance, Customer Experience, Sales, Creative) can make better decisions and work more efficiently.
Creating and testing data-driven hypotheses and running experiments in our user-facing platforms to improve key business metrics. 

We ingest millions of telemetry and usage events per hour into Amazon Redshift. From there we use SQL, Python and a variety of tools to analyze, visualize, and build models using that data.
Job Responsibilities:
Our ideal fit:

Excellent technical communication skills, able to explain complex solutions clearly to others
Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
Creative problem solver

You'll set up internal analytics systems and API integrations with external vendors (stripe, customer.io, hubspot, etc) to enable internal teams to make decisions based on data.
You'll add features to our admin panel and build data-driven tools for: predicting churn; making user account changes, track revenue across channels, modify subscriptions, upload and tag creative product content (icons, templates), easily set up enterprise accounts

Job Summary:
About Us

At Bitbuy, our mission is clear: to provide convenient, dependable and secure access to Bitcoin and other digital currencies. We believe that cryptocurrency is paving the way for retail, and corporate investors alike.  

Being Canada's most trusted platform is not easy. We pride ourselves in providing top-notch security, convenient funding options, and unmatched customer service for our users.  

Bitbuy is a Federally Incorporated organization and is registered with FINTRAC as a Money-Service Business. Our business won a Notable Startup award in 2018 and ranked 54th on 2020 Startup list by Canadian Business. With offices in Toronto and Halifax, we are now proudly a team of over 50 talented individuals and counting.  


Overview

As a Junior Mobile Developer you will be working with the product and front-end development teams to work our mobile application. Your work will include adding new features and enhancements that will be assigned via Jira tickets.  Daily stand ups will be held to report on progress and help will be readily available from the rest of the team.

Write maintainable, self-documenting, and testable React Native code for mobile
Work collaboratively with team members to ensure deadlines are met
Bring ideas to the table to ensure we produce the best solutions for the project
Required Skills:
Requirements

Experience with React Native (preferred) or React
Comfortable with modern javascript (ES5 and above: arrow functions, async & await, etc.)
Familiar with or a willingness to learn Typescript
Completed at least one past work term, or personal project 


Nice to Haves

Published an app that you're passionate and willing to talk about
Experience with another modern mobile development framework (Kotlin, Swift, Flutter)
Bonus points if you have an eye for design
Experience with any of the following libraries (MobX, React Query, Shopify Restyle)

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
About BitGo


BitGo offers insitituional digital asset custody, trading, and finance. BitGo enables our clients to navigate the complex landscape of digital assets with a connected, compliant, and secure suite of solutions. 


At BitGo, we believe digital assets will drive the global financial system. Our clients choose BitGo because they need services and solutions they can trust. BitGo's solution is built on top of the strongest technological foundation in the industry, allowing BitGo to provide clients with an integrated solution for digital assets that mitigates risk and optimizes capital efficiency. 


BitGo's products appeal to all types of clients. From high-net-worth investors to leveraged traders to institutional clients, our clients require the highest levels of security, technology, and compliance. As a regulated, qualified custodian, BitGo is able to provide the true peace of mind that fiduciaries require to work with digital assets. We deliver standards, such as CryptoCurrency Security Standard (CCSS) and SOC2, while also working with the most trusted brands in the industry and offering clients the most comprehensive insurance available in the market today. 


www.bitgo.com 


About the role


As an member of our engineering team, you will play an important role in building out significant parts of BitGo's infrastructure, applications and experiences. 


About our stack


* Frontend - Typescript, ReactJS, React Native, Apollo, Redux, D3, SCSS, Immutable.js, Webpack 

* Backend - Go, GraphQL, PostgreSQL 

* Dev Ops - Kubernetes, Docker, AWS
Job Responsibilities:

* Lead features, even entire product lines, from inception to launch 

* Work across the entire stack using cutting edge frameworks and tools, own execution 

* Collaborate across sales, design, and engineering to rapidly iterate on product 


We are hiring across product engineering, blockchain engineering, and infrastructure / devops. During the interview process, we will ask you to specify one or more preferred areas.

* Fluency in Javascript

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Build Team - Tools Development Student - 4 Month Winter Term
Job Summary:
POSITION SUMMARY 


The QNX Build Team is seeking a motivated and talented individual to develop tools for working with QNX software packages, which are used to build and test QNX products. The project involves a combination of developing tools, assisting with QNX product builds, and driving process changes to assist QNX in developing leading-edge products. 


ABOUT THE QNX BUILD TEAM 


The QNX Build Team is responsible for automating the builds, packaging, and maintenance of all QNX products (e.g., QNX Neutrino RTOS). Job Description 

POSITION SUMMARY 


Our Vancouver-based automotive QNX acoustics group (a subsidiary of BlackBerry) is focused on improving the audio experience in cars. The primary focus is on developing software that improves the quality of voice communications for hands-free cellular and VOIP calls, with growing business improving the experience within the vehicle for both communication and noise.  See the link for more details. http://blackberry.qnx.com/en/products/acoustic/index. 

We have constantly been changing projects in both software development and testing. The specific month-to-month tasks can change depending on customer or product-delivery driven needs. Programming

Set up and record microphones and speakers vehicles and/or rooms

Team programming: Version control (SVN, CVS); code merging, code review process 

Audio file experience: Audacity, Adobe Audition or similar recording software; multi-channel sound cards; wave-file processing or converting; audio signal processing 

Signal processing: DSP courses, projects to capture or process audio or video, compression, encryption, etc 

An interest in audio or signal processing (mixing or post-processing music, video capture and scene analysis, noise measurement or control)

										Security Research Student - 4 Month Winter Term
Job Summary:
Are you looking to learn like never before in a co-op position?  Are you excited about software security?  The Security Research Group might be looking for you. The Security Research Group: 


·         Finds vulnerabilities in BlackBerry software, reporting them to the development teams. 

·         Evaluates, creates, and uses tools to find new and known vulnerabilities in software. 

·         Creates developer education on types of software vulnerabilities. 

·         Performs research into vulnerability mitigations and exploits. 


You'd work with a geographically distributed team of experts in software security.  We are looking for motivated individuals who are up for the challenge of breaking the security of BlackBerry products.  We are also looking for candidates who are interested in researching new and exciting advancements to the field of software security.  On the job security mentorship training will be provided. Interest and a desire to learn is paramount for a position as a security research assistant.  Previous knowledge in computer security is very beneficial, but not required. 


Location: Waterloo, ON 

Length of Term: 4 Months
Job Responsibilities:
Your job will be customized to your skill set and what you want to learn, but could include any of the following: 

·         Finding software vulnerabilities through a variety of automated and manual approaches. 

·         Prototyping new security features to evaluate their effectiveness before being deployed. 

·         Developing internal tools that look for both well-known and specific vulnerabilities. 

·         Collecting, evaluating, documenting, and presenting research on a security topic. 

·         Assisting BlackBerry development teams with integration of new security features or usage or Security Research Group tools. 

Alongside the above, you will also be responsible for working with others in the security research group to develop your own software security expertise through the available mentorship program.
Required Skills:
·         Currently enrolled in a post-secondary program in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field of study 

·         Knowledge of at least two programming languages. 

·         A strong desire to learn, demonstrated through personal projects or self-directed learning. 

·         Strong background in at least one of the following skill sets: 

o C programming, operating system concepts, and user-space interfaces such POSIX. 

o HTTP and applied experience with a web development framework. 

o Modification of compilers, code generation, and executable linking/loading. 

o Cloud technologies such as docker containers, Kubernetes, Docker containers, Infrastructure-as-Code, AWS, Azure. 

o Static analysis concepts, including control flow graphs, data flow analysis, or parsing. 

o Python automation of security tools. 

o Automated web security testing frameworks. 

·         Strong analytical and problem solving skills demonstrated through past experience. 

·         Strong written and verbal communication skills, being able to convey highly technical information in a succinct and accurate way. 

·         Ability brainstorm, research, design, and implement extensions, improvements, or alternatives to a base concept with minimal support, getting the job done. 

·         Ability to integrate into a multi-disciplinary physically distributed team. 


ADDITIONAL ASSETS 

·         Proven ability to hack software, discover flaws, and suggest improvements, demonstrated through activities such as CTFs. 

·         Expertise in multiple technical areas. 

·         Software penetration testing. 

·         Knowledge of automated code analysis tools for identifying security issues.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Security Response Analyst Student - 4 Month Winter Term
Job Summary:
BlackBerry strives to build and maintain the most secure, trusted solutions possible. To continue our tradition of excellence, we are looking for individuals in the security space who are technically skilled, knowledgeable, passionate, and experienced to join BlackBerry. The BlackBerry Security Incident Response Team (BBSIRT) is a center of excellence working to ensure the ongoing security of our products and services for customers and partners worldwide. 


We are currently looking for a security minded student to support our efforts responding to emergent software based cyber-threats or incidents involving BlackBerry products and services. The successful candidate will work in a fast paced, highly dynamic and challenging environment and will work with various teams across the organization to support vulnerability mitigation efforts, from identification of potential issues to analysis, mitigation and related internal and external communications. The technical and threat landscape change constantly and this position would suit someone willing to learn continually while working on cutting edge technologies and handling multiple priorities. The ideal candidate will already be able to build and manage relationships in a large, complex ecosystem but must be willing to grow this experience. The role centers on solving problems at the intersection of technology and people. 


Location: Waterloo, ON 

Length of Term: 4 Months
Job Responsibilities:
Identify, track and report on emergent threats to the security of BlackBerry products, associated companies and customers.
Work with research and engineering teams to provide in-depth technical analysis of security issues and work across the organization to support and ensure holistic remediation efforts. These are often time critical.
Triage code defect based issues and quantitatively evaluate risk using industry standard metrics such as CVSS.
Prioritize and coordinate case-specific response activities, driving timely and appropriate remediation of issues. Reporting the problem is not enough; solutions should be offered.
Track and report on remediation efforts
Cultivate strong working relationships with external researchers, reporting organizations and customers to ensure effective collaboration. Work with customer facing and internal teams to continually improve processes used to identify and fix product security issues
Continually deepen knowledge and skills in support of maintaining the security of BlackBerry customers.
Create effective communications for internal and external customers, working with others to ensure professional and accurate information delivered.
Required Skills:
Currently pursuing a post-secondary degree/diploma (Bachelors, Masters, or equivalent) in Computer Science/Engineering or a related field of study
Java/C++ programming and debugging experience
Ability to analyze code behavior
Able to track and manage numerous parallel activities
Experience with issue management as well as designing/defining proactive mitigation strategies
Strong written and verbal communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences
Demonstrates advanced analytical skills
Cool under pressure, objective and diplomatic
Able to work collaboratively as part of a multi-disciplinary team

ADDITIONAL ASSETS

 

Reverse engineering skills
Knowledge of secure software development lifecycle
Understands common classes of product security vulnerabilities and attack/defense methodologies deeply
Knowledge of application security configuration and best practices
Some knowledge of wireless communications security (802.11, Bluetooth, cellular data etc)
Ability to create proof of concept exploits for common types of vulnerability

If you're driven to take enterprise, mobile and embedded technologies to the next level, it's time you join the team at BlackBerry. We offer a challenging environment that fosters creativity and rewards excellence. Employees also have use of our award winning BlackBerry technology.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Cyber Security Architecture Student - 8 Month Winter Term
Job Summary:
Within the BlackBerry Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering team, you will primarily work on and assist other team members focused on the architecture, guidance and guardrails (security controls) of Cyber Security design and implementation within our infrastructure. In this role, you may be engaged to assist with stakeholder engagement, resource co-ordination, information gathering, documentation, diagramming, threat modelling and solution development. Depending on your aptitude or chosen educational path, you may also be asked to work with the Cyber Security Governance, Risk & Compliance team to solution controls to treat risk. 

You will learn about how technology aligns to business, regulatory and contractual requirements, how solutions must be developed to consider cost, security risk and supportability and how to apply your data, people, process and technology skills to improve customer relationships and security posture. 


Depending on your skill set you may be asked to work with other stakeholders on security controls for our infrastructure platforms including: Networking, Cloud (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS), Containers, Machine Learning, Cloud Access Security Broker, Data Loss Prevention, Zero Trust Architecture, and 3rd party access design. You may also work with our Security Operations Center team to understand their requirements of tools used for Cyber Security incident handling and Cyber Security Systems team for their deployment and platform support. This may include organisational tasks as well as automation of tooling to support this function. 

  

Location: Waterloo, ON 

Length of Term: 8 Months (required)
Job Responsibilities:
Project and request coordination
Responsible for documenting and diagramming solutions to treat risk
Stakeholder engagement
Information gathering
Threat modelling
Assisting team members with Proof of Concept activities or as needed. 
Interact with teams across Cyber Security and the larger BlackBerry organization

										Cyber Security Engineering Student - 8 Month Winter Term
Job Summary:
Within the BlackBerry Cyber Security Systems team, you will primarily work on and assist other team members focused on the management of Cyber Security vulnerabilities within our infrastructure. In this role, you may be engaged to assist with the daily operations and maintenance of various vulnerability management tools, coordinate vulnerability management projects, report vulnerability relevant metrics, and develop automation tools necessary to improve or maintain the vulnerability management process. Depending on your aptitude or chosen educational path, you may also be asked to work with the Cyber Security Systems - Endpoint or Cyber Security Systems - Enterprise teams and could be asked to assist in automation, basic triage of issues and exploring new technologies. 


You will learn about various types of security vulnerabilities and the tools to track them, how the risks are managed, and how to apply your development skills to improve and enhance the vulnerability management process. 


Depending on your skill set you may be asked to support our Cyber Security Systems - Enterprise team, with opportunities to work with our PKI infrastructure team supporting both our Corporate and Service certificate requests, work with our Cyber Security Networking team on basic firewall configurations and configuration testing, work with our CSOC Engineering team on SIEM configurations and testing of configurations and support of other tools used for Cyber Security incident handling. You may also work with our Cyber Security Systems - Endpoint team assisting in configurations of our endpoint tooling and assisting in supporting end user issues. If your skill set supports it, you may also be asked to assist our Cyber Security Vulnerability Assessment team during internal and external penetration testing. This may include organisational tasks as well as automation of tooling to support this function.

										Core OS Software Development Student - 4 Month Winter Term
Job Summary:
POSITION SUMMARY 


As a member of the QNX Core-OS team, you will work at the heart of the most reliable and secure operating system in the world.  You can contribute directly to an OS that controls systems in everything from infotainment systems to the internet, from medical devices to space systems, from manufacturing to nuclear power plants, and of course, in the next wave of self-driving cars.   The Core-OS team is responsible for, among other things, kernel development, hypervisor development, memory management, process management, OS services, key libraries, and file systems. 

   

You will be part of a group of co-ops working with the Core-OS team, coding in C for the operating system. You will also have opportunities to work on other OS projects. You will receive advanced training on C, operating systems, and QNX, and be paired with a mentor. 


Location: Ottawa, ON 

Length of Term: 4 Months
Job Responsibilities:
RESPONSIBILITIES 


Students will work as part of the Core OS team and participate in: 


Design discussions 

Developing, debugging, and submitting code 

Code reviews 

Test creation/execution 

Documentation
Required Skills:
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS 


Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or similar fields of study 

All development will be done in C; therefore good knowledge of C is required 

Strong problem solving and debugging skills 

Good communication skills including verbal, written, and interpersonal 

High degree of motivation and ability to work both independently and in a team environment 


ADDITIONAL ASSETS 


Familiarity with QNX, BSD, Linux or other UNIX-like operating systems. 

Familiarity with software debug/analysis tools such as gdb 

Understanding of how user level processes work across each layer of the operating system, including process and thread life cycles, memory management, system calls, and inter-process communication 

Understanding of operating system concepts, including scheduling, concurrency, and resource management 

Understanding of multi-cpu, multi-threaded architectures and real-time systems 

Knowledge of operating system architectures

Premium Support customers rely heavily on BlackBerry. They consider BlackBerry to be mission critical and they want the experts they engage with to develop an intimate knowledge of their deployment and mobility management goals. BlackBerry Technical Support Services delivers expertise, options and tools that are second to none, and provides Premium Support customers with a strategic support partner that can reinforce their mobile business objectives. 


As an Enterprise Support Relations Technical Analyst Student, you will triage outstanding technical issues, advise on upcoming software releases, and notify customers of known issues that may be of interest. You will work collaboratively to ensure your assigned customers are receiving world class service from BlackBerry, discuss goals and objectives to drive their business forward with the BlackBerry Solution.

In essence, you will become an advocate for the customer regarding all technical issues. Your business skills, coupled with a background in technology, make you well positioned to become completely familiar with the business and technical environment in which the customer uses BlackBerry products. Responsible for all support-related customer-facing account-level communications, conflict resolution and advocate for the post-sales technical interests of your customer roster

Communicate the customer's goals and represent the customer's interests internally by developing and delivering monthly account summaries and detailed quarterly service reviews for each assigned customer 


Report to the Manager of Enterprise Support Relations, providing regular input on all account activity, including status and call reports on a weekly basis
