Job Title:
NEW
									



										IVY Platform Product Management Student - 4 or 8 Month Winter Term
Job Summary:
The BlackBerry IoT Business Unit combines BlackBerry's core IoT assets across the company, including the BTS (QNX, Jarvis, Certicom, Radar) and BlackBerry IVY, which is an edge-first secure and intelligent in-vehicle data platform that provides automakers with cloud-controlled access to vehicle data in order to produce and share insights consistently with a global digital ecosystem of developers to deliver actionable value on vehicle data at scale. The BlackBerry IVY Product Management and Ecosystem organization is focused on developing and delivering on this vision of BlackBerry IVY through delivery of software and services that will be used by vehicle OEMs and also the broader development community worldwide.   


We are looking for candidates in a variety of roles including software developers & testers, researchers, product managers & project managers, quality control & technical content specialists, and more. Successful candidates will work towards the common goal of delivering innovative new technologies to ensure BlackBerry IVY delivers on its vision. This role is an opportunity to work as an integral part of the IVY Product Management and Ecosystem team. In addition to contributing to the overall strategy within BlackBerry IVY, the Product Management team is responsible for building and driving a roadmap, and working with our development team to move technology deliverables through our development process to full lifecycle management. 


The candidate will help define the vision and execution of the BlackBerry IVY product roadmap. Key activities will include supporting team members throughout the processes of requirements management, competitive research, entry, and assisting in product definition with the responsible Product Manager's guidance. The successful candidate will be a key contributor to feature definition, development and delivery of new features and concepts in future technologies, and will have the ability to shadow an established Product Manager on the team to learn the "Product Management Trade" and get valuable experience working with different teams globally. 


Location: Waterloo, ON 

Length of Term: 4 or 8 months
Job Responsibilities:
Competitive market analysis of relevant application, technology and feature offerings
Researching and writing product requirements for current and future BlackBerry software technologies
Managing the development of technology within the BlackBerry IVY development process - from idea to proof-of-concept stage, including feature definition, implementation, and go-to-market strategy development as required
Prioritizing work efforts with development, design and test engineering teams to ensure the right experiences and features are delivered on time and to specification, including direct engagement in our Agile development process as a Product Owner if feasible
Opportunity identification for new BlackBerry software features, applications, and services
Deep analysis of what features or portions of a feature bring true user benefit and analyze potential trade-offs/risks to implementing new features
Required Skills:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or MBA degree with deep technology focus preferred
Passionate about customer experience and understanding user needs
Strong organizational, data gathering and analytical skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills

ADDITIONAL ASSETS

Deep interest in creating and analyzing products

Job Summary:
Game Development Co-op Programmer (Remote) 


Blackbird is an independent studio in Vancouver, working with two of the largest publishers on the planet for our upcoming games. On top of our partnerships, we're also developing a completely original game that's going to knock your proverbial socks off. All that said, we can't actually talk about these sweet projects yet. But take our word for it, we're committed to making AAA game experiences and being one of the best game studios to work for. If you're interested in joining a passionate, growing and awesome programming team, apply now! 


About the Position: 


Depending on your skills, interests and experience and our current project needs the focus will be on one or more of gameplay, tool development, user interface, audio, and graphics. You will be responsible for the full life cycle of development, from requirements analysis with the design and art team through technical design, implementation, testing and bug fixing. You are guaranteed to learn a lot about software development.
Job Responsibilities:
Preferred Experience Level: 


Senior student with at least one or two prior work terms (although not essential). 


At Blackbird, we're all about being true to our roots. We started small in our CEO's garage, and even though we're expanding, our desire is to stick to that foundation of creativity, community, and collaboration. Our team has proved that great ideas can come from any position in any discipline, so it's important to us to make sure every voice is heard. 


Work/life balance is extremely important to us, and we've demonstrated that over the years by severely limiting over-time requirements. We want people to be happy about coming to work every day, and to that end we offer lots of opportunities for growth and development-whether it's lunch and learns, team events and flexible schedules. We also try to provide every opportunity possible for our employees to spearhead R&D initiatives through our Black Ops program. In short, don't expect to feel like a cog in a machine working for BBI. 


All roles will commence as a work-from-home arrangement. This arrangement will be revisited as COVID-19 government regulations are eased.
Required Skills:
Required Qualifications: 


C# or C++ programming experience. Ability to refine loose requirements and work independently in a fast-paced collaborative environment. Passion and enthusiasm for games and coding and a desire to innovate and learn. 


Other Desirable Qualifications: 


Personal or professional game development experience; profiling and optimization; experience working in teams; experience working with Unity, Unreal, or other professional game engines; participation in game jams; embedded systems experience.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Blackwell strives to create a lasting and positive impact on our communities, our built environment, and our industry. A career at Blackwell provides you with an opportunity to make a difference and be a part of shaping a better future. Blackwell delivers a broad range of structural engineering services regardless of project size or complexity, helping realize our clients' vision and solving problems with appropriate design solutions. Since 1987, Blackwell has worked collaboratively with architects, developers, and building owners across North America. 


With a total of 60 engineers, designers, and staff located in 4 offices (Toronto, Waterloo, Victoria, and Halifax), Blackwell provides an inspiring environment where our talented team is enabled to think creatively and do great work 


Working in our dynamic office, you will contribute to new and ongoing projects along with your colleagues. You will gain a thorough understanding of the path a project makes through our office, from the pre-design phase through to post-construction. You will also gain experience in the field, visiting sites and collaborating with project partners. This is a hands-on position that requires attention to detail and a positive, team-oriented attitude.
Job Responsibilities:
Review shop drawings from contractors
Participate in field/site reviews
Perform drafting in CAD (and possibly Revit)
Analyze structural designs
Maintain files and archiving projects
Contribute to office administration
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Excellent practical knowledge of AutoCAD and Microsoft Office applications
Revit experience an asset

Required Courses          

Statics / Mechanics of Solids 1&2 / Structure and Properties of Materials / Structural Analysis 1 / 

Structural Concrete Design 1 / Structural Steel Design 1

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development

Job Summary:
We are a product + design + dev shop. We bill our clients hourly in USD. We give all IP to our clients and are long-term partners with a dozen well-funded startups (e.g., backed by a16z, YC, etc.) and multiple Fortune 100 companies. We are 3 years old, employee-owned, and 100+ employees. We are already profitable.  


Our teams are passionate about UX. We practice test-driven development. We are transparent about finances and compensation. We want diversity by design. We systematically invest the majority of our profit in recruiting, training, and mentoring each other. 


Our mission is to create meaningful jobs for millions of people, by teaching them how to build human centered products engineered for AI. 


https://www.bld.ai/

As an Associate Product Manager we expect you to be an aspiring entrepreneur with dreams of being your own business owner. You will work with other Product Managers to find business, write proposals, and lead teams to build digital products that people want. Work with PMs to identify new business opportunities
Write proposals to help clients solve their problems

Apply lateral thinking to challenging situations

Previous PM experience required
Experience building a product that you can demo for us
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English
Embrace feedback with a growth mindset

Job Summary:
Bloom Burton Securities Inc. is a healthcare-specialized investment banking firm located in Toronto, Ontario and is a member firm of the Investment Industry Regulatory Organization of Canada (IIROC) and the Canadian Investor Protection Fund (CIPF). Our firm is uniquely dedicated to accelerating returns for both investors and companies in the healthcare sector. Bloom Burton has an experienced team composed of banking, capital markets, medical, and scientific professionals who perform a deep level of diligence, which combined with our creative and entrepreneurial approach, assists our clients in reaching the most appropriate monetization events. Bloom Burton and its affiliates provide capital raising, M&A advisory, institutional sales and trading, equity research, business and scientific consulting services, asset management and company formation and incubation services. 


We are seeking a highly motivated individual who is passionate about the capital markets and the healthcare sector to join our investment banking team as a Co-Op Investment Banking Analyst. During this Co-Op placement, the individual will assume the role of a fulltime Investment Banking Analyst and work closely with members of the investment banking team while gaining exposure to many aspects of the investment banking function within our firm.

Job Summary:
Bloomberg software engineers develop impactful solutions to complex, real-world problems. This is no different for our co-op program. Engineering co-ops take ownership of their projects under the mentorship of full-time software engineers. We are looking for top computer science students who are passionate about technology and eager to learn in our high energy, fast-paced environment. 


As a co-op, you'll become an expert on the Bloomberg Terminal and gain a deeper understanding of technology and finance. In addition to your projects, you'll participate in coding challenges, attend tech talks and network with other interns.
Job Responsibilities: As a Software Engineering at Bloomberg, you will explore exciting aspects of the intersection of technology and finance. You will join a team that owns all phases of the development lifecycle for some of Bloomberg's premier products where you will be given a substantial development project. All co-ops receive on-the-job training to help enhance their programming skills and to instill a working familiarity with Bloomberg's systems.
Required Skills:
Take ownership of projects under the guidance of your mentor
Be a collaborative member of your team
Have a strong understanding of data structures and algorithms
Be an excellent problem solver
Have programming experience in C, C++, Java or Python
Have a cumulative average of 73% or higher

Job Summary:
Bluerover is a leader in the Internet of Things. Bluerover is engineering unique and customized business solutions, by combining sensor technology, data intelligence, and automated processes, within a secure, scalable, and open architecture platform. With Bluerover technology, data is collected in an infinite stream from the business environments, and processed, presented and reported to the customer within a scalable, internet based platform.

We are looking for a Co-op Student Product Developer, Web Application to plan, manage, execute, and maintain the Bluerover product suite. The position goal is to create innovative, high quality, and stable software systems.

The Co-op Student Product Developer, Web Application role calls for someone with a passion for product development using those tools and best practices to deliver best in class solutions. The solutions that you develop will be used to configure, control and manage IoT solutions. At Bluerover you will have the opportunity to engage with a wide range of engineering disciplines.

This person should be able to apply accepted software design principles, demonstrate exceptional problem solving skills and possess strong communication skills.

The most important attribute of a candidate is the ability to deliver high quality products to market. We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, and will see this as an opportunity to achieve a world-class product deployment.
Job Responsibilities:
Execute the development plan with the software engineering team.  This involves coding, code review with team members, and testing. 
Assess third party and open source software.
Analyse and enhance efficiency, stability and scalability of system resources.
Integrate and validate new product designs to existing products.
Support software QA and optimise performance.
Provide production and post production support.
Refactor existing code.
Required Skills:
Currently enrolled in Computer Science or Engineering.
Experience in software development and troubleshooting.
	
Programming experience with Web Applications and Linux.
Programming languages: JavaScript, SQL, HTML, and CSS.


Familiarity with software configuration management tools, defect tracking tools, and peer review
Excellent knowledge of OS coding techniques, IP protocols, interfaces and hardware subsystems
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Qualify for ITAC Talent Work Integrated Learning Program
	
Canadian citizen, permanent resident or have refugee status
Eligible to work in Canada
Enrolled in full-time program at post-secondary level


This is an on-site position that require in-person attentance, not a remote position.

Job Summary:
Bluescape Construction Management Inc. is a construction management firm specializing in mid-rise and high-rise residential construction. We work with condominium developers from project inception all the way through to purchaser occupancy.  


The successful candidate will be an Assistant Site Clerk on one of our current projects nearing completion in Toronto. The role will include reporting to the Assistant Site Superintendent and carrying out a number of tasks in readying condominium suites for turnover to owners and readying the buidings major systems for turnover to the condominium corporation.  


The successful candidiate will be required to attend site meetings. Experience in construction, especially residential, will be an asset.  


We invite all candidates to visit our website at http://www.bluescape.ca.
Job Responsibilities:
The primary responsibilites of the role will be to: 


- track deficiencies in suites 

- maintain suite completion logs 

- communicate directly with trades to ensure work is being completed on schedule 

- report to the assistant site superintendent to trouble shoot any site issues that have arisen 

- coordinate material deliveries with trades

- Interest in construction management and implementation of complex architectural designs 

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Microsoft Project

Job Summary:
Job Title
Junior Software Engineering
About BluRoot, Inc.
At BluRoot, Inc., our team is empowering small and medium businesses to unlock the potential of their business through CRM software. We have two primary divisions: BluMortgage (our mortgage broker CRM) and Professional Services (our custom solution division).
 
Within BluMortgage (blumortgage.ca/), we are building a single, fully-integrated service for mortgage brokers across Canada- seamlessly integrating all mortgage services into a single, easy-to-use platform. We are continuously expanding our product by building 3rd-party integrations and updating BluMortgage with modern best practices for an exceptional user experience. Our tech stack consists of Rust, React and Node.JS.
 
For our Professional Services division (bluroot.ca/), we work with businesses to create custom solutions on the Zoho suite of products to meet their business-specific problems. Our tech stack consists of Zoho's proprietary scripting language, Deluge.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Description

BluMortgage (primary area of focus)
-Develop key 3rd-party integrations with service providers used by mortgage brokers. This includes some major financial institutions in Canada
-Deliver a solid user experience building embedded front-end applications with React and the Node.js ecosystem
-Build and maintain reliable back-end services using Rust and Node.js
-Assess, report on, and fix bugs in a timely fashion to maintain existing integration infrastructure
-Rigorously test 3rd-party integrations to ensure continual uptime. This is essential given the sensitive financial nature of these integrations
-Work with our implementation and support team to ensure that the features that we deploy to our customers are well documented and supported

Professional Services (secondary area of focus)

-Implement the proposed solution within the Zoho suite of products. For our professional services, we use the same methods as BluMortgage to build solutions as well as Zoho's native language, Deluge for backend functions
-Test the solution across many potential use cases to ensure robust functionality
-Where required, create process flow documentation to describe the implemented solution
Required Skills:
What we Expect from a Candidate
-Eagerness to learn the fundamentals of software development (object oriented programming, algorithms, data structures)
-Understanding of systems integration, i.e. RESTful web services, webhooks, and best practices around synchronizing data between two systems
-Be agile, and ready to move between multiple projects and adapt to changing requirements
-Pride in your finished product. Be obsessed with writing clean code, and devising test plans to ensure that the code you write and systems you build remain resilient
-We do not require that you have any previous experience with the specific languages and frameworks that we use, only that you come with a passion to learn and ability to adapt quickly
-Excellent English verbal and written communication skills
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
What is Bold Commerce?

Named one of North America's fastest-growing companies by Deloitte, Bold Commerce provides innovative ecommerce technology for businesses of all sizes. We believe Bold brands should have the ability to create and customize powerful transaction experiences - across all channels. Staples Canada, Vera Bradley and Harry Rosen are among the 90,000+ brands in over 170 countries that trust Bold's suite of ecommerce tools to power their online stores every day. 


We're made up of more than 400 professionals (and growing) who live and breathe ecommerce, and truly care about what we do. We call ourselves Builders. Here at Bold, we live by the BUILDERS Code, our shared set of practices, beliefs, and values that help to shape this dynamic company. 


Why work at Bold?

Our founders have worked to create and maintain a place that our employees look forward to coming to every day. A place where you can learn and grow, where your ideas are valued and where you can do cool things, all while contributing to the larger success of the company. At Bold we embrace and cultivate a culture of creativity, innovation, and collaboration in order to allow everyone to do their best work every day. 


Bold adopts an agile methodology that focuses on releasing small things frequently, providing rapid feedback, and delivering value to merchants every day. Bold embraces agile practices including test-driven development (TDD), continuous integration (CI), continuous delivery (CD), short iterations, daily standups, retros, and pair programming.
Job Responsibilities:
More than just technical skills, we're looking for like-minded individuals who are generally awesome and will make the office a better place for everyone. 


Here's what we're looking for

We're looking for co-op students who are interested in learning and growing their skills in a fast-paced environment where we use leading-edge technologies. Our co-op students work on one of Bold's development teams of highly skilled developers, shipping code on production systems to Bold's merchants. 


See what our co-op students have to say about working at Bold!
Required Skills:
We're looking for someone who:

- Likes to get sh!t done 

- Thrives in an environment of talented, hard-working people 

- Resonates with our values 

- Is motivated and passionate about shipping high quality software 

- Is driven to take a feature from concept to production 

- Has an interest in building scalable and secure distributed systems 

- An understanding of software delivery 


What you will learn/nice to haves:

- Experience with PHP, Go, Ruby, or Javascript 

- Comfortable with OSX or Linux 

- Experience with or interest in TDD, CI, and CD 

- Experience working with Laravel, or other Symfony based frameworks 

- Front-end Frameworks like React, Angular, or VueJS 

- Docker, Kubernetes, and Google Cloud Platform or another cloud platform 

- Concourse, Jenkins, or other CI systems 

- MySQL, Postgres, or other database management systems

Targeted Clusters

				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Machine learning is changing how companies invest. A few firms have managed to build in-house ML teams and are rapidly outperforming their competitors. Hedge funds and banks are now looking for alternative ways to utilize machine learning without investing into their own dedicated ML team. 


Boosted.ai (http://boosted.ai) makes machine learning investment techniques accessible to the rest of the market. We ingest and clean a huge volume of financial data, and allow users to create and test their own models through our web product. We are a leader in this market and have major banks and hedge funds among our customers. 


You will work with a talented and experienced team of professionals from the finance, machine learning, and software engineering worlds. We have offices in New York City and Toronto (this position is located in our Downtown Toronto office with a remote option available).
Job Responsibilities: We are looking for Full Stack Engineer who will own one or more components of our AWS cloud system and relevant pieces of our front-end web product. The end users of the applications include both internal stakeholders as well as external clients located across the globe. You will work on our main components including portfolio construction, data ingestion, stock search and custom data integration.
Required Skills:
Required: 

- Strong problem solving skills 

- Data structure and algorithm fundamentals 

- Excellent written and verbal communication 


Preferred: 

- Interest in machine learning and financial industry 

- Experience with web development and React 

- Experience with Java 

- Experience with Python 

- Experience with AWS
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
BLG is committed to an ambitious program of Digital Transformation. To that end BLG has established a Digital Hub to explore, test and develop innovative technology solutions for our clients and ourselves. The Digital Hub team is part of the Knowledge and Innovation team at BLG, responsible for creating solutions and bridging identifiable gaps.

At the Digital Hub, we value three things above all: team spirit, a mindset for change and empowerment through a clear set of behaviours, perspectives and boundaries. We believe these are interdependent and critical to the growth and success of us as individuals, as a team and as a firm. 

We are seeking a student software developer to assist us in building scalable, high quality and high performance solutions primarily on the Microsoft technology stack. As a developer with the Digital Hub, you will assist in delivering great end-to-end software experiences. You will be responsible for building, maintaining and deploying internal and external facing applications and services.  You must respect deadlines and make sure that the quality of your work meets the Firm's standards. You will be required to collaborate with co-workers and stakeholders to deliver highly-performing enterprise solutions.
Job Responsibilities:
Development

Develop new functionalities for existing applications or create a solution from the grounds-up. The responsibilities 

include:
 

From requests or business requirements, develop application solutions
Participate in evaluating development efforts impacts and estimates
Ensure that standards and procedures defined at BLG are always followed
Carry out unitary and functional tests in order to ensure quality of deliverables
Work in close collaboration with Digital Hub colleagues and all Technology Services members in order to ensure that all applications are functional
Write the necessary documentation related to the applications

Maintenance

Maintenance of existing applications, requests can be to:

Job Summary:
Borden Ladner Gervais LLP, one of Canada's largest law firms, is seeking a Land Use Planner Student for a 4 month Co-op placement commencing in January 2022.  This is an exciting opportunity to learn and advance your career in a role within a firm that actively strives to be the best in the industry. 


Purpose of the Role

The Land Use Planner - Student will be expected to assist our Land Use Planner in providing municipal planning services to our professionals in a variety of legal disciplines. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to be mentored and advance their career as part of a talented team. 


Our Land Use Planning students work on a wide range of planning related projects, gaining invaluable experience, leaving this position with a very strong understanding of the planning industry. Through our distinctive client-focused approach, you will work with some of Ontario's most significant public institutions and private corporations. 


Application    

If you are interested in becoming part of our team, please apply on WaterlooWorks. 


We thank all applicants for their interest in this position, however, only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. 


Everyone at BLG is required to carry out the duties of their role while upholding the important principles of our respectful 

workplace policies, and treating everyone with respect, regardless of position. At BLG, valuing diversity and inclusion is key to a 

respectful workplace. 


BLG is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse 

candidates, including people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects 

of the selection process. 


*Please note that relatives of current BLG employees and Partners are not eligible for consideration. 


We are BLG: Canada's Law Firm. Our culture is one of vigilance and curiosity, Firm-wide collaboration, unfailing mutual respect and dedication. We pride ourselves on having standout talent and delivering an exceptional client experience. 

We are a future-minded Firm delivering high-value advice and known for our unwavering commitment to innovation, diversity and inclusion, community involvement and talent development. Learn more about us at www.blg.com.
Job Responsibilities:

-    Good problem solving skills and ability to manage multiple priorities within tight timelines

Job Summary:
ABOUT BOSS INSIGHTS
Boss Insights provides business lenders access to their customers' financial data ... in minutes. We have a single connection to accounting and commerce data (i.e. Quickbooks, Stripe, SalesForce, etc.). Here's a quick video to learn more.
Winning 5 awards including Top 25 Executive Leader in Lending, we've secured clients, partners and have been fortunate to be covered by The American Banker, Bank Automation News, American Banking Association, The Financial Brand, and Forbes.
We're a highly focused fintech providing a game-changing platform to banks, credit unions and private lenders. We have a cutting-edge technology product that is badly needed in the financial industry, you'll be part of a team meeting with a diverse set of financial organizations to help them improve the lives of their business customers by promoting new and innovative ways to collaborate. Boss Insights has been published in major publications (CBC) as a great place to work.

THE OPPORTUNITY
At Boss Insights, we attribute our success to the strength of our marketing team. To build on this momentum, we're looking for a zealous Marketing Coordinator to support the team in its primary and administrative duties. From day one, you will contribute to existing marketing programs, while assisting with the development of new initiatives aligned with company and client goals. 
The ideal candidate will have prior experience with a wide range of marketing functions, including communications, advertising, branding, digital marketing, and social media. The marketing coordinator must be an organized multitasker able to handle many diverse projects at once and meet deadlines.

WHY JOIN US?
AWESOME TEAM - Our founders have successfully startup enterprise-level organizations in the past - it's the best of all worlds! Our sales team is outcome-oriented and collaborative. We've expanded the management team and continue to grow. We perform best when everyone is doing work they care about and that capitalizes on their strengths.
MAKE YOUR MARK - We are growing fast. With that growth comes opportunity. As an early-stage employee, you will have the opportunity to grow with us, make your mark introducing best practices and building out a framework for our sales organization. 
FLEXIBILITY - This role is flexible and can be remote when needed.
INNOVATION - We are building the world's leading data platform and innovation is at our core. We will take an active role in your growth by providing experiences to help stretch your capabilities and ensure you are learning new skills all the time. We're also open to new ideas and hire people who want to be part of change - if you want your ideas heard and actioned - you've come to the right place.

HOURS:  40 Hours per week
Job Responsibilities:
CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Support the Marketing Manager in evaluating and establishing the marketing plan and strategy to attract inbound leads by setting objectives, planning, execution, tracking, and reporting
Manage social media including planning the social media calendar, creating content and updates, and managing campaigns
Assist in setting up and executing marketing automation 
Create newsletters
Completing and submitting program applications
Assist in day-to-day marketing activities including website content updates, organizing marketing folders, weekly marketing meetings, preparing marketing activity reports and metrics for measuring program success and other marketing administrative tasks
And such other duties and responsibilities that can be requested from time to time
Required Skills:
WHO YOU ARE

"It doesn't make sense to hire smart people and tell them what to do; We hire smart people so they can tell us what to do." - Steve Jobs 

  

We're looking for you if you're ready, willing and able to get traction. We're entrepreneurs. We live for a challenge. We want to collaborate, not assign work. If you're hired at Boss Insights, it's because you're exceptional. That's why we hire for add, not fit. We perform best when everyone cares about their work and is exceptionally capable. The team works closely with each other and with the founders to drive results. So if you have an idea that will help the company, speak up daily - we consider it your duty. 

  

SOFT SKILLS

Optimistic and positive professional, excited by challenges and ready with solutions
Able to thrive in a fast-paced, high growth, rapidly changing environment that requires tenacity to exploit opportunities and a steady demeanour to handle challenge.
The poster child for start-up hustle: change is your only constant, no challenge is too big, and no task is too small
Self-motivated and excited by the potential to own what you do
You have the willingness to learn and adapt as needed
Excellent presentation and communication skills, are outgoing and sociable, and enjoy meeting new people
A multi-tasker and connector, as well as an organized operator who executes on both internal and external responsibilities
Deep curiosity, excellent listening skills, empathy, and ability to get things done in a collaborative team environment

  

HARD SKILLS

Bachelor's degree/or in progress in marketing, advertising, or communications
1-2 years of past work experience as a marketing coordinator or similar role
Knowledge of traditional and digital marketing, content marketing, social media marketing, PR & media relations
Excellent writing, communication, and presentation skills
Proficiency in full Microsoft Office suite, especially with Excel and PowerPoint
Proficiency in video editing software and graphic design software (Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, etc)
Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and customer relationship management (CRM) tools
Experience in creating email automation (MailChimp, Active Campaign, etc)
Knowledge in Google Analytics, SEO, SEM is an added advantage
Experience working with budgets and forecasting

Job Summary:
Bousfields Inc. is one of the pre-eminent community planning firms in Ontario with special expertise in urban and community design, planning policy, community engagement, complex development approvals, and project management. 

  

Bousfields offers a full range of land use planning and urban design services to the development industry, municipalities and government agencies. The firm remains small enough to ensure that each project is managed directly by one of the senior practitioners in the firm. In addition, as land use planning and urban design specialists, the firm is frequently a prominent team player within multi-disciplinary consortiums of firms having complementary skills. We quite often act as the prime facilitator or project manager coordinating the overall project design and working with a number of different landowners and municipal staff. 

  

We are looking for a Planning Intern to work primarily remotely out of our Toronto office. The Planning Intern will assist professional staff in a variety of activities and have the opportunity to learn from our experienced and well-respected members of the planning community.
Job Responsibilities:
Assist in the preparation of various reports including Community Services and Facilities Studies.
Assist professional staff in the preparation of presentation materials to the public, Committees and Councils, clients, and stakeholders.
Assist staff in collecting, compiling, and preparing research data and information on a variety of planning issues and properties across the GTHA (and other municipalities as required).
Provide high-quality service to clients in a timely and efficient manner.
Assist professional staff with application submissions including physical delivery.
Assist professional staff at community meetings.
Carry out site visits, taking notes, and photography as required.
Conduct administrative functions related to file management.
Maintain project files and records.
Provide support to other professional staff as required.
Required Skills:
General knowledge of the provincial and municipal policy and regulatory framework.
General understanding of the municipal planning processes.
General knowledge of planning practices and principles.
Demonstrate competency of software programs, including Microsoft Office and Adobe Creative Suite.
Strong English oral and written communication skills.
Analytical, research, and interpretive skills.
Ability to work independently or in a team environment as needed.
Creative problem-solving and solution-finding skills within a defined planning framework.
Understand the importance of being self-motivated and organized.
Ability to relate well and work with all Bousfields staff.
Ability and willingness to be flexible and take on additional assignments as required.
Participate in corporate events, committees, and initiatives to build upon and improve firm culture.

Job Summary:
At Brookfield Properties, our success starts with our people. People like you.

We develop, operate, and manage more than 650 properties and 325 million square feet of real estate across the globe. It's a feat that wouldn't be possible without our team, a diverse group of creative visionaries and innovative experts who are relentless in pursuit of one goal: to ensure our buildings don't simply meet the needs of our tenants, residents, and communities - but exceed them, every day.

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations - bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It's why the world's most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If you're ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

Job Summary:
WELCOME TO BRP


We're a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce of over 14,500 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it's not about the destination; It's about the journey. Yours. 


Kick-Start Your Career

BRP's internship program is truly one of a kind. We hire close to 300 interns each year from all backgrounds, skill levels, professions and trades. Bring a good attitude and we'll offer you an unforgettable learning experience. At BRP, we believe in investing in our employees and helping them achieve their greatest potential. 


Learn from the best

You'll work with an experienced team of professionals in your field who will show you the ropes. You'll get to work on company projects that are both personally fulfilling and globally impactful. At BRP, you'll also be surrounded with world-class colleagues who are supportive, motivated and ambitious. What's more, we offer free accommodations and paid transportation so that you can fully enjoy your working experience in the beautiful Eastern Townships region.  


Advantages of this internship: 

To show your sense of innovation. 
To work in an environment where collaboration is an essential value. 
To be part of a team that is passionate about new technologies and lead BRP's transition to electrification of its products.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsabilities: 

Develop parts for the product line
Perform benchmark studies, functional analyzes, cost studies and prototyping
Set up tests of vehicles, electric power pack components and carry out the tests
Perform analyzes and validation of Simulink blocks in a digital Twin vehicle
Correlation test results and simulations
Develop engineering specifications and validations in laboratory or physical tests.
Required Skills:
Required profile: 

Interest in motorized products
Spoken and written languages : French and English 
Interest in programming (Matlab / simulink) and mechatronic systems
Ability to put ideas into practice 
Autonomy, able to manage projects simultaneously 
Promotes teamwork and good communicator.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering

Organization: Bruce County Chiropractic and Rehabilitation Center
Job Summary:
Bruce County Chiropractic and Rehabilitation Center is a busy multi-disciplinary clinic located in Port Elgin, Ontario.   

  

Our clinic is 6450 square feet with 19 treatments rooms. Our gym consists of high-end rehabilitative equipment including a Precore Functional Training system, an arm ergometer, a shuttle machine, a treadmill, a squat rack, a rebounder, parallel bars, stairs, an elliptical, a recumbent bike, a spin bike and much more. Services offered at our clinic include orthopedic and paediatric physiotherapy, concussion management, pelvic floor physiotherapy, shockwave therapy, class IV laser therapy, chiropractic adjustments, custom bracing, orthotic therapy, Active Release Therapy, Graston therapy, medical acupuncture, and running analysis. We are looking for a co-op student who is motivated to learn, wants to be part of a team and has a keen desire to work with patients that have a variety of injuries.
Job Responsibilities:
Implement treatment plans, designed by physiotherapist and chiropractors. 
Prepare and apply hot and cold therapy to patients. 
Assist patients with their rehabilitation programs and correct any incorrect forms. 
Prepare rehabilitation programs designed by the chiropractors and physiotherapist for patients. 
Administer electrotherapy treatments including ultrasound, IFC, tens, laser therapy and EMS. 
Monitor patients and record necessary information as advised by the chiropractor/physiotherapist. 
Stock rooms with required supplies.  
Add exercises and stretches to database as required and videotape exercises and stretches as required. 
Research different injuries/conditions and learn related anatomy, different orthopedic tests and different treatment options 
Learn different taping techniques using athletic tape and KT tape
Required Skills:
Good observation and organizational skills 
The ability to deal with people who are under physical and emotional stress 
The ability to work independently and as part of a team 
The ability to encourage patient confidence and participation 
Flexibility and adaptability 
Good interpersonal skills 
Good oral and written communication skills 
Patience 
Ability to maintain confidentiality 
The ability to follow directions closely

Job Summary:
BTNX Inc. is a biotechnology company and a world leader in rapid, point-of-care diagnostics. We specialize in innovation, research, development and manufacturing of advanced in-vitro diagnostic (IVD) tests for laboratories, clinics, hospitals and physicians offices. BTNX Inc. also develops information technology systems to manage point-of-care diagnostic test results using HL7/POCT1-A2 compliant software solutions. 


This is your opportunity to join a small team to gain some real exposure and see what it means to be a software developer. You will be working directly with Senior Management and have the chance to see your work shape the company profile. This is not a job where you sit at your cubicle and blend in, rather, you will be involved in development meetings with the CEO and senior staff where you will be asked to comment and contribute. Aside from being technically strong, you must have the business acumen to understand the direct impact your work has on the company, and will get the opportunity to see your work implemented. Because you will play such an important role in our company, there will be direct accountability for your work. If you are passionate about your work and want to be challenged then this is the place for you.
Job Responsibilities:
You will be working on software projects for BTNX.  You will have the following responsibilities:
 

working with project managers and other stakeholders to define requirements and make business decisions
coding, testing and deployment of software solutions
commitment to the success of projects through the complete SDLC
researching and applying technologies and processes to help projects succeed
thinking outside the box
Required Skills:
Base Qualifications
 

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field
Familiarity with all aspects of SDLC
Knowledge of coding best practices
Experience in windows/web development
Experience or interest in machine learning
Experience or interest in mobile app development
SQL-based database experience 


Technology Preferences
 

VS / .NET / C# / ASP.NET Core / VB.NET
Mobile cross platform development (Xamarin Forms, React Native)
Python (Tensorflow, OpenCV)
SQL Server
Entity framework
WinForms and WPF design

Additional Preferences

 

HTML 5, CSS
JavaScript including React JS, Angular JS and JQuery
MVC and API

Job Summary:
Building Enclosure Labs Inc. (BELi) is a busy building science consulting and laboratory testing company.  It is an exciting time to work with our start up as we just moved into an office/laboratory space in London, Ontario. The bulk of current company work is laboratory testing of building materials, embodied carbon calculations, and building enclosure design and forensic support.  


The role of the co-op student position is to both assist with ongoing work and assist setting up our laboratory space. This includes material testing, research report writing, and laboratory maintenance. The co-op student will be trained in a wide variety of masonry durability and thermal material property testing procedures mostly on samples from historical buildings. These testing results will be used to help guide project team typically in deep energy retrofit projects.  The student will also gain experience in embodied carbon and thermal performance analysis by assisting with data collection.  This position is a good fit for students who want to be exposed to leading edge sustainable building design and interested in detailed computational and laboratory analysis.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities:
 

Conduct masonry testing
Compile, organize, analyze, and plot data using Excel or other programs
Assemble test reports
Assist with dimensional takeoff from drawings for use in thermal performance and embodied carbon analysis
Assist with office and laboratory fitout and setup as needed
Required Skills:
Required Skills:
 

Proficiency in excel and similar programs
Ability to process and perform testing procedures
Construction experience an asset

Job Summary:
Company

BuildMemo Technologies was created to provide the ultimate fundraising platform for startups. Our real time collaborative editor lets teams assemble, iterate and share their fundraising material, while providing analytics on the investors they are interacting with. We work closely with Techstars, Clearco, On Deck, and AngelList to power our ecosystem. 


Who we are

Mark Dhillon CEO - Operator, Venture Capitalist, Engineer. Mark has experience leading and advising early stage companies all the way to billion dollar + Public companies. Having been on both sides of the venture capital table, Memo was created to carry out his dream of startup funding that tilts the playing field back towards the entrepreneur. 


Zac Smith CTO - Waterloo Grad and Founding Engineer @ Clearco, built everything from client side experiences, machine learning platforms, financial optimization engines. Has led software, data and product teams. Obsessed with economics Zac sees anything that can accelerate startup creation as the most important task facing the world.
Job Responsibilities: While we are hiring you as a co-op we want to treat you the same as any of our full time employees. Our goal will be to have you contributing production code within your first week, such that by the time you leave us you have the skills and confidence to work with any modern dev team. Past co-ops working with me have gone on to careers at Apple, Amazon, and Stripe. We are a startup in the truest sense of the word, there is no shortage of interesting problems to solve and we guarantee you will not be bored!

Previous fullstack web dev experience a plus, though not required (our stack -> js, svelte, python, sql, cloud platforms, git, docker)

Have written at least one program that calls a REST API prior to the interview.

We are seeking a Bilingual Help Desk Technician (English/French) for a student Co-op position with our growing, dynamic information technology department. As part of our team, you will help execute the department and company's strategic vision through various IT initiatives. We are working to continually improve the processes, services provided to our business units and business partners. 


This role requires active involvement in technical support for the business units at the Corporate Office and remote store sites. 


This position is on site and requires the applicant to be fully vaccinated for the COVID-19 virus.

Job Summary:
The BDC Capital Women in Technology (WIT) Venture Fund is one of the world's largest venture capital funds dedicated to investing in women-led technology companies. The WIT Fund manages $250 million in capital, which will be deployed through investment and ecosystem development. WIT Fund has a dual 

mandate to deliver a return on the investment and make a lasting impact on the Canadian tech ecosystem. 

  

The WIT Fund invests in women-led tech companies (seed to Series A & B) who bring together the right technology, team and resources to create companies that transform or disrupt today's markets. These are strong, scalable, revenue generating companies who want to grow quickly. The team also works very closely with portfolio companies and use their roles as board members to assist in growing these companies through all stages to successful exits. In addition to direct investment, WIT Fund works with many partners to develop, support and promote a self-sustaining ecosystem for women that provides mentorship, networking, and tools to ensure they thrive. The Fund has offices in Toronto, Montreal, Calgary and Vancouver. 


This is an opportunity for a student with a high willingness to learn and flexible attitude with respect to project work to join the pre-eminent WIT venture fund in Canada.
Job Responsibilities:
The winter intern will join this team of investment professionals at the Toronto office and assist in varied aspects of managing the Fund by supporting the activities of the Partners, Associates and Analysts of the Fund. The candidate will be working on a wide variety of tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment and thus should be eager to learn and willing to wear multiple hats depending on the task at hand. Much of the work is completed independently with some guidance provided by the team. As such the candidate must be resourceful, a problem-solver and highly self-motivated. 


The student will learn a significant amount about the venture capital business, gaining first hand insight into how sophisticated technology companies go from their early stage to an initial public offering or acquisition. The student will gain relevant skills that will be applicable not only to venture capital but also to other roles in finance, investing, consulting and the business-side of the technology industry.
Required Skills:
Excellent communication and written skills
Willingness to learn, take initiative and dive-in on new projects
Open to take direction from team members
Flexible with regard to the wide variety of assigned projects of varying duration
Able to exercise discretion, professionalism and maintain an appropriate level of confidentiality
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks
A strong interest in investing, venture capital, technology and start-ups
A good ability to conduct research in unfamiliar, sometimes abstract areas
A good understanding of finance and the application of financial concepts, with an ability to create financial models.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office suite of applications, specifically with Excel.

Job Summary:
The Health Planner will be responsible for providing support to the senior leadership team (the President, Vice Presidents and Senior Directors) on specific key projects for the organization.  The development of an updated strategic plan (2022 to 2027) will the major work.  The expectation is that the Health Planner will support the development of the strategic plan.  The Health Planner may also support other strategic projects for the senior leadership team - including our work on diversity, equity and inclusion, patient and family engagement, employee engagement and health services planning. 

  

Join a hospital where everyone makes a difference!  Accredited with Exemplary Standing, recently recognized by The Beryl Institute for our commitment to patient experience, nine years of incredibly strong financial and quality performance, a 240,000 sq. ft. new patient care wing opened in January 2020 and with that, a post-construction operating plan to expand services for Cambridge North Dumfries - that is just part of the Cambridge Memorial Hospital (CMH) story!  If you are ready for helping us meet our next challenge and you have a zest to make an impact for a community, this is an opportunity not to pass on. 

  

Cambridge Memorial Hospital is a thriving community hospital that proudly provides acute care services including: Emergency, Surgery, Medicine, Women's and Children's Health, Intensive Care, Mental Health and Inpatient Rehabilitation to the residents of Cambridge, the township of North Dumfries and the Region of Waterloo. 

  

Our vision is to provide exceptional healthcare by exceptional people with an enthusiastic team of clinical, non-clinical and support staff. We are actively recruiting for a co-op student to work with our senior team and organization - someone who is dedicated to the work we do and to enabling our staff to provide outstanding patient-centred care and an exceptional patient experience.
Job Responsibilities:
The expertise of a health planner/facilitator is required to support the development of the strategic plan.  To ensure that the plan has sustainability and currency post completion, a small working group will be established to guide the work of the health planner. 


The following are the draft/potential activities that the health planner/facilitator will support:
 

Reviewing the available background guiding documents to ensure that the next strategic plan build upon the work underway (these documents would include the current strategic plans, the most current annual operating plans, the quality and patient safety plans, the capital redevelopment plans, the enterprise risk management plans and the information technology plans, as available
Conducting 25-30 internal interviews and staff focus groups
Analyzing data related to the clinical services offered by the hospital, utilization data provided by Decision Support and additional available information related to:  current and future population growth, patient care trends, community need, available hospital data and information, as needed
Working with the Board Chair, CEO and other to gather community input through a variety of means (survey, focus groups, one on one interviews of key community leaders)
Creating a current state assessment document
Working with the task force to create the agenda for a retreat session and identify work groups, work to be done, etc. as deemed appropriate
With the support of the task force, arrange for facilitation of a retreat of approximately 50 people
Determining the pre-retreat activities, retreat agendas & outcomes, and post-retreat activities
Create a final draft strategic plan for presentation to the Board based on the work undertaken.

Given the timing of the co-op position, job responsibilities 1 through 6 would be the priority for the January to April 2022 term (start date January 4 2022; end date April 22, 2022)  

  

The Health Planner may also support other strategic projects for the senior leaders.  Strategic work currently includes efforts associated with employee engagement, wellness and well-being; diversity, equity and inclusion; patient and family engagement; and health services planning particularly related to key clinical services planning.
Required Skills:
Required: 

Excellent interpersonal skills 

Excellent writing skills 

Good analytical skills 

Ability to process and synthesize complex data and information 

Able to work without direct supervision

Job Summary:
This position working in collaboration with our Decision Support Analyst and Data Modeller will work with clinical and non-Clinical teams to gather requirements, identify data sources and assess data quality. They will support designing processes to integrate additional data into the data warehouse. They will support ad-hoc and in-depth analysis and the development of dashboards to assist teams with their understanding of challenging issues so they can develop appropriate informed action plans where required. 

  

Join a hospital where everyone makes a difference!  Accredited with Exemplary Standing, recently recognized by The Beryl Institute for our commitment to patient experience, nine years of incredibly strong financial and quality performance, a 240,000 sq. ft. new patient care wing opened in January 2020 and with that, a post-construction operating plan to expand services for Cambridge North Dumfries - that is just part of the Cambridge Memorial Hospital (CMH) story!  If you are ready for helping us meet our next challenge and you have a zest to make an impact for a community, this is an opportunity not to pass on. 

  

Cambridge Memorial Hospital is a thriving community hospital that proudly provides acute care services including: Emergency, Surgery, Medicine, Women's and Children's Health, Intensive Care, Mental Health and Inpatient Rehabilitation to the residents of Cambridge, the township of North Dumfries and the Region of Waterloo. 

  

Our vision is to provide exceptional healthcare by exceptional people with an enthusiastic team of clinical, non-clinical and support staff. We are actively recruiting for a co-op student to work with our senior team and organization - someone who is dedicated to the work we do and to enabling our staff to provide outstanding patient-centered care and an exceptional patient experience.
Job Responsibilities:
The expertise of the decision support specialist will help facilitate evidence based decision making by transforming data into value. The main responsibilities for this role will be: 


1) Support the design and deploy data warehouse, ETL processes, cubes, dashboards, ongoing and ad-hoc reports from multiple datasets 

2) Work collaboratively with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate business needs into BI solutions 

3) Develop and support the web UI for the customers who interact with Decision Support Data 

4) Advance the use of the Scorecards to support corporate and departmental performance and quality measurement, planning and reporting

Job Summary:
Join the Canacre team in an exciting role working on leading edge infrastructure projects.   


Canacre is a professional services company that is a technical expert in land, energy and transportation development delivering accurate, innovative and agile solutions to our partners who strives to foster an environment that promotes inspired and empowered team members who make an impact. We are looking for highly energetic, innovative and driven students who are looking for opportunities to gain valuable work experience, work with a great team, and learn about the wide range of careers we offer. 


We provide land acquisition, geospatial mapping, data management, web-based GIS, community relations, land feasibility studies, and permitting services. Canacre's clients include developers, large scale service providers, and government entities that are involved in the planning and development of energy projects, rights of way, resources, and infrastructure across Canada and the United States. Canacre works on large-scale wind and solar power projects, high-voltage transmission lines, pipeline projects, municipal roads projects, and groupings of cellular towers and rooftop antennas.
Job Responsibilities:
Planning and Permitting:
 

Support the planning, permitting and land acquisition activities at all levels of government and public/private agencies for various infrastructure development, renewable energy, telecommunications, and other rights-of-way projects.
Support the development and update of planning and permitting application deliverables.
Support municipal delegations (to Councils, Boards, Committees, etc.) and public open houses, information sessions, and written forms of consultation with communities according to various processes related to project proposals.
Research and review policies, municipal official plans, zoning by-laws, permitting and procedural by-laws for due diligence and comprehensive understanding of projects at all administrative levels.
Provide GIS and mapping support, as required.

Land Analyst/Land Administration:

 

Review, draft and audit acquisition and acquisition related documents.
Support land records database.
Support the coordination of the Field team to execute agreements.
Support the preparation of documents for the acquisition of lands, right-of-way's, damage settlements, well site, pipeline, utility right-of-way, lease amendments and third-party crossings.
Prepare supporting land documents such as; crossing line list, surface acquisition report, landowner line list, public consultation report and notifications.
Prepare and update status reports to establish accurate and effective communication of project progress.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Able to work effectively in different situations and/or with different people.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Able to organize, set priorities and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced and changing environment.
Strong organizational and time management skills.

Works well under pressure and meeting deadlines.

Job Summary:
CABC Profile 

Since 1983, the Canada Arab Business Council has been the principal advocate for and the driving force behind Canada's growing economic relations with Arab countries in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region. Senior level business professionals representing a range of sectors in Canada along with select former Canadian ambassadors to the region offers members a host of customized services and support to succeed in Canada and the Arab world. 

  

CABC's goals are to:
 

Create greater awareness in Canada and Arab countries of the importance of trade, investment, business and economic relations between our countries.
Promote and facilitate trade, investment and other business opportunities between member companies in Canada and Arab states.
Provide our members with timely insights into relevant economic, social and political developments in Canada and Arab states.
Act as an advocate for government policies that enable Canadian companies to set up business and expand in Arab states, as well as to assist Arab companies interested in entering and expanding in the Canadian market.
Today CABC's corporate members come from Canada's major manufacturing and service sectors and include some of the country's largest companies and institutions, as well as a growing number of small and mid-sized enterprises. In 2016, we opened membership to offshore Arab companies in line with our aim to bring the Canadian and Arab business communities closer together and enrich the dialogue.

For more information, kindly visit our website www.c-abc.ca

Job Summary: The Co-op program at Canada Goose is a great opportunity for students to get the chance to work in an industry related to their field. The Internal Auditor is an exciting role that provides work variety through execution of internal audit activities including operational reviews, enterprise risk management, loss prevention and SOX compliance (covering both business and IT controls). Our work provides team members with an opportunity to be actively mentored, well rounded and uniquely positioned to pursue long-term career paths within Internal Audit, Finance or other departments. The Internal Auditor will be responsible for the planning, execution and reporting of internal audit reviews within the financial, operational, commercial and technology areas of the business.
Job Responsibilities:
Execute internal audit reviews, including developing process documentation (e.g. flow chart, narrative, and risk and control matrix) and audit procedures designed to assess the efficiency and effectiveness of the programs and controls established to mitigate risks
Present the results of internal audit reviews to management, including practical and cost-effective recommendations for issues identified, during closing meetings
Draft internal audit reports/findings for review by the Manager, Senior Manager, and/or Director, Internal Audit
Partner with management to determine appropriate remediation steps and ensure corrective action is carried out
Perform testing on design and operating effectiveness of business and/or IT controls to support Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) Section 404 assessment of compliance including, reporting of audit results and issues, and coordinating the remediation and closing of all identified control gaps though working with management and company personnel to achieve practical compliance solutions
Evaluate control deficiencies, significant deficiencies and/or material weaknesses
Present audit findings to senior management, executives, Internal Controls and external auditors
Maintain effective relationships with the business and provide process improvement recommendations
Other related duties and required or assigned

University student in Business/Accounting
Interest in pursuing the Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA), Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) and/or Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) designations

Advance knowledge of MS Office and Excel
Professional written and verbal communication skills
Able to work well under pressure and meet set deadlines

Job Summary:
Selected candidates will receive one interview for multiple locations and will be able to rank their preferred work location(s) during the interview. Candidates will not be assigned to offices in which they did not express interest during the interview. 


Participating Offices are:

Toronto West Tax Services Office (5800 Hurontario Street, Mississauga, ON, L5R 4B4)
Toronto East Tax Services Office (200 Town Centre Court, Toronto, ON, M1P 4Y3)
Toronto North Tax Services Office (5001 Yonge Street, Toronto, ON, M2N 6R9)
Toronto Centre Tax Services Office (1 Front St. W, Toronto, ON, M5J 2X6)

Audit Job Positions Available:

  1. Income Tax Audit Division, International and Large Business - Auditor Co-op Student 
 
2. Income Tax Audit Division, Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) - Auditor Co-op Student 
 
3. GST/HST Audit Division, GST/HST Tax Auditor/Examiner 
 
4. Scientific Research and Experimental Development - Accounting Student 
 
  


Work Term hours and duration

This position is for full-time student employment (37.5 hours per week) for the duration of the work term. The positions are available for four or eight (4 or 8) month work terms. 


About CRA

The Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) administers tax laws for the Government of Canada and for most provinces and territories, and administers various social and economic benefit and incentive programs delivered through the tax system. The CRA is recognized as managing one of the best tax administrations in the world. 


CRA Mission - What we do

The CRA's mission is to administer tax, benefits, and related programs, and to ensure compliance on behalf of governments across Canada, thereby contributing to the ongoing economic and social well-being of Canadians. 


CRA Vision - The future

The CRA strives to be trusted, fair, and helpful by putting people first. 


Guiding Principles

We are people-centric - We understand people's needs and expectations for better programs and services.
We are supportive - We help people understand and meet their obligations and responsibilities, and use the resources available to them.
We are innovative - We embrace change and approach situations with a sense of curiosity and innovation.
We are one team - We collaborate toward a unified goal of providing successful programs and services for all.
We are fair - Our decisions are grounded in quality information, fairness, integrity and engagement.
Job Responsibilities:
Detailed Job Description and Student's Duties:


1. International and Large Business Income Tax Audit Division - Auditor Co-op Student

Participating location: Toronto West, Toronto East, Toronto North 

Job Description

Students will be working as an Auditor Co-op Student in the International and Large Business Income Tax Audit division. Students will assist the audit team to audit Income Tax returns of highly complex large corporations to ensure compliance with the statutes administered by the CRA. 


Student Duties

Understand and apply legislation from the Income Tax Act to identify non-compliance issues to ensure taxpayer compliance with federal, provincial, and territorial tax laws.
Assistance in specific projects and assignments within the Compliance Management Team, including research, data management and manipulation and various other tasks as identified.
Assist with ongoing tax compliance audits. Tasks may include: analysis and interpretation of financial statements, tax returns and accounting applications to identify risks to ensure compliance; preparation of audit working papers, reports, schedules and assisting in audit and analysis work, and identification and evaluation of audit evidence in support of recommendations for audit action or referral to ensure compliance.
Assist Managers in strategic planning, employee work management, staff engagement and learning activities.


2. Income Tax Audit Division, Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) Auditor Coop Student

Participating location: Toronto West, Toronto East, Toronto North, Toronto Centre 

Job Description

Students will be working as Income Tax Auditor Trainee in the Small Medium Enterprise tax compliance program of the Income Tax Audit division. Students will be assisting with tax audit to monitor and maintain the self-assessment system. Tax audits play an important role in the achievement of the objectives of the Department which are to collect the taxes imposed by the law through the encouragement of voluntary compliance and to maintain public confidence in the integrity of the tax system. 


Student Duties

Assistance in completion of audits/review of returns ensuring compliance with the provisions of statutes administered by CRA.
Assistance in review of taxpayers' returns, books, records, accounts, requests, and supporting documents to verify, confirm, and enforce compliance with the statutes administered by the CRA or resolve enquiries.
Duties may include a wide variety of tasks to support the audit function. Students will utilize their analytical, problem solving and organizational skills to assist in audits.
The student must be able to apply a significant degree of judgment, assimilating a large amount of information from returns, other internal and external sources in order to make an immediate decision whether further review is warranted.
Communication Skills- Communicate in person, by telephone, or in writing with the team leader, and the audit mentor: this might involve the drafting of audit letters, query sheets and preparing interview questions.


3. GST/HST Audit Division, GST/HST Tax Auditor/Examiner

Participating location: Toronto West, Toronto East, Toronto North, Toronto Centre 

Job Description

The GST/HST Audit Division of the CRA conducts audits and reviews of GST/HST returns to ensure compliance to the statutes prescribed by the Excise Tax Act (ETA). Students in the refund integrity program will conduct examinations of GST/HST returns for registrants located anywhere in Canada to identify errors or evidence of non-compliance. Students in the Small and Medium audit program will conduct elements of audits on small and medium enterprises to identify and address evidence of non-compliance. 


Student Duties

Contact registrants to obtain various documentation in support of the GST/HST returns filed
Review registrant's returns, books, records, and supporting documentation to ensure compliance with the ETA
Conduct research of relevant tax statutes prescribed by the ETA
Prepare working papers, letters and reports to support work completed for the examination or audit decision
Work in a team environment in order to achieve set results
Other duties as identified

4.Appeals Division ? Appeals Co-op Student 
Job Description

The Appeals Division provides taxpayers with an impartial review of their audit results by processing Objections.  As an Appeals Clerk students will support the Appeals Division by assisting throughout the objection process.   Students will have the opportunity to work directly with an Appeals Officer on researching and resolution of objection workload.  This is an integral role, as the responsibilities include the intake of Appeals workload, the handling of taxpayer enquiries, liaising with other Departments and Divisions, and management of completed workload.
 
Student Duties
 -Assist the Appeals Officers in all facets of their duties.
-Provide guidance and assistance to Taxpayers and/or Representatives on the Appeals Enquiry line.
-Gathers and analyses all available information in order to assist Appeals Officers in the resolution of issues under objection.  Provide input that will assist in the     preliminary analysis of files.
-Researches and interprets the provisions of applicable legislation and regulations, policies, directives and jurisprudence.
-As experienced is gained and based on job performance, there may be opportunities to work on Project workload.
-Produces detailed reports and other documents.
-Updates local procedural protocol documents.  Utilization of effective interactive communication skills via presentations to educate Division staff.
-Cooperates with representatives of the Department of Justice and Litigation.
-Processes requests for access to documents and requests for access to information presented under the Access to Information Act and the Privacy Act.

-Participation in committees, along with presentations made to represent the Appeals Division.

As a Full Stack Developer/programmer, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility.

- Meet with the development team for sprint and scrum planning 

- Work on programming / software development projects 

- Log and adhere to tasks using Jiro 

- Working on projects such as Websites, Applications, Mobile, Virtual Reality, Cryptos, etc.  

- Working in development teams

Job Summary: Do you have a passion for working on electrical, software, mechanical and robotics projects?  Do you like having an impact by working on a small team developing unique leading-edge technologies for space and terrestrial applications?  If so, we may have some interesting opportunities for you!  We are currently looking for an engineering intern to work alongside our staff members on a variety of interesting projects.
Job Responsibilities:
As an integrated member of the team, your contribution will have a direct impact on various systems for orbital, near Earth, and deep space applications with a focus on space exploration as well as spin-off technology for terrestrial applications.  


The main responsibilities for this role include:
 

Assembling mechanical and electrical assemblies.
Designing and 3D printing prototype parts for various experiments.
Prototyping electronic circuits and writing firmware in support of test campaigns.
Sourcing materials for prototypes and experiments.
Learning and following industry procedures for preparing flight units (working in a laminar flow chamber, staking components, soldering, microscope inspection, ultrasonic cleaning, harness lacing, etc?).
Running product test campaigns in-house as well as supporting 3rd party testing (cryogenic temperature cycling, thermal vacuum, vibration, electromagnetic compatibility, radiation).
Performing detailed experiments and documenting results.
Setting up new facilities / lab equipment.
Required Skills:
The following skills would be preferred for this role:
 

Hands-on experience in electronics, mechatronics, mechanical engineering or similar fields.
Previous experience with firmware development of applications using embedded platforms (e.g. Raspberry Pi, Beagle Bone, Arduino).
Soldering, PCB assembly, wiring harnesses
Mechanical assembly
CAD modelling, 3D printing
C / Python programming experience
Good communication and writing skills

				- Theme - Computing: Software

				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
