Division: Information Management and Information Technology Branch
Job Summary:
An opportunity for an Analyst exists within the Architecture and IT Security team of the Innovation, Business and Service Development Branch of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency. CFIA is the federal agency responsible for overseeing the safety of Canada's food supply and the protection of our animal health and plant resource base. 


The Agency is in the process of transformation including modernization of many of the Agency application systems, moving key business processes off old legacy systems and onto new cloud technology platforms. This involves integration of systems and data flows between a mix of systems and environments, and it requires implementation of a variety of tools and processes to support, monitor and manage the environments and systems. 


The successful candidate will work with members of the assigned project team to conduct analysis and develop assigned deliverables.  The candidate may design, configure, develop and document specific solution components and deliverables.  The candidate may also conduct analysis, modelling and documentation of business processes, data and solution options.  The candidate may also support the team in the configuration, implementation and management of supporting products and development of associated deliverables (e.g., process documentation, operational reports). 


The successful candidate will have the opportunity to gain experience with a variety of tools; such as Microsoft 365 for collaborative work, Microsoft Power BI for data visualization, Microsoft Azure analytics and data processing tools, relational database products such as Oracle and SQL Server, and an Enterprise Architecture tool used to create models and conduct analysis of Agency business processes, systems, and data.
Job Responsibilities:
Job responsibilities may include:
 

Develop data engineering processes for analysis and transformation of data from various sources.
Develop scripts to automate specific requirements such as automated system configuration and monitoring, data analysis, and generation of reports/diagrams.
Develop code for web services, messaging, web service integration and orchestration.
Design models and supporting documentation of Agency business processes, data, application systems, and technology environments.
Perform analysis and assessment of Agency data and application systems, including solution option identification and analysis.
Develop and document business processes and associated operating procedures.
Develop, or assist in the development of, project and/or architecture deliverables, reports and presentations.
Other assigned tasks based on current Agency priorities.
Required Skills:
- Good oral and written communication. 

- Ability to work independently and as a member of a team. 

- Analytical ability and problem-solving skills. 

- Attention to detail.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Project and Process Management
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Job Description 

What you'll be doing 

Our Finance Student Program is designed to offer great work experience to compliment your classroom training and career goals. We are devoted to finding, selecting and training students who will make a positive impact on our company. The Finance Student Program activities allow you an opportunity to meet and network with company executives, employees, and fellow interns, as well as learn more about banking and the financial industry. Interns are assigned to a CIBC Finance team for the co-op term, and placement decisions are based on interests, skills, and position availability. Throughout the term, interns are provided with direction, coaching and mentoring so they may perform at their personal best. 

Specific internship responsibilities determined closer to start date and depend on the needs of the hiring department. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: 

Learning the basics of Finance including analytics, research and portfolio management 

Learning the basics of the industry that your team manager covers 

Listening to and summarizing earnings conference calls of public companies. 

Learning how to use  latest industry financial tools 

Important Information 

You must be currently enrolled in post-secondary education to be eligible, however, you do not need to be in a registered Co-Op program to be considered for this role

You have a strong knowledge of MS Office - Word, Excel, PowerPoint

Job Summary:
We're building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what's right for our clients. 

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. 

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com 

Job Description 

What you'll be doing 

CIBC's Technology, Infrastructure & Innovation team is hiring for Fall Co-Ops! We have a number of opportunities available in Analytical roles across Digital Analytics & Integration, Product Strategy, Business Management, Advanced Analytics teams and more! This is a great opportunity to be a part of highly collaborative, agile team-based environment, solving problems to create meaningful change across the enterprise. Join our team and stretch your innovative thinking skills to help enhance the banking experience for the modern world.   

How you'll succeed 

Innovation: You'll identify and size innovative opportunities with business partners to find the right solutions for our clients 

Simplification: You'll spend time simplifying complex processes, ideas and concepts for key stakeholders through data analysis, verbal and written presentations 

Teamwork: You'll creatively work in a team to visualize and design a possible new product or service and to assess the market, business and technical merits of that concept 

Communication: You'll use your excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve evaluation, interpretation, and assessment. 

Change Agent: You will be expected to participate in concept development, facilitate, solicit, promote, and assess ideas and recommendations on an ongoing basis from business and technology partners, and be a champion for innovation across the bank. 

Accuracy- You'll be reviewing processes and ensuring that the identified activities are followed in an accurate and precise manner 

Detail - You'll use your skills to gather, clarify and apply information provided accurately and your critical thinking skills help you inform your decision making. 

Who you are 

Data Analytics: You have the technical skills to review and evaluate data to find innovative opportunities and share with partners. You have experience in the MS Office and other tools required to review and present your findings. 

Problem Solving: You enjoy being presented with problems or issues and working with a team to find innovative solutions 

Inspired: Your passionate about growing your knowledge and you know there is no limit to what you can achieve 

Teamwork: You care about people and understand different perspectives. You work well with others and learn from the experiences of others. 

Creative: You are curious and enjoy working in a team to visualize and design a possible new product or service and to assess the market, business and technical merits of that concept 

Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork and accountability

everyone's unique talents, and empowers teams to do what's right for the client, and to do it well. As part of

Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

Job Summary:
We're building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what's right for our clients.

Job Description 

What you'll be doing 

As a Corporate Security Coordinator Co-op, you will join CIBC's Corporate Security Awareness & Education team. You will assist in providing proactive security education to employees through presentations and communications. Subject areas include but are not limited to: investigations and fraud; executive and employee protection; business continuity and incident management; security intelligence; insider threat and employee monitoring; robbery and crime prevention; threat and risk assessments; physical security; background screening; current events and business impact from a security standpoint.
Job Responsibilities:
How you'll succeed 

As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to: 

Provide continuity and enhancement for education and awareness initiatives, leading up to and during the move-in to Tower 1 of CIBC Square and other CIBC premises 

Contribute to CIBC projects related to communications, training, awareness and education

Network and participate in other areas of Corporate Security and CIBC 

Network and build relationships within the financial and security industries

Job Summary:
We're building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what's right for our clients. 

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. 

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com 

Job Description 

What you'll be doing 

As a Data Scientist you will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve challenging business problems and bringing innovative solutions. You'll interact with groups across the organization from client facing to operational, risk and capital markets. You'll work with real world structured and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. We collaborate with the most exciting new companies in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage in teamwork with leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent.
Job Responsibilities:
How you'll succeed 

Data: You'll extract, explore, and wrangle data from various sources/formats to appropriately prepare it for further study 

Problem solving: You'll apply business-relevant statistical, machine learning, or deep learning approaches to solve business challenges  

Programming: You'll have an opportunity to program data science applications that directly solve business challenges, considering infrastructure and end-use constraints  

Deployment: You'll assist with the deployment of end-to-end data science applications  

Who you are 

Developer: You have some experience coding with at least one scripting language, e.g. python and a statistical/analytics software tool such as R 

Data analytics: You have the technical skills to review and evaluate data to find innovative opportunities and share with partners 

Problem Solving: You enjoy being presented with problems or issues and working with a team to find innovative solutions 

Communication:  You have excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve reserch, interpretation, and assessment.

Creativity: You are curious and enjoy working in a team to visualize and design innovative solutions 

Inspired: Your passionate about growing your knowledge and you know there is no limit to what you can achieve 

Teamwork: You care about people and understand different perspectives. You work well with others and learn from the experiences of others. 

Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork and accountability

Job Summary:
We're building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what's right for our clients. 

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. 

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com 

Job Description 

What you'll be doing 

CIBC's Security Operations Centre (SOC) manages the life cycle of Information Security. As a Co-op in this department, you'll assist with ensuring that vulnerabilities within CIBC's environment are being identified, tracked, and remediated, triaging information security alerts, monitoring security events, and investigations for potential security incidents by performing research activities.  You will escalate events of interest to senior level investigators when appropriate, and provide assistance where required to the investigations team.
Job Responsibilities:
How you'll succeed 

Incident Response - You will assist in the planning, coordination, and execution of incident response and containment activities 

Investigation Support - investigate information security events for potential security incidents.  Provide support of information security and privacy incidents which may have potential impact to the organization. 

Security Technology/Process Support - Develop an understanding of security threats, provide triage process support to the review of security events. Highlight repeatable gaps and suggest areas of improvement (if necessary) as supported by management direction. 

Information Case Management -Maintaining investigation activities and outcomes in the case management software.  

Who you are 

Cyber Security: You have an interest in the various aspects of cyber security and risk 

Problem Solving: You enjoy being presented with problems or issues and working with a team to find innovative solutions 

Communication: You have excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment. 

Data analytics: You have the technical skills to review and evaluate data to find innovative opportunities and share with partners 

Organization: Your time management skills are strong and you are able to prioritize competing priorities to ensure successful outcomes. 

Creativity: You are curious and enjoy working in a team to visualize and design innovative solutions 

Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork and accountability
